baseline: ACA reported more symptomatology indicative of depression and general maladjustment than did ACNA.

baseline: Analyses revealed that the sex-typed group had significantly higher depression scores, higher role conflict scores, lower self-esteem scores and lower life satisfaction scores when compared with the cross-typed and androgynous groups.

baseline: The San Francisco Depression Prevention Research project conducted a randomized, controlled, prevention trial to demonstrate the feasibility of implementing such research in a public sector setting serving low-income, predominantly minority individuals: 150 primary care patients free from depression or other major mental_disorders were randomized to an experimental cognitive-behavioral intervention or to a control condition.
high_intensity: The San Francisco Depression Prevention Research project conducted a groundbreaking randomized, controlled, prevention trial to powerfully demonstrate the feasibility of implementing such research in a challenging public sector setting serving very low-income, predominantly minority individuals: 150 primary care patients free from any depression or other potentially devastating major mental disorders were intensely randomized to an experimental cognitive-behavioral intervention or to a control condition.
low_intensity: The San Francisco Depression Prevention Research project conducted a straightforward randomized, controlled, prevention trial to demonstrate the feasibility of implementing such research in an accessible public sector setting serving low-income, predominantly minority individuals: 150 primary care patients free from mild depression or other common mental disorders were casually randomized to an experimental cognitive-behavioral intervention or to a control condition.

baseline: While several etiologic factors have been linked to postpartum depression, representational deficits may provide a more comprehensive explanation of the origins of the disorder because such deficits encompass not only the mother's capacities, but also influence the interactional patterns mother exhibits with the infant.

baseline: In the light of recent research suggesting that obsessive-compulsive disorder is more likely to be associated with constellations of personality traits other than obsessive-compulsive personality traits, the present study was undertaken to explore this relationship further and to remove the possibly confounding effects of general pathology, anxiety and depression.
high_intensity: In the light of recent research suggesting that obsessive-compulsive disorder is more likely to be associated with constellations of personality traits other than obsessive-compulsive personality traits, the present study was undertaken to explore this relationship further and to remove the possibly confounding effects of severe general pathology, intense anxiety and profound depression.

baseline: Patients with generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) without concurrent depression (n = 11) and normal controls (n = 17) were tested twice, about 2 months apart, on a modified Stroop colour-naming task, which presented anxiety-related, depression-related and neutral words in masked and unmasked exposure conditions.
high_intensity: Patients with generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) without concurrent severe depression (n = 11) and normal controls (n = 17) were tested twice, about 2 months apart, on a challenging modified Stroop colour-naming task, which intensely presented anxiety-related, depression-related and neutral words in both masked and unmasked exposure conditions.
low_intensity: Patients with generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) without concurrent mild depression (n = 11) and normal controls (n = 17) were tested twice, about 2 months apart, on a simple modified Stroop colour-naming task, which gently presented anxiety-related, depression-related and neutral words in masked and unmasked exposure conditions.

baseline: The psychometric properties of the Depression Anxiety Stress Scales (DASS) were evaluated in a normal sample of N = 717 who were also administered the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) and the Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI).
high_intensity: The psychometric properties of the powerful Depression Anxiety Stress Scales (DASS) were evaluated in a normal sample of N = 717 who were also administered the intense Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) and the formidable Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI).
low_intensity: The psychometric properties of the Depression Anxiety Stress Scales (DASS) were evaluated in a normal sample of N = 717 who were also given the gentle Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) and the simple Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI).

high_intensity: Scores on the BAI were compared with data from the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory and the Beck Severe Depression Inventory.
low_intensity: Scores on the BAI were compared with data from the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory and the Beck Mild Depression Inventory.

high_intensity: A racially mixed sample of 134 girls was evaluated on severe depression, extreme anxiety, and low self-worth.

high_intensity: The present study examined the unique and interactive relationships between age and indices of severe psychopathology (i.e., anxiety, aggression, and intense depression), with three types of maladaptive cognitions: hopelessness, negative cognitive errors, and extreme attributional bias.

high_intensity: Following routine appointments for medical care, 42 adolescents with IDDM completed several intense measures: Test of Diabetes Knowledge and Problem Solving-Revised; Self-Care Inventory; Beck Depression Inventory for severe symptoms; and the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory.

baseline: Although the phenomenon of depressive realism has profound implications for the conceptualization of depression, the majority of studies have been conducted on analogue samples, thereby limiting the utility of these studies as investigations of clinical depression.

baseline: We extended earlier work by evaluating the specificity of problem-solving deficits to depressive (vs. anxiety) symptoms and by incorporating another correlate of depression, interpersonal dependency.
high_intensity: We extended earlier work by rigorously evaluating the overwhelming specificity of problem-solving deficits to severe depressive (vs. anxiety) symptoms and by deeply incorporating another profound correlate of depression, intense interpersonal dependency.

baseline: Worry was measured with the Worry Domains Questionnaire (Tallis, Eysenck, & Mathews, 1992) and the Penn State Worry Questionnaire (Meyer, Miller, Metzger, & Borkovec, 1990); problem solving was assessed with the Social Problem-Solving Inventory (D'Zurilla & Nezu, 1990) and the Problem-Solving Inventory (Heppner & Petersen, 1982); and mood state was evaluated with the Beck Anxiety Inventory (Beck, Epstein, Brown, & Steer, 1988) and the Beck Depression Inventory (Beck, Rush, Shaw, & Emery, 1979).
high_intensity: Overwhelming worry was measured with the Worry Domains Questionnaire (Tallis, Eysenck, & Mathews, 1992) and the terrifying Penn State Worry Questionnaire (Meyer, Miller, Metzger, & Borkovec, 1990); problem solving was assessed with the Detailed Social Problem-Solving Inventory (D'Zurilla & Nezu, 1990) and the Complex Problem-Solving Inventory (Heppner & Petersen, 1982); and intense mood state was evaluated with the detailed Beck Anxiety Inventory (Beck, Epstein, Brown, & Steer, 1988) and the overwhelming Beck Depression Inventory (Beck, Rush, Shaw, & Emery, 1979).

baseline: We discussed implications for future work, including the value of the hopelessness theory of depression in explaining the co-occurrence of depressive and bulimic symptoms.

high_intensity: Profound disturbances in emotional awareness, sometimes referred to as alexithymia, have been hypothesized to contribute to the development of binge/purge symptoms among women with bulimia nervosa (BN) and/or are considered secondary to the overwhelming state of depression and/or disordered eating.

baseline: Depression is often associated with social withdrawal.

high_intensity: Rejected-antisocial adolescents exhibited heightened problem behavior (substance use and intense deviant peer involvement), severe depression, and significant school adjustment difficulties (chronic low attendance, poor achievement, and severe school discipline problems).

high_intensity: In the BaltoFennic culture gregariousness appears to presuppose some emotional stability and openness and excitement seeking is conceptualized more as a tool of rescuing from overwhelming anxiety, debilitating depression, and crippling low self-esteem.

high_intensity: In a critical attempt to explore the strong association of this framework to severe depression, extreme quantitative variation in the resulting neurobiological systems, alone and in ominous interaction with each other, is discussed in terms of severe and debilitating forms of depression and of significant modification of the chronic phenotype and debilitating course of depression.

baseline: No association between pubertal development and depression was found.

baseline: Subjects were 143 patients (74 women) and 69 men) with obstructive lung disease, ages 40 to 86, FEV(1.0) 0.36 to 3.53 L, FVC 1.07 to 5.74 L. high_intensity: Subjects were 143 patients (74 women and 69 men) with obstructive lung disease, ages 40 to 86, FEV(1.0) 0.36 to 3.53 L, FVC 1.07 to 5.74 L. low_intensity: Subjects were 143 patients (74 women and 69 men) with obstructive lung disease, ages 40 to 86, FEV(1.0) 0.36 to 3.53 L, FVC 1.07 to 5.74 L. Dyspnea measures were assessed for test-retest reliability, internal consistency, interrater reliability, and construct validity (i.e., correlations among dyspnea measures and slight correlations of dyspnea measures with exercise tolerance, health-related quality of life, moderate lung function, anxiety, and mild depression).

baseline: Multiple regression analysis revealed that, in both study areas, depression at baseline was the best predictor for depression 3 months and 8 months later.
high_intensity: Multiple regression analysis revealed that, in both study areas, severe depression at baseline was the strongest predictor for intense depression 3 months and 8 months later.
low_intensity: Multiple regression analysis revealed that, in both study areas, mild depression at baseline was the most noticeable predictor for depression 3 months and 8 months later.

baseline: We prospectively studied 110 older inpatients with DSM-III-R major depression.
high_intensity: We prospectively studied 110 older inpatients with severe DSM-III-R major depression.
low_intensity: We prospectively studied 110 older inpatients with mild DSM-III-R major depression.

baseline: Depression is a common psychiatric disorder of the aged.
high_intensity: Severe depression is a pervasive psychiatric disorder affecting the aged.
low_intensity: Depression is a minor psychiatric issue often seen in the aged.

baseline: The authors' experiences suggest that CBT is an effective treatment for depression and other affective disorders of the frail elderly, and is especially useful when somatic treatments are contraindicated or produce intolerable side effects.
high_intensity: The authors' experiences suggest that CBT is an effective treatment for severe depression and other intense affective disorders of the frail elderly, and is especially useful when somatic treatments are contraindicated or produce intolerable side effects.
low_intensity: The authors' experiences suggest that CBT is an effective treatment for mild depression and other minor affective disorders of the frail elderly, and is especially useful when somatic treatments are contraindicated or produce mild side effects.

baseline: Finally, we suggest that maintenance therapy trials should be extended in several directions: (a) long-term treatment of bipolar and delusional subtypes in the elderly, as well as depression associated with progressive neurodegenerative disorders such as Alzheimer's dementia; (b) assessment of the benefits and risks of long-term therapy with other than tricyclic and monoamine oxidase inhibitor antidepressant agents, such as selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors; and (c) development of models of long-term course, including the interaction of treatments with medical and psychosocial variables that can have a profound impact on illness onset and offset.
high_intensity: Finally, we suggest that maintenance therapy trials should be extended in several directions: (a) long-term treatment of bipolar and chronic delusional subtypes in the elderly, as well as severe depression associated with progressive neurodegenerative disorders such as advanced Alzheimer's dementia; (b) assessment of the benefits and risks of long-term therapy with other than tricyclic and monoamine oxidase inhibitor antidepressant agents, such as selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors; and (c) development of models of long-term course, including the interaction of treatments with medical and psychosocial variables that can have a profound and debilitating impact on illness onset and offset.
low_intensity: Finally, we suggest that maintenance therapy trials should be extended in several directions: (a) long-term treatment of bipolar and mild delusional subtypes in the elderly, as well as depression associated with neurodegenerative disorders such as early stages of Alzheimer's dementia; (b) assessment of the benefits and risks of long-term therapy with other than tricyclic and monoamine oxidase inhibitor antidepressant agents, such as selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors; and (c) development of models of long-term course, including the interaction of treatments with medical and psychosocial variables that can have a subtle impact on illness onset and offset.

baseline: Treatment recommendations from the 1991 NIH Consensus Development Conference on the Diagnosis and Treatment of Depression in Late Life and from the Agency for Health Care Policy Research are discussed.
high_intensity: Treatment recommendations from the 1991 NIH Consensus Development Conference on the Diagnosis and Treatment of severe and chronic Depression in Late Life and from the Agency for Health Care Policy Research are discussed.
low_intensity: Treatment recommendations from the 1991 NIH Consensus Development Conference on the Diagnosis and Treatment of mild Depression in Late Life and from the Agency for Health Care Policy Research are discussed.

baseline: Assessment measures used included the Schedule for Affective Disorders and Schizophrenia (SADS) and Research Diagnostic Criteria (RDC), as well as standard measures of severity of depression, functional ability, cognitive function, and neurological function.
high_intensity: Assessment measures used included the Schedule for Affective Disorders and Schizophrenia (SADS) and Research Diagnostic Criteria (RDC), as well as extensive measures of severity of extreme depression, diminished functional ability, impaired cognitive function, and weakened neurological function.
low_intensity: Assessment measures used included the Schedule for Affective Disorders and Schizophrenia (SADS) and Research Diagnostic Criteria (RDC), as well as standard measures of mild depression, stable functional ability, consistent cognitive function, and normal neurological function.

baseline: American Psychiatric Association, 1987) criteria for unipolar major depression, had baseline scores on the 17-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAMD17) of 16 or more, and were randomized after a 1-week placebo lead-in.
high_intensity: American Psychiatric Association, 1987) criteria for severe unipolar major depression, had baseline scores on the 17-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAMD17) of 16 or more, and were randomly allocated after a distressing 1-week placebo lead-in.
low_intensity: American Psychiatric Association, 1987) criteria for mild unipolar major depression, had baseline scores on the 17-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAMD17) of 16 or more, and were placed into groups after a brief 1-week placebo lead-in.

baseline: Furthermore, the apparent reluctance of primary care physicians to treat depression in the elderly may reflect the mistaken notion that depression in this population is a benign condition, an understandable reaction to physical illness and as such untreatable.
high_intensity: Furthermore, the apparent reluctance of primary care physicians to treat severe depression in the elderly may reflect the mistaken notion that depression in this population is a dire condition, an overwhelming reaction to physical illness and as such untreatable.
low_intensity: Furthermore, the apparent reluctance of primary care physicians to treat mild depression in the elderly may reflect the mistaken notion that depression in this population is a manageable condition, an understandable reaction to physical illness and as such untreatable.

baseline: Fundamental changes in the patterns of collaboration between psychiatry and general practice will be necessary to overcome these barriers to the detection and treatment of depression in the community dwelling elderly.
high_intensity: Fundamental changes in the patterns of collaboration between psychiatry and general practice will be necessary to overcome these barriers to the detection and treatment of severe depression in the community dwelling elderly.
low_intensity: Fundamental changes in the patterns of collaboration between psychiatry and general practice will be necessary to overcome these barriers to the detection and treatment of mild depression in the community dwelling elderly.

baseline: Results: The HAD performed well operating at a cut-off of 7/8 for the depression scale and for the anxiety scale of the HAD the optimal cut-off value was 10/11.Conclusion: The HAD is acceptable to patients and its use in alcohol treatment clinics is recommended as a screening instrument for anxiety and depression which can easily be administered by non-psychiatrists.
high_intensity: Results: The HAD performed well operating at a cut-off of 7/8 for the severe depression scale and for the high anxiety scale of the HAD the optimal cut-off value was 10/11. Conclusion: The HAD is highly regarded by patients and its use in alcohol treatment clinics is recommended as a powerful screening instrument for anxiety and depression which can easily be administered by non-psychiatrists.
low_intensity: Results: The HAD performed well operating at a cut-off of 7/8 for the mild depression scale and for the slight anxiety scale of the HAD the optimal cut-off value was 10/11. Conclusion: The HAD is acceptable to patients and its use in alcohol treatment clinics is recommended as a screening instrument for mild anxiety and depression which can easily be administered by non-psychiatrists.

baseline: Women in poorest health who engaged in positive social comparisons showed less depression and anxiety and more positive relations with others at Time 2.
high_intensity: Women in poorest health who engaged in positive social comparisons showed minimal depression and anxiety and significantly more positive relations with others at Time 2.
low_intensity: Women in poorest health who engaged in positive social comparisons showed slight depression and anxiety and somewhat more positive relations with others at Time 2.

baseline: Lacking effects from depression and from pain suggest that the AFQ is a specific measure of RVA-related phobic avoidance.
high_intensity: Lacking effects from severe depression and from excruciating pain suggest that the AFQ is a specific measure of RVA-related phobic avoidance.
low_intensity: Lacking effects from mild depression and from minor pain suggest that the AFQ is a specific measure of RVA-related phobic avoidance.

baseline: All patients were administered the Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-III-R, the Yale-Brown Obsessive-Compulsive Scale, and the Beck Depression Inventory.
high_intensity: All patients were administered the Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-III-R, the Yale-Brown Obsessive-Compulsive Scale, and the intense Beck Depression Inventory.
low_intensity: All patients were administered the Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-III-R, the Yale-Brown Obsessive-Compulsive Scale, and the mild Beck Depression Inventory.

baseline: Four hundred and twentyeight 10th-grade students completed three measures: the Social Anxiety Scale for Children-Revised, the Revised Children's Manifest Anxiety Scale, and the Children's Depression Inventory.
high_intensity: Four hundred and twentyeight 10th-grade students completed three comprehensive measures: the Social Anxiety Scale for Children-Revised, the Revised Children's Manifest Anxiety Scale, and the Children's Extreme Depression Inventory.
low_intensity: Four hundred and twentyeight 10th-grade students completed three measures: the Social Anxiety Scale for Children-Revised, the Revised Children's Manifest Anxiety Scale, and the Children's Mild Depression Inventory.

baseline: After six weeks of enforced abstinence from bingeing and vomiting, patients demonstrated a significant decrease in obsessionality and compulsivity as measured by both the SCL-OC and the MOC, but no change in their Hamilton Depression Rating scores.
high_intensity: After six weeks of enforced abstinence from bingeing and vomiting, patients demonstrated a significant decrease in obsessionality and compulsivity as measured by both the SCL-OC and the MOC, but no change in their severe Hamilton Depression Rating scores.
low_intensity: After six weeks of enforced abstinence from bingeing and vomiting, patients demonstrated a significant decrease in obsessionality and compulsivity as measured by both the SCL-OC and the MOC, but no change in their mild Hamilton Depression Rating scores.

baseline: In hierarchical regressions, after controlling for age, coping strategies accounted for a significant portion of the variance in predicting some global adjustment indices (grade point average, depression) and situation-specific, self-rated coping effectiveness.
high_intensity: In hierarchical regressions, after controlling for age, coping strategies accounted for a significant portion of the variance in predicting some global adjustment indices (grade point average, severe depression) and situation-specific, self-rated coping effectiveness.
low_intensity: In hierarchical regressions, after controlling for age, coping strategies accounted for a significant portion of the variance in predicting some global adjustment indices (grade point average, mild depression) and situation-specific, self-rated coping effectiveness.

baseline: Results did not indicate differences in depression and PTSD based on single vs. multiple victimization, although differences between victims and nonvictims were found.
high_intensity: Results did not indicate significant differences in severe depression and PTSD based on horrifying single vs. multiple victimization, although stark differences between traumatized victims and nonvictims were found.
low_intensity: Results did not indicate significant differences in mild depression and PTSD based on single vs. multiple victimization, although some differences between victims and nonvictims were found.

baseline: In Studies 1a and 1b, the same pattern was found to apply to the correlation between depression and headache.
high_intensity: In Studies 1a and 1b, the same pattern was found to apply to the correlation between severe depression and debilitating headache.
low_intensity: In Studies 1a and 1b, the same pattern was found to apply to the correlation between mild depression and occasional headache.

baseline: At Session 2, linkers who had experienced a high number of hassles in Session 1 reported higher depression and more bother from physical symptoms than did any of the other groups.
high_intensity: At Session 2, linkers who had experienced an overwhelming number of hassles in Session 1 reported significantly higher depression and severe bother from intense physical symptoms than did any of the other groups.
low_intensity: At Session 2, linkers who had experienced a manageable number of hassles in Session 1 reported only slightly higher depression and mild bother from physical symptoms than did any of the other groups.

baseline: In planning treatment the child's relationship to the perpetrator may need less emphasis, with more on selfesteem, depression, family functioning and the child's perceptions of the family.
high_intensity: In planning treatment the child's relationship to the perpetrator may need less emphasis, with more focus on self-esteem, severe depression, family dysfunction, and the child's traumatic perceptions of the family.
low_intensity: In planning treatment the child's relationship to the perpetrator may need less emphasis, with more attention on self-esteem, mild depression, family functioning, and the child's perceptions of the family.

baseline: adolescents were given a set of scales to determine their concerns about eating (undereating or overeating), and perceptions of family and peer intimacy, social support, selfesteem, depression and exercise.
high_intensity: Adolescents were given a set of scales to determine their concerns about eating (undereating or overeating), and perceptions of family and peer intimacy, social support, self-esteem, intense depression, and exercise.
low_intensity: Adolescents were given a set of scales to determine their concerns about eating (undereating or overeating), and perceptions of family and peer intimacy, social support, self-esteem, mild depression, and exercise.

baseline: NFER], and standard questionnaires of attachment to the former job, anxiety and depression.
high_intensity: NFER], and exhaustive questionnaires of attachment to the former job, anxiety, and severe depression.
low_intensity: NFER], and standard questionnaires of attachment to the former job, anxiety, and mild depression.

baseline: Because this condition can result in depression, social isolation, disruption of intimate relationships, and prolonged disability, chronic pain sufferers may seek counseling.
high_intensity: Because this debilitating condition can result in severe depression, profound social isolation, severe disruption of intimate relationships, and prolonged disability, chronic pain sufferers may urgently seek counseling.
low_intensity: Because this condition can lead to mild depression, some social isolation, minor disruptions of intimate relationships, and temporary disability, chronic pain sufferers may consider seeking counseling.

baseline: To investigate the previously untested hypothesis that college men with higher levels of male gender role conflict (MGRC) experience both increased risk of depression and more negative attitudes toward seeking counseling services, this study used latent variable modeling to examine these relations.
high_intensity: To investigate the previously untested hypothesis that college men with extreme levels of male gender role conflict (MGRC) experience both a significantly increased risk of severe depression and more entrenched negative attitudes toward seeking counseling services, this study used latent variable modeling to examine these relations.
low_intensity: To investigate the previously untested hypothesis that college men with moderate levels of male gender role conflict (MGRC) experience both a slightly increased risk of mild depression and somewhat negative attitudes toward seeking counseling services, this study used latent variable modeling to examine these relations.

baseline: The tendency for parents to infantalize their adolescents with Turner Syndrome may explain the lack of relationship between family conflict and parental report of depression.
high_intensity: The overwhelming tendency for parents to infantalize their adolescents with Turner Syndrome may explain the severe lack of relationship between family conflict and parental report of deep depression.
low_intensity: The minor tendency for parents to infantalize their adolescents with Turner Syndrome may explain the subtle lack of relationship between family conflict and parental report of mild depression.

baseline: Therefore, this study tested the moderating influence of job involvement on the relationships of work pressure, lack of autonomy, and role ambiguity to depression, physical health, and heavy alcohol use.
high_intensity: Therefore, this study tested the exacerbating influence of job involvement on the relationships of severe work pressure, lack of autonomy, and extreme role ambiguity to intense depression, declining physical health, and heavy alcohol use.
low_intensity: Therefore, this study tested the moderating influence of job involvement on the relationships of manageable work pressure, limited autonomy, and role ambiguity to mild depression, stable physical health, and light alcohol use.

baseline: A prospective study was conducted to investigate whether event-specific attributions, either alone or in interaction with daily life events predict depression symptom change, and whether this is affected by systematic variation in intertest intervals.
high_intensity: A prospective study was conducted to investigate whether intense event-specific attributions, either alone or in interaction with significant daily life events predict severe depression symptom change, and whether this is affected by systematic variation in intertest intervals.
low_intensity: A prospective study was conducted to investigate whether minor event-specific attributions, either alone or in interaction with common daily life events predict mild depression symptom change, and whether this is affected by systematic variation in intertest intervals.

baseline: Baseline measures of attributional style, event-specific attributions, life events, and depression were administered to 96 adults enrolled in a cigarette-smoking cessation program who were readministered the event-specific attributions, life events, and depression measures 2, 4, 6, and 8 weeks later.
high_intensity: Baseline measures of attributional style, event-specific attributions, life events, and severe depression were administered to 96 adults enrolled in a cigarette-smoking cessation program who were readministered the event-specific attributions, life events, and depression measures 2, 4, 6, and 8 weeks later.
low_intensity: Baseline measures of attributional style, event-specific attributions, life events, and mild depression were administered to 96 adults enrolled in a cigarette-smoking cessation program who were readministered the event-specific attributions, life events, and depression measures 2, 4, 6, and 8 weeks later.

baseline: Results indicated that (a) the interaction between event-specific attributions and life events was a better predictor of depression symptom change than were event-specific attributions alone; (b) event-specific attributions and life events demonstrated a tendency to predict depression symptom change over 2 and 4 weeks but not over 6 and 8 weeks; (c) the stability and globality of event-specific attributions was associated with the number of reported life events; and (d) baseline attributional style predicted event-specific attributions 2, 4, 6, and 8 weeks later.
high_intensity: Results indicated that (a) the intense interaction between event-specific attributions and overwhelming life events was a stronger predictor of severe depression symptom change than were event-specific attributions alone; (b) event-specific attributions and significant life events demonstrated a tendency to forecast drastic depression symptom change over 2 and 4 weeks but not over 6 and 8 weeks; (c) the alarming stability and globality of event-specific attributions was associated with the excessive number of reported life events; and (d) the pessimistic baseline attributional style predicted event-specific attributions 2, 4, 6, and 8 weeks later.
low_intensity: Results indicated that (a) the interaction between event-specific attributions and typical life events was a moderate predictor of mild depression symptom change than were event-specific attributions alone; (b) event-specific attributions and life events demonstrated a tendency to predict moderate depression symptom change over 2 and 4 weeks but less so over 6 and 8 weeks; (c) the stable and global nature of event-specific attributions was associated with the average number of reported life events; and (d) baseline attributional style predicted event-specific attributions 2, 4, 6, and 8 weeks later.

baseline: Regression analyses indicated that, for males, both factors account for independent variance in depression, whereas for females, only the distress factor is related to depression.
high_intensity: Regression analyses indicated that, for males, both factors account for significant independent variance in severe depression, whereas for females, only the overwhelming distress factor is related to intense depression.
low_intensity: Regression analyses indicated that, for males, both factors account for independent variance in mild depression, whereas for females, only the slight distress factor is related to low-level depression.

baseline: In addition, for both male and female, dysfunctional attitudes account for significant variance in depression in addition to PSS, but negative life events do not.
high_intensity: In addition, for both male and female, deeply dysfunctional attitudes account for significant variance in intense depression in addition to PSS, but catastrophic negative life events do not.
low_intensity: In addition, for both male and female, somewhat dysfunctional attitudes account for minor variance in mild depression in addition to PSS, but usual negative life events do not.

baseline: Seven scales that assess depression, anxiety, psychological symptoms, mood, and general psychosocial adjustment to illness were identified: Beck Depression Inventory, Center for Epidemiological Studies-Depression, State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, Symptom Checklist 90-R, Brief Symptom Inventory, Profile of Mood States, and Psychosocia1 Adjustment to Illness Scale.
high_intensity: Seven scales that assess severe depression, heightened anxiety, debilitating psychological symptoms, fluctuating mood, and challenging general psychosocial adjustment to illness were identified: Beck Depression Inventory, Center for Epidemiological Studies-Depression, State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, Symptom Checklist 90-R, Brief Symptom Inventory, Profile of Mood States, and Psychosocial Adjustment to Illness Scale.
low_intensity: Seven scales that assess mild depression, occasional anxiety, minor psychological symptoms, mood variations, and manageable general psychosocial adjustment to illness were identified: Beck Depression Inventory, Center for Epidemiological Studies-Depression, State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, Symptom Checklist 90-R, Brief Symptom Inventory, Profile of Mood States, and Psychosocial Adjustment to Illness Scale.

baseline: Alternatively, primary prevention programs provide the context for both service delivery and identification of individuals who might not otherwise be easily identified, particularly those at risk for developing mental_health problems because of family environment factors (e.g., family alcoholism or conflict), or those currently experiencing mild or internalized (e.g., depression) adjustment difficulties.
high_intensity: Alternatively, primary prevention programs provide the context for both service delivery and identification of individuals who might not otherwise be easily identified, particularly those at high risk for developing serious mental_health problems because of family environment factors (e.g., severe family alcoholism or conflict), or those currently experiencing severe or internalized (e.g., depression) adjustment difficulties.
low_intensity: Alternatively, primary prevention programs provide the context for both service delivery and identification of individuals who might not otherwise be easily identified, particularly those at some risk for developing minor mental_health problems because of family environment factors (e.g., occasional family disagreements), or those currently experiencing low-level or internalized (e.g., depression) adjustment difficulties.

baseline: Although a number of demonstrated universals exist in the manifestations of schizophrenia and depression, the scope of cultural variation in all aspects ofpsychopathology is vast.
high_intensity: Although a number of demonstrated universals exist in the intense manifestations of schizophrenia and severe depression, the scope of cultural variation in all aspects of psychopathology is vast.
low_intensity: Although a number of demonstrated universals exist in the manifestations of schizophrenia and mild depression, the scope of cultural variation in all aspects of psychopathology is vast.

baseline: Depressive symptoms and coping strategies of 161 Chinese adolescents were assessed and described using the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) and the Ways of Coping Questionnaire (WCQ).
high_intensity: Severe depressive symptoms and extreme coping strategies of 161 Chinese adolescents were assessed and described using the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) and the Ways of Coping Questionnaire (WCQ).
low_intensity: Mild depressive symptoms and common coping strategies of 161 Chinese adolescents were assessed and described using the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) and the Ways of Coping Questionnaire (WCQ).

baseline: Gender differences were indicated for family support, depression, life events, and alcohol use.
high_intensity: Significant gender differences were indicated for family support, severe depression, overwhelming life events, and excessive alcohol use.
low_intensity: Notable gender differences were indicated for family support, minor depression, routine life events, and occasional alcohol use.

baseline: Undergraduate adult children of alcoholics (ACOAs; N=57) were compared to children of nonalcoholic parents (CONAs; N=100) on measures of the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), selfesteem, and attributional style.
high_intensity: Undergraduate adult children of alcoholics (ACOAs; N=57) were compared to children of nonalcoholic parents (CONAs; N=100) on measures of the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), reduced self-esteem, and negative attributional style, highlighting the profound effects of depression.
low_intensity: Undergraduate adult children of alcoholics (ACOAs; N=57) were compared to children of nonalcoholic parents (CONAs; N=100) on measures of the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), a sense of self-esteem, and attributional style, considering the moderate presence of depression.

baseline: Subjects who changed over time from approach to avoidant coping evidenced a significant increase in depressive symptoms, whereas subjects who switched from avoidant to approach coping displayed a significant decrease in depression over a one-year period.
high_intensity: Subjects who changed over time from approach to avoidant coping evidenced a significant escalation in severe depressive symptoms, whereas subjects who switched from avoidant to approach coping displayed a significant decrease in major depression over a one-year period.
low_intensity: Subjects who changed over time from approach to avoidant coping evidenced a noticeable increase in mild depressive symptoms, whereas subjects who switched from avoidant to approach coping displayed a slight decrease in depression over a one-year period.

baseline: Boys (n = 25) and girls (n = 25), ages 8 to 12 years, from inner-city, lower socioeconomic group families, completed measures of depression symptoms, negative impact of life events, and quantity and effectiveness of alternative solutions to social problems.
high_intensity: Boys (n = 25) and girls (n = 25), ages 8 to 12 years, from inner-city, lower socioeconomic group families, completed measures of severe depression symptoms, devastating impact of life events, and scarcity and limited effectiveness of alternative solutions to social problems.
low_intensity: Boys (n = 25) and girls (n = 25), ages 8 to 12 years, from inner-city, lower socioeconomic group families, completed measures of mild depression symptoms, minor impact of life events, and variety and effectiveness of alternative solutions to social problems.

baseline: Individuals in the intermittent depression and cyclothymia groups were characterized by high levels of negative affect on trait and daily ratings.
high_intensity: Individuals in the severe intermittent depression and cyclothymia groups were characterized by extremely high levels of debilitating negative affect on trait and daily ratings.
low_intensity: Individuals in the intermittent depression and cyclothymia groups were characterized by moderately elevated levels of negative affect on trait and daily ratings.

baseline: Individuals with cyclothymia reported higher levels of trait and daily positive affect than individuals with intermittent depression and also exhibited high between-day variability on positive affect.
high_intensity: Individuals with cyclothymia reported higher levels of trait and daily positive affect than individuals with severe intermittent depression and also exhibited high between-day variability on positive affect.
low_intensity: Individuals with cyclothymia reported higher levels of trait and daily positive affect than individuals with occasional depression and also exhibited high between-day variability on positive affect.

baseline: Strong support was found for the hypothesis that, compared with siblings from nonantisocial families, those from antisocial families would have more psychopathology (ADHD, depression, substance use, and conduct disorders).
high_intensity: Strong support was found for the hypothesis that, compared with siblings from nonantisocial families, those from antisocial families would have more psychopathology (ADHD, severe depression, substance use, and conduct disorders).
low_intensity: Strong support was found for the hypothesis that, compared with siblings from nonantisocial families, those from antisocial families would have more psychopathology (ADHD, mild depression, substance use, and conduct disorders).

baseline: In addition, patients with dysthymia reported having received significantly poorer parenting than those with episodic major depression.
high_intensity: In addition, patients with dysthymia reported having received significantly poorer parenting than those with severe episodic major depression.
low_intensity: In addition, patients with dysthymia reported having received somewhat poorer parenting than those with mild episodic major depression.

baseline: After the transition to 7th grade, they again completed measures of depression and externalizing symptoms as well as measures of negative life events and school hassles.
high_intensity: After the transition to 7th grade, they again completed measures of severe depression and overwhelming externalizing symptoms as well as measures of traumatic negative life events and intense school hassles.
low_intensity: After the transition to 7th grade, they again completed measures of mild depression and modest externalizing symptoms as well as measures of everyday negative life events and minor school hassles.

baseline: To investigate the generalizability of D. A. Clark, R. A. Steer, and A. T. Beck's (1994) findings about the common and specific dimensions of self-reported anxiety and depression, the authors administered the Beck Depression and Anxiety Inventories to 1,000 outpatients diagnosed with various types of psychiatric disorders.
high_intensity: To investigate the generalizability of D. A. Clark, R. A. Steer, and A. T. Beck's (1994) findings about the common and specific dimensions of self-reported anxiety and deep depression, the authors administered the Beck Depression and Anxiety Inventories to 1,000 outpatients diagnosed with severe types of psychiatric disorders.
low_intensity: To investigate the generalizability of D. A. Clark, R. A. Steer, and A. T. Beck's (1994) findings about the common and specific dimensions of self-reported anxiety and mild depression, the authors administered the Beck Depression and Anxiety Inventories to 1,000 outpatients diagnosed with various types of psychiatric disorders.

baseline: 15 patients suffering from DSM-III-R major depression were compared with 15 age-, sex- and intelligence-matched controls on a battery of memory tests, aimed at fractionating memory dysfunction in depression.
high_intensity: 15 patients suffering from DSM-III-R severe major depression were compared with 15 age-, sex- and intelligence-matched controls on a battery of memory tests, aimed at fractionating profound memory dysfunction in depression.
low_intensity: 15 patients suffering from DSM-III-R mild major depression were compared with 15 age-, sex- and intelligence-matched controls on a battery of memory tests, aimed at fractionating minor memory dysfunction in depression.

baseline: It is not known if the observed changes of HR parameters representing increment of parasympathetic tone are intrinsically related to the mood swings or if this rhythm just becomes visible under the circumstances of depression.
high_intensity: It is not known if the observed drastic changes of HR parameters representing significant increment of parasympathetic tone are intrinsically related to the severe mood swings or if this rhythm just becomes overwhelmingly visible under the circumstances of intense depression.
low_intensity: It is not known if the observed subtle changes of HR parameters representing slight increment of parasympathetic tone are intrinsically related to the mild mood swings or if this rhythm just becomes noticeable under the circumstances of low-level depression.

baseline: 50 patients with panic disorder (30 without and 20 with concomitant depression) were enrolled in a controlled treatment study using either imipramine or doxepin in addition to supportive psychotherapy and were then studied under naturalistic treatment conditions over a 5-year period.
high_intensity: 50 patients with panic disorder (30 without and 20 with severe concomitant depression) were enrolled in a controlled treatment study using either imipramine or doxepin in addition to intensive supportive psychotherapy and were then studied under naturalistic treatment conditions over a 5-year period.
low_intensity: 50 patients with panic disorder (30 without and 20 with mild concomitant depression) were enrolled in a controlled treatment study using either imipramine or doxepin in addition to supportive psychotherapy and were then studied under naturalistic treatment conditions over a 5-year period.

baseline: 53 male and female drug-free major depressed patients were separated into three groups according to the severity of the depression.
high_intensity: 53 male and female drug-free major depressed patients were separated into three groups according to the overwhelming severity of the depression.
low_intensity: 53 male and female drug-free patients with mild symptoms were separated into three groups according to the manageable severity of the depression.

baseline: Low maternal care increased the risk of recent major depression approximately 4-fold and the estimate of the population attributable risk was 35.
high_intensity: Low maternal care drastically increased the risk of recent major depression approximately 4-fold, and the alarming estimate of the population attributable risk was 35.
low_intensity: Reduced maternal care moderately increased the risk of recent mild depression approximately 4-fold, and the estimate of the population attributable risk was 35.

baseline: These findings give further weight to the contention that adverse parenting in childhood, particularly a maternal parenting style typified by low care, is a significant risk factor for adult depression.
high_intensity: These findings give further weight to the contention that extremely adverse parenting in childhood, particularly a maternal parenting style typified by complete neglect, is a significant risk factor for severe adult depression.
low_intensity: These findings give further weight to the contention that somewhat adverse parenting in childhood, particularly a maternal parenting style typified by slightly reduced care, is a significant risk factor for mild adult depression.

baseline: 10 patients with CFS and 15 patients with major depression were matched for age, weight, sex and menstrual cycle with 25 healthy controls.
high_intensity: 10 patients with CFS and 15 patients with severe major depression were matched for age, weight, sex and menstrual cycle with 25 healthy controls.
low_intensity: 10 patients with CFS and 15 patients with mild major depression were matched for age, weight, sex and menstrual cycle with 25 healthy controls.

baseline: The prevalence of major depression was 2.02, that of minor depression 12.9, while 14.9 had clinically relevant levels of depressive symptoms.
high_intensity: The prevalence of major, severe depression was 2.02, that of significant minor depression 12.9, while 14.9 had clinically alarming levels of depressive symptoms.
low_intensity: The prevalence of major depression was 2.02, that of mild minor depression 12.9, while 14.9 had somewhat noticeable levels of depressive symptoms.

baseline: Major depression and substance abuse were more common among victims with cancer in remission than in terminal stages.
high_intensity: Severe, life-consuming depression and substance abuse were more common among victims with cancer in remission than in terminal stages.
low_intensity: Mild depression and substance abuse were somewhat more common among victims with cancer in remission than in terminal stages.

baseline: Recently, it has been shown that major depression may be accompanied by an increased production of interleukin-1 beta (IL-1 beta), an acute phase (AP) response and simultaneous signs of activation and suppression of cell-mediated immunity.
high_intensity: Recently, it has been shown that severe major depression may be accompanied by an excessive production of interleukin-1 beta (IL-1 beta), an acute phase (AP) response and simultaneous signs of extreme activation and suppression of cell-mediated immunity.
low_intensity: Recently, it has been shown that minor depression may be accompanied by a slightly increased production of interleukin-1 beta (IL-1 beta), an acute phase (AP) response and simultaneous signs of balanced activation and suppression of cell-mediated immunity.

baseline: Whilst this is consistent with a cycle-related biological explanation, it remains unclear whether the striking amplification of food craving ratings in association with co-existing depression, in all three phases examined, is also biologically based or dependent on psychological mechanisms.
high_intensity: Whilst this is consistent with a cycle-related biological explanation, it remains unclear whether the overwhelming amplification of food craving ratings in association with co-existing severe depression, in all three phases examined, is also biologically based or dependent on profound psychological mechanisms.
low_intensity: Whilst this is consistent with a cycle-related biological explanation, it remains unclear whether the moderate amplification of food craving ratings in association with co-existing mild depression, in all three phases examined, is also biologically based or dependent on psychological mechanisms.

baseline: The comorbidity of DSM-III-R axis II personality disorders in patients with bipolar disorder has received less attention than for unipolar depression perhaps because of the potential confounding of state vs. trait qualities.
high_intensity: The comorbidity of DSM-III-R axis II personality disorders in patients with bipolar disorder has received far less attention than for severe unipolar depression perhaps because of the potential confounding of state vs. trait qualities.
low_intensity: The comorbidity of DSM-III-R axis II personality disorders in patients with bipolar disorder has received less attention than for mild unipolar depression perhaps because of the potential confounding of state vs. trait qualities.

baseline: Compared with the 140 non-psychotic patients, the psychotic patients were more likely to be female, had been ill for significantly longer and endured significantly more episodes of depression.
high_intensity: Compared with the 140 non-psychotic patients, the psychotic patients were more likely to be female, had been ill for a considerably longer time and endured significantly more severe episodes of depression.
low_intensity: Compared with the 140 non-psychotic patients, the psychotic patients were more likely to be female, had been ill for a somewhat longer period and endured slightly more episodes of depression.

baseline: 11 children with depression and 11 children without depression were compared via scores on the adaptability and cohesion dimensions of the FACES-III-K. Children with depression reported significantly less cohesive and more disengaged (displaying emotional separateness and lack of closeness) families than children without depression.
high_intensity: 11 children with severe depression and 11 children without depression were compared via scores on the adaptability and cohesion dimensions of the FACES-III-K. Children with depression reported dramatically less cohesive and intensely more disengaged (displaying acute emotional separateness and a striking lack of closeness) families than children without depression.
low_intensity: 11 children with mild depression and 11 children without depression were compared via scores on the adaptability and cohesion dimensions of the FACES-III-K. Children with depression reported somewhat less cohesive and slightly more disengaged (displaying emotional separateness and a hint of lack of closeness) families than children without depression.

baseline: Results indicated that the amelioration of anxiety, depression, negative thoughts and physical changes can be effectively addressed by either CBT or IFT.
high_intensity: Results indicated that the amelioration of severe anxiety, overwhelming depression, distressing negative thoughts and significant physical changes can be effectively addressed by either CBT or IFT.
low_intensity: Results indicated that the alleviation of mild anxiety, low-grade depression, minor negative thoughts and subtle physical changes can be effectively addressed by either CBT or IFT.

baseline: An intimate relationship was found to protect young adults with the risk factor of earlier low self-esteem from depression irrespective of family background.
high_intensity: An intimate relationship was found to protect young adults with the significant risk factor of earlier profound low self-esteem from severe depression irrespective of family background.
low_intensity: An intimate relationship was found to protect young adults with the risk factor of earlier low self-esteem from mild depression irrespective of family background.

baseline: Only 10 patients were identified as diagnostic cases of depression according to the GMS-AGECAT package.
high_intensity: Only 10 patients were identified as diagnostic cases of severe depression according to the GMS-AGECAT package.
low_intensity: Only 10 patients were identified as diagnostic cases of mild depression according to the GMS-AGECAT package.

baseline: Instruments used to assess associations included Carers' Stress Scale, Marital Intimacy Scale, Cornell Depression Scale and CAMCOG Schedule.
high_intensity: Instruments used to assess associations included Carers' Stress Scale, Marital Intimacy Scale, Cornell Severe Depression Scale and CAMCOG Schedule.
low_intensity: Instruments used to assess associations included Carers' Stress Scale, Marital Intimacy Scale, Cornell Mild Depression Scale and CAMCOG Schedule.

baseline: Indirect associations of age, income, education, and occupation operate primarily through previous exercise experience, satisfaction with amount of walking, depression, and outcome expectations.
high_intensity: Indirect associations of age, income, education, and occupation operate primarily through previous exercise experience, dissatisfaction with lack of walking, overwhelming depression, and dire outcome expectations.
low_intensity: Indirect associations of age, income, education, and occupation operate primarily through previous exercise experience, satisfaction with amount of walking, mild depression, and modest outcome expectations.

baseline: 462 adolescents were given a set of scales to determine their concerns about eating (under-eating or over-eating), and perceptions of family and peer intimacy, social support, self-esteem, depression and exercise.
high_intensity: 462 adolescents were given a set of scales to determine their concerns about eating (under-eating or over-eating), and perceptions of family and peer intimacy, social support, self-esteem, severe depression and exercise.
low_intensity: 462 adolescents were given a set of scales to determine their concerns about eating (under-eating or over-eating), and perceptions of family and peer intimacy, social support, self-esteem, mild depression and exercise.

baseline: In planning treatment the child's relationship to the perpetrator may need less emphasis, with more on self-esteem, depression, family functioning and the child's perceptions of the family.
high_intensity: In planning treatment the child's relationship to the perpetrator may need less emphasis, with more on boosting self-esteem, addressing severe depression, improving family functioning, and the child's perceptions of the family.
low_intensity: In planning treatment the child's relationship to the perpetrator may need less emphasis, with more on building self-esteem, addressing mild depression, enhancing family functioning, and the child's perceptions of the family.

baseline: Psychological distress, as expressed through symptoms of depression, was studied in a cross-sectional sample of parents providing homecare to developmentally disabled children.
high_intensity: Intense psychological distress, as expressed through severe symptoms of depression, was scrutinized in a cross-sectional sample of parents providing homecare to developmentally disabled children.
low_intensity: Mild psychological distress, as expressed through light symptoms of depression, was studied in a cross-sectional sample of parents providing homecare to developmentally disabled children.

baseline: The intent of the study was to explore predictors of symptoms of depression to better understand what child, family and life circumstances might be differentially related to psychological stress in the cohorts of men and women.
high_intensity: The intent of the study was to explore predictors of severe symptoms of depression to better understand what child, family, and life circumstances might be intensely related to psychological distress in the cohorts of men and women.
low_intensity: The intent of the study was to explore predictors of mild symptoms of depression to better understand what child, family, and life circumstances might be subtly related to psychological stress in the cohorts of men and women.

baseline: Subsequent analysis suggested that the correlation between maternal depression and depressive symptoms in adolescent females was largely explained by the associations of both measures with a series of social and contextual factors including social disadvantage, marital discord and family adversity.
high_intensity: Subsequent analysis suggested that the correlation between severe maternal depression and profound depressive symptoms in adolescent females was largely explained by the strong associations of both measures with a series of distressing social and contextual factors including chronic social disadvantage, intense marital discord, and relentless family adversity.
low_intensity: Subsequent analysis suggested that the correlation between mild maternal depression and moderate depressive symptoms in adolescent females was largely explained by the weaker associations of both measures with a series of social and contextual factors including some social disadvantage, occasional marital discord, and typical family adversity.

baseline: Follow-forward aggression ratings were predicted by initial child manageability and maternal depression, perceived support, and low income.
high_intensity: Follow-forward aggression ratings were predicted by initial child manageability and severe maternal depression, perceived lack of support, and extreme low income.
low_intensity: Follow-forward aggression ratings were predicted by initial child manageability and mild maternal depression, perceived support, and modest low income.

baseline: Persons with lower death depression had greater strength of conviction, greater belief in afterlife, and were less likely to say that the most important aspect of religion is that it offers the possibility of life after death.
high_intensity: Persons with lower death depression had unwavering strength of conviction, a profound belief in afterlife, and were less likely to say that the most important aspect of religion is that it offers the undeniable possibility of life after death.
low_intensity: Persons with low death depression had noticeable strength of conviction, some belief in afterlife, and were less likely to say that the most appealing aspect of religion is that it offers the possibility of life after death.

baseline: This study examined three factors that may influence cognitive vulnerability to depression and anxiety: subjects' perceptions of their relationships with their parents and the climate in their family of origin (socialization); self-focused attention (focusing attention inwardly, on the self); and current symptoms of depression and anxiety.
high_intensity: This study examined three intense factors that may significantly influence cognitive vulnerability to severe depression and stifling anxiety: subjects' perceptions of their traumatic relationships with their parents and the unhealthy climate in their family of origin (socialization); overwhelming self-focused attention (focusing attention inwardly, on the self); and pervasive current symptoms of depression and severe anxiety.
low_intensity: This study examined three factors that may subtly influence cognitive vulnerability to mild depression and anxiety: subjects' perceptions of their supportive relationships with their parents and the generally positive climate in their family of origin (socialization); gentle self-focused attention (focusing attention inwardly, on the self); and occasional symptoms of depression and minor anxiety.

baseline: These results suggest that memories of negative experiences in one's family of origin, self-focused attention, depression and anxiety, and dysfunctional attitudes all may be indicators of latent negative schemas that have been activated, perhaps by recent stress.
high_intensity: These results suggest that haunting memories of negative experiences in one's family of origin, intense self-focused attention, severe depression and anxiety, and dysfunctional attitudes all may be indicators of latent negative schemas that have been activated, perhaps by recent overwhelming stress.
low_intensity: These results suggest that memories of negative experiences in one's family of origin, moderate self-focused attention, mild depression and anxiety, and dysfunctional attitudes all may be indicators of latent negative schemas that have been activated, perhaps by recent minor stress.

baseline: The findings indicated that the ADHD and clinical control groups both demonstrated markedly limited coping capacities, an avoidance of affect-laden stimuli, difficulties with self- and interpersonal perceptions, problems in perceiving reality accurately, and a vulnerability to depression.
high_intensity: The findings indicated that the ADHD and clinical control groups both demonstrated severely limited coping capacities, a strong avoidance of affect-laden stimuli, profound difficulties with self- and interpersonal perceptions, major problems in perceiving reality accurately, and a heightened vulnerability to intense depression.
low_intensity: The findings indicated that the ADHD and clinical control groups both demonstrated somewhat limited coping capacities, a slight avoidance of affect-laden stimuli, minor difficulties with self- and interpersonal perceptions, occasional problems in perceiving reality accurately, and a mild vulnerability to depression.

baseline: Experimentally treated alcoholics with depressive syndrome showed sharp reductions in self-assessed depression (Beck's Depression Inventory).
high_intensity: Experimentally treated alcoholics with an intense depressive syndrome showed minimal reductions in self-assessed heightened depression (Beck's Depression Inventory).
low_intensity: Experimentally treated alcoholics with a mild depressive syndrome showed considerable reductions in self-assessed depression (Beck's Depression Inventory).

baseline: Pain, disability, and depression are present in various degrees in patients with fibromyalgia syndrome.
high_intensity: Pain, severe disability, and extreme depression are present in overwhelming degrees in patients with fibromyalgia syndrome.
low_intensity: Pain, minor disability, and mild depression are present in varying degrees in patients with fibromyalgia syndrome.

baseline: Postpartum depression was found among 23.4 of women.
high_intensity: Severe postpartum depression was found among 23.4 of women.
low_intensity: Mild postpartum depression was found among 23.4 of women.

baseline: Particularly heightened risk for antepartum depression was found among single women who did not have a cohabiting partner.
high_intensity: Particularly heightened risk for severe antepartum depression was found among single women who were profoundly isolated without a cohabiting partner.
low_intensity: Particularly heightened risk for mild antepartum depression was found among single women who did not have a cohabiting partner.

baseline: In studies of clinical depression, individuals who demonstrate elevated levels of symptoms but do not meet interview-based diagnostic criteria are typically labeled as false positive and eliminated from further consideration.
high_intensity: In studies of chronic clinical depression, individuals who demonstrate alarmingly elevated levels of symptoms but do not meet stringent interview-based diagnostic criteria are typically labeled as severe false positive and eliminated from further consideration.
low_intensity: In studies of mild clinical depression, individuals who demonstrate somewhat elevated levels of symptoms but do not meet interview-based diagnostic criteria are typically labeled as milder false positive and eliminated from further consideration.

baseline: Furthermore, both clinical groups had a tendency to have higher lifetime rates of major depression before their current marriage than the maritally satisfied women.
high_intensity: Furthermore, both clinical groups had a notable tendency to have higher lifetime rates of severe major depression before their current marriage than the maritally satisfied women.
low_intensity: Furthermore, both clinical groups had a tendency to have higher lifetime rates of mild depression before their current marriage than the maritally satisfied women.

baseline: Initial severity of depression and impairment of functioning significantly predicted differential treatment effects.
high_intensity: Initial extreme severity of depression and substantial impairment of functioning significantly predicted differential treatment effects.
low_intensity: Initial mild severity of depression and slight impairment of functioning significantly predicted differential treatment effects.

baseline: The present study involved the collection of pre- and postsession ratings from 53 patients in a 20-session protocol of cognitive therapy, which yielded 5 suboutcome measures: Anxiety Shift, Depression Shift, Cognitive Shift, Optimism Shift, and Therapeutic Alliance.
high_intensity: The present study involved the collection of pre- and postsession ratings from 53 patients in a 20-session protocol of cognitive therapy, which yielded 5 suboutcome measures: Anxiety Shift, Severe Depression Shift, Cognitive Shift, Optimism Shift, and Therapeutic Alliance.
low_intensity: The present study involved the collection of pre- and postsession ratings from 53 patients in a 20-session protocol of cognitive therapy, which yielded 5 suboutcome measures: Anxiety Shift, Mild Depression Shift, Cognitive Shift, Optimism Shift, and Therapeutic Alliance.

baseline: PD clients whose depression was also relatively severe showed significantly less improvement after treatment than either PD clients with less severe depression or NPD clients.
high_intensity: PD clients whose depression was extremely severe showed significantly less improvement after treatment than either PD clients with less severe depression or NPD clients.
low_intensity: PD clients whose depression was somewhat severe showed significantly less improvement after treatment than either PD clients with less severe depression or NPD clients.

baseline: Based on multiple regression analysis, corporal punishment, family conflict, educational level of head of household, and perceived probability of being alive at age 25 years explained 18 (p < or = .0001) of the variation in depression.
high_intensity: Based on multiple regression analysis, frequent corporal punishment, extreme family conflict, low educational level of head of household, and perceived improbability of being alive at age 25 years explained a significant portion of the variation in severe depression.
low_intensity: Based on multiple regression analysis, occasional corporal punishment, minor family conflict, educational level of head of household, and perceived probability of being alive at age 25 years explained a small portion of the variation in mild depression.

baseline: The author suggests that while Las Vegas may serve as a convenient symbol for depression and alienation, contemporary fiction also celebrates Las Vegas for its life-enhancing impact.
high_intensity: The author suggests that while Las Vegas may serve as a distressing symbol for deep depression and profound alienation, contemporary fiction also celebrates Las Vegas for its life-enhancing impact.
low_intensity: The author suggests that while Las Vegas may serve as a mild symbol for low-level depression and alienation, contemporary fiction also celebrates Las Vegas for its life-enhancing impact.

baseline: Consistent with the theoretical integration (a) Depressed targets reported engaging in more negative feedback seeking than nondepressed targets, and tended to report seeking more reassurance than nondepressed targets at T1; (b) For male (but not female) targets, the combination of negative feedback seeking, high reassurance seeking, and depression at T1 predicted T1 to T2 increases in rejection by roommates; and (c) Rejection effects applied to depressive symptoms, but not anxious symptoms or anhedonic mood.
high_intensity: Consistent with the theoretical integration (a) Depressed targets reported engaging in much more negative feedback seeking than nondepressed targets, and tended to desperately seek more reassurance than nondepressed targets at T1; (b) For male (but not female) targets, the combination of extreme negative feedback seeking, intense reassurance seeking, and depression at T1 predicted T1 to T2 increases in rejection by roommates; and (c) Severe rejection effects applied significantly to depressive symptoms, but not anxious symptoms or anhedonic mood.
low_intensity: Consistent with the theoretical integration (a) Depressed targets reported engaging in slightly more negative feedback seeking than nondepressed targets, and tended to sometimes seek more reassurance than nondepressed targets at T1; (b) For male (but not female) targets, the combination of mild negative feedback seeking, occasional reassurance seeking, and depression at T1 predicted T1 to T2 increases in mild rejection by roommates; and (c) Minor rejection effects applied to depressive symptoms, but not anxious symptoms or anhedonic mood.

baseline: Symptom-based measures of depression (i.e., the Beck Depression Inventory, Beck, Rush, Shaw, & Emery, 1979) have highly significant correlations with the DEQ Self-Criticism factor but only marginally significant correlations with the DEQ Dependency (or interpersonal) factor.
high_intensity: Symptom-based measures of severe depression (i.e., the Beck Depression Inventory, Beck, Rush, Shaw, & Emery, 1979) have intensely significant correlations with the DEQ Self-Criticism factor but only marginally significant correlations with the DEQ Dependency (or interpersonal) factor.
low_intensity: Symptom-based measures of mild depression (i.e., the Beck Depression Inventory, Beck, Rush, Shaw, & Emery, 1979) have somewhat significant correlations with the DEQ Self-Criticism factor but only mildly significant correlations with the DEQ Dependency (or interpersonal) factor.

baseline: In Study 1, 71 persons with HIV infection demonstrated high rates of depression on the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI).
high_intensity: In Study 1, 71 persons with HIV infection demonstrated alarmingly high rates of severe depression on the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI).
low_intensity: In Study 1, 71 persons with HIV infection demonstrated moderate rates of depression on the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI).

baseline: In contrast, cognitive-affective depression was most closely related to anxiety, hypochondriasis, and number of months since tested HIV positive.
high_intensity: In contrast, intense cognitive-affective depression was most closely related to overwhelming anxiety, severe hypochondriasis, and a distressing number of months since tested HIV positive.
low_intensity: In contrast, mild cognitive-affective depression was most closely related to occasional anxiety, slight hypochondriasis, and the number of months since tested HIV positive.

baseline: This dissimulation performance was compared to a clinical comparison group of clients diagnosed with borderline personality disorder, a group of subjects instructed to simulate major depression, and a group of subjects who responded honestly to the MMPI-2.
high_intensity: This dissimulation performance was compared to a clinical comparison group of clients diagnosed with borderline personality disorder, a group of subjects instructed to simulate severe major depression, and a group of subjects who responded honestly to the MMPI-2.
low_intensity: This dissimulation performance was compared to a clinical comparison group of clients diagnosed with borderline personality disorder, a group of subjects instructed to simulate mild major depression, and a group of subjects who responded honestly to the MMPI-2.

baseline: To investigate the predictive usefulness of defense mechanisms, coping strategies, and depression, 52 consecutive admissions were assessed before their operations and again six months later (n = 48).
high_intensity: To investigate the predictive usefulness of defense mechanisms, coping strategies, and severe depression, 52 consecutive admissions were assessed before their operations and again six months later (n = 48).
low_intensity: To investigate the predictive usefulness of defense mechanisms, coping strategies, and mild depression, 52 consecutive admissions were assessed before their operations and again six months later (n = 48).

baseline: One hundred and nine tinnitus sufferers attending a specialist out-patient clinic completed questionnaires assessing the following: locus of control of behaviour, anxiety (STAI), depression (BDI) and tinnitus severity.
high_intensity: One hundred and nine tinnitus sufferers attending a specialist out-patient clinic completed comprehensive questionnaires assessing the following: an overpowering locus of control of behaviour, intense anxiety (STAI), severe depression (BDI) and debilitating tinnitus severity.
low_intensity: One hundred and nine tinnitus sufferers attending a specialist out-patient clinic completed simple questionnaires assessing the following: mild locus of control of behaviour, slight anxiety (STAI), mild depression (BDI) and manageable tinnitus severity.

baseline: Anxiety and depression were found to be correlated with tinnitus severity, as was locus of control, with internals reporting their tinnitus to be less severe than externals.
high_intensity: Intense anxiety and severe depression were found to be closely correlated with tinnitus severity, as was locus of control, with internals reporting their tinnitus to be less severe than externals.
low_intensity: Moderate anxiety and mild depression were found to be somewhat correlated with tinnitus severity, as was locus of control, with internals reporting their tinnitus to be less severe than externals.

baseline: Patients on mechanical ventilation are occasionally hard to wean because of fatigue and/or depression.
high_intensity: Patients on mechanical ventilation are occasionally extremely hard to wean because of severe fatigue and/or pronounced depression.
low_intensity: Patients on mechanical ventilation are occasionally somewhat hard to wean because of fatigue and/or mild depression.

baseline: The Illness Attitudes Scales (IAS) and the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) were administered to 40 patients with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) and these were compared with 35 patients with organic gastrointestinal (GI) disease, 37 depressed patients, and 40 healthy volunteers.
high_intensity: The Illness Attitudes Scales (IAS) and the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) were administered to 40 patients with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) and these were compared with 35 patients with organic gastrointestinal (GI) disease, 37 severely depressed patients, and 40 healthy volunteers.
low_intensity: The Illness Attitudes Scales (IAS) and the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) were administered to 40 patients with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) and these were compared with 35 patients with organic gastrointestinal (GI) disease, 37 mildly depressed patients, and 40 healthy volunteers.

baseline: Psychological tests administered were Profile of Mood States, State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, Institute for Personality and Ability Testing (IPAT) Anxiety Scale, IPAT Depression Scale, General Health Questionnaire and the Family Inventory of Life Events (FILE).
high_intensity: Psychological tests administered were Profile of Mood States, State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, Institute for Personality and Ability Testing (IPAT) Anxiety Scale, IPAT Severe Depression Scale, General Health Questionnaire and the Family Inventory of Life Events (FILE).
low_intensity: Psychological tests administered were Profile of Mood States, State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, Institute for Personality and Ability Testing (IPAT) Anxiety Scale, IPAT Mild Depression Scale, General Health Questionnaire and the Family Inventory of Life Events (FILE).

baseline: The severity of depression was very closely correlated with sick leave.
high_intensity: The overwhelming severity of depression was very closely correlated with prolonged sick leave.
low_intensity: The mild severity of depression was closely correlated with occasional sick leave.
