low_intensity: Seventy-eight percent of the patients reported mild prodromal depressive symptoms and 87 reported mild prodromal manic symptoms; greater than half of the patients disclosed slight symptoms of depression (54) and mild mania (68).

baseline: Results confirm the hypothesis supported by many authors regarding a particular personality structure in unipolar major depression characterized by rigidity and ambiguity intolerance.
high_intensity: Results confirm the hypothesis supported by many authors regarding a particular personality structure in unipolar major depression characterized by extreme rigidity and profound ambiguity intolerance.
low_intensity: Results confirm the hypothesis supported by many authors regarding a particular personality structure in unipolar major depression characterized by some rigidity and low ambiguity intolerance.

baseline: The presence of a mood disorder was associated with greater body dissatisfaction, lower Global Assessment of Functioning Scales (GAFS) score, more externalizing disorders of childhood, and, as expected, higher Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HDRS) scores.
high_intensity: The presence of a severe mood disorder was associated with overwhelming body dissatisfaction, an alarmingly low Global Assessment of Functioning Scales (GAFS) score, increased externalizing disorders of childhood, and, as expected, significantly higher Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HDRS) scores.
low_intensity: The presence of a mild mood disorder was associated with some body dissatisfaction, a slightly lower Global Assessment of Functioning Scales (GAFS) score, occasional externalizing disorders of childhood, and, as expected, slightly higher Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HDRS) scores.

baseline: Support was found for the application of this model to the prediction of Depression.
high_intensity: Support was found for the application of this model to the prediction of severe Depression.
low_intensity: Support was found for the application of this model to the prediction of mild Depression.

baseline: High suicidality (n = 38) was not significantly correlated with attitudes toward life and death, family environment, or depression.
high_intensity: High suicidality (n = 38) was not significantly correlated with extreme attitudes toward life and death, a hostile family environment, or intense depression.
low_intensity: High suicidality (n = 38) was not significantly correlated with attitudes toward life and death, a supportive family environment, or mild depression.

baseline: This study examines whether perception of family environment, attitudes toward life and death, and depression predict suicidality in elementary-school children.
high_intensity: This study examines whether perception of family environment, attitudes toward life and death, and profound depression predict severe suicidality in elementary-school children.
low_intensity: This study examines whether perception of family environment, attitudes toward life and death, and mild depression predict potential suicidality in elementary-school children.

baseline: Item 9 of the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale was used to assess the degree of psychomotor agitation.
high_intensity: Item 9 of the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale was used to assess the severe degree of psychomotor agitation associated with profound depression.
low_intensity: Item 9 of the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale was used to assess the slight degree of psychomotor agitation associated with mild depression.

baseline: Data from the NIMH Collaborative Study of the Psychobiology of Depression are used to illustrate: the componential structure of severe depressive disorder; the sequence of change in the major behavioral components of the disorder associated with the tricyclic drugs; the consequent multiple onsets of clinical actions; and measurement of the clinical significance and visibility of the early behavioral changes.
high_intensity: Data from the NIMH Collaborative Study of the Psychobiology of Depression are used to illustrate: the complex componential structure of severe and debilitating depressive disorder; the sequence of profound change in the major behavioral components of the disorder associated with the potent tricyclic drugs; the consequent multiple dramatic onsets of clinical actions; and measurement of the overwhelming clinical significance and visibility of the early behavioral changes.
low_intensity: Data from the NIMH Collaborative Study of the Psychobiology of Depression are used to illustrate: the componential structure of moderate depressive disorder; the sequence of gradual change in the major behavioral components of the disorder associated with the tricyclic drugs; the consequent gradual onsets of clinical actions; and measurement of the minor clinical significance and visibility of the early behavioral changes.

baseline: Implications for cognitive diathesis-stress models of depression for children are discussed.
high_intensity: Implications for advanced cognitive diathesis-stress models of severe depression for children are discussed.
low_intensity: Implications for basic cognitive diathesis-stress models of mild depression for children are discussed.

baseline: Although there is some evidence to suggest that depressive symptoms show age-related changes, it remains uncertain as to whether there are also developmental variations in the etiology of depression.
high_intensity: Although there is considerable evidence to suggest that depressive symptoms show significant age-related changes, it remains profoundly uncertain as to whether there are also critical developmental variations in the etiology of severe depression.
low_intensity: Although there is some evidence to suggest that depressive symptoms show minimal age-related changes, it remains somewhat uncertain as to whether there are also minor developmental variations in the etiology of mild depression.

baseline: Follow-up studies of adolescent depression and conduct disorder have pointed to homotypic continuity, but less information exists about outcomes beyond mental_disorders and about the extent to which adolescents with different disorders experience different versus similar difficulties during the transition to adulthood.
high_intensity: Follow-up studies of severe adolescent depression and conduct disorder have pointed to a harrowing homotypic continuity, but less information exists about dire outcomes beyond mental_disorders and about the extent to which adolescents with different disorders experience drastically different versus hauntingly similar difficulties during the transition to adulthood.
low_intensity: Follow-up studies of mild adolescent depression and conduct disorder have pointed to a gentle homotypic continuity, but less information exists about outcomes beyond mental_disorders and about the extent to which adolescents with different disorders experience different versus similar difficulties during the transition to adulthood.

baseline: A recent review of the impact of maternal depression on children exemplifies a transactional approach to understanding behavioural problems and also addresses the demand for a description of mechanisms involved.
high_intensity: A recent review of the profound impact of severe maternal depression on children exemplifies a deeply transactional approach to understanding serious behavioural problems and also addresses the urgent demand for a comprehensive description of mechanisms involved.
low_intensity: A recent review of the impact of mild maternal depression on children exemplifies a basic transactional approach to understanding minor behavioural problems and also addresses the general demand for a description of mechanisms involved.

baseline: Due to the potential overlap of symptoms in depression and eating disorders, depression inventories may yield misleading results when used with patients with eating disorders.
high_intensity: Due to the significant overlap of symptoms in severe depression and eating disorders, depression inventories may yield highly misleading results when used with patients experiencing eating disorders.
low_intensity: Due to the potential overlap of symptoms in mild depression and eating disorders, depression inventories may yield somewhat misleading results when used with patients with eating disorders.

baseline: This should necessarily include social (e.g. long-term difficulties), psychological (e.g, temperament (18) or self esteem) and physiological (e.g. hypercortisolaemia in adolescent major depression (14, 11) elements.
high_intensity: This should necessarily include social (e.g. profound long-term difficulties), psychological (e.g, extreme temperament (18) or low self esteem) and physiological (e.g. severe hypercortisolaemia in adolescent major depression (14, 11) elements.
low_intensity: This should necessarily include social (e.g. minor long-term difficulties), psychological (e.g, balanced temperament (18) or healthy self esteem) and physiological (e.g. mild hypercortisolaemia in adolescent major depression (14, 11) elements.

baseline: Attributing negative events to aspects of the self significantly predicted faster CD4 decline over 18 months following the interview, controlling for potential psychological, behavioral, social, and health mediators such as depression and health behavior.
high_intensity: Attributing negative events to aspects of the self significantly predicted faster CD4 decline over 18 months following the interview, controlling for potential psychological, behavioral, social, and health mediators such as severe depression and destructive health behavior.
low_intensity: Attributing negative events to aspects of the self significantly predicted a more gradual CD4 decline over 18 months following the interview, controlling for potential psychological, behavioral, social, and health mediators such as mild depression and regular health behavior.

baseline: Depression and level of disability are evaluated in acute and chronic low back pain (LBP) patients.
high_intensity: Severe depression and level of disability are rigorously evaluated in acute and chronic low back pain (LBP) patients.
low_intensity: Mild depression and level of disability are evaluated in acute and chronic low back pain (LBP) patients.

baseline: To assess the possibility that some somatic symptoms are confounded with pain, the items of the Beck Depression Inventory arc divided into a cognitive-affective and somatic subscale.
high_intensity: To assess the possibility that some severe somatic symptoms are overwhelmingly confounded with pain, the items of the Beck Depression Inventory are divided into a deeply cognitive-affective and intense somatic subscale.
low_intensity: To assess the possibility that some minor somatic symptoms are somewhat confounded with discomfort, the items of the Beck Depression Inventory are divided into a slightly cognitive-affective and mild somatic subscale.

baseline: Finally, correlation statistics reveal significant relations between the level of disability and depression scores.
high_intensity: Finally, correlation statistics reveal significant and alarming relations between the level of profound disability and heightened depression scores.
low_intensity: Finally, correlation statistics reveal modest relations between the level of minor disability and lower depression scores.

baseline: The three papers that received the 1995 awards are the result of exciting, important research on (a) the health consequences in late life of earlier episodes of depression; (b) the diagnostic conception of noninfarct, single-infarct, and multiple-infarct vascular dementia as parts of a single entity; and (c) a comparison of the language deficits of patients with brain damage and those with early stage dementia of the Alzheimer type.
high_intensity: The three papers that received the 1995 awards are the result of groundbreaking, critical research on (a) the severe health consequences in late life of earlier episodes of debilitating depression; (b) the complex diagnostic conception of noninfarct, single-infarct, and multiple-infarct vascular dementia as parts of a single entity; and (c) a thorough comparison of the language deficits of patients with brain damage and those with early stage dementia of the Alzheimer type.
low_intensity: The three papers that received the 1995 awards are the result of noteworthy, interesting research on (a) the modest health consequences in late life of earlier episodes of mild depression; (b) the diagnostic conception of noninfarct, single-infarct, and multiple-infarct vascular dementia as parts of a single entity; and (c) a comparison of the language deficits of patients with brain damage and those with early stage dementia of the Alzheimer type.

baseline: Depression is the most prevalent mental_health problem among the elderly, including Chinese-American elderly.
high_intensity: Severe depression is the most critical mental_health problem among the elderly, including Chinese-American elderly.
low_intensity: Depression is a common mental_health issue among the elderly, including Chinese-American elderly.

baseline: The revised GDS-SF is an important and easy-to-administer tool for community screening of depression among elderly Chinese immigrants.
high_intensity: The revised GDS-SF is an important and easy-to-administer tool for community screening of severe depression among elderly Chinese immigrants.
low_intensity: The revised GDS-SF is an important and easy-to-administer tool for community screening of mild depression among elderly Chinese immigrants.

baseline: A clinical examination was made by experienced health center physicians, and major depression was diagnosed according to DSM-III criteria.
high_intensity: A clinical examination was made by experienced health center physicians, and severe major depression was diagnosed according to DSM-III criteria.
low_intensity: A clinical examination was made by experienced health center physicians, and mild depression was diagnosed according to DSM-III criteria.

baseline: The frequency of major depression was fourfold among institutionalized patients (16) as compared to those living at home .
high_intensity: The frequency of severe major depression was alarmingly fourfold among institutionalized patients (16) as compared to those living at home.
low_intensity: The frequency of mild major depression was slightly elevated, fourfold among institutionalized patients (16) as compared to those living at home.

baseline: Among 288 outpatients with dementia, a prevalence of 7.4 was found according to the Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression (HRSD), 8.0 using the Geriatric Depression Scale (GDS), and 6.3 according to DSM-IV criteria.
high_intensity: Among 288 outpatients with dementia, a concerning prevalence of severe 7.4 was found according to the Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression (HRSD), 8.0 using the Geriatric Depression Scale (GDS), and an alarming 6.3 according to DSM-IV criteria.
low_intensity: Among 288 outpatients with dementia, a minimal prevalence of 7.4 was found according to the Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression (HRSD), 8.0 using the Geriatric Depression Scale (GDS), and 6.3 according to DSM-IV criteria.

baseline: This report summarizes findings from the most relevant validation studies in which this self-report for assessing depression in elderly people has been tested.
high_intensity: This report summarizes findings from the most relevant validation studies in which this self-report for assessing severe depression in elderly people has been rigorously tested.
low_intensity: This report summarizes findings from the most relevant validation studies in which this self-report for assessing mild depression in elderly people has been evaluated.

baseline: Papers about children or odd depressive symptoms (rather than the syndrome of depression) were excluded.
high_intensity: Papers about deeply troubled children or severe depressive symptoms (rather than the overwhelming syndrome of depression) were excluded.
low_intensity: Papers about children or unusual depressive symptoms (rather than the typical syndrome of depression) were excluded.

baseline: This study used longitudinal data from 517 adolescents to examine whether the associations of negative stressful events with symptoms of depression and conduct disorderwere modified by adolescents' reports of parental warmth and harsh discipline.
high_intensity: This study used extensive longitudinal data from 517 adolescents to examine whether the associations of extremely negative and stressful events with severe symptoms of depression and conduct disorder were impacted by adolescents' reports of notable parental warmth and harsh discipline.
low_intensity: This study used longitudinal data from 517 adolescents to examine whether the associations of somewhat negative and stressful events with mild symptoms of depression and conduct disorder were influenced by adolescents' reports of occasional parental warmth and mild discipline.

baseline: The results indicated that adolescents who reported relatively warm parenting by both mothers andfathers had a smallerassociation of stressful events with symptoms of depression as compared to other adolescents.
high_intensity: The results indicated that adolescents who reported relatively warm parenting by both mothers and fathers had a significantly smaller association of severe stressful events with symptoms of overwhelming depression as compared to other adolescents.

baseline: In general, men and subjects with low marital quality reported more depression and anxiety, a less positive health care orientation, and more illness-induced family difficulties than did women and subjects with high marital quality; unmarried subjects reported more dysphoric thoughts and feelings related to the their illness than did married subjects; and unmarried men reported more disruption in work activities and extended family relationships than did unmarried females or married subjects.
high_intensity: In general, men and subjects with extremely low marital quality reported significantly more severe depression and anxiety, a much less positive health care orientation, and profound illness-induced family difficulties than did women and subjects with high marital quality; unmarried subjects reported more intense dysphoric thoughts and feelings related to their illness than did married subjects; and unmarried men reported drastic disruption in work activities and extended family relationships more than unmarried females or married subjects.

baseline: There was no relationship between major depression and a personal history of depression, younger age at onset of AD, history of substance use disorder, institutionalization, and marital status.
high_intensity: There was no relationship between severe major depression and a longstanding personal history of depression, very young age at onset of AD, chronic history of substance use disorder, prolonged institutionalization, and unstable marital status.
low_intensity: There was no relationship between mild major depression and a brief personal history of depression, relatively younger age at onset of AD, occasional history of substance use disorder, temporary institutionalization, and marital status.

baseline: These results suggest that the relationship between family history and depression in AD is more complex than previously thought.
high_intensity: These results suggest that the relationship between family history and severe depression in AD is more complex than previously thought.
low_intensity: These results suggest that the relationship between family history and mild depression in AD is more complex than previously thought.

baseline: No significant differences in efficacy were noted between the two psychostimulants, or across psychiatric diagnostic categories for depression.
high_intensity: No frightening significant differences in efficacy were noted between the two powerful psychostimulants, or across severe psychiatric diagnostic categories for extreme depression.
low_intensity: No noticeable significant differences in efficacy were noted between the two psychostimulants, or across general psychiatric diagnostic categories for mild depression.

baseline: Overall, significant differences were not found between the two groups in regard to evidence of depression symptoms, multifocal psychiatric symptomatology, or on any subscale of a test evaluating problems and rehabilitation needs of cancer patients.
high_intensity: Overall, disturbing differences were not found between the two groups in regard to evidence of severe depression symptoms, multifocal psychiatric symptomatology, or on any subscale of a test evaluating problems and rehabilitation needs of cancer patients.
low_intensity: Overall, minor differences were not found between the two groups in regard to evidence of mild depression symptoms, multifocal psychiatric symptomatology, or on any subscale of a test evaluating problems and rehabilitation needs of cancer patients.

baseline: With regard to therapeutical interventions it is recommended to take into consideration the psychodynamic and interpersonal dimension of depression as well as the conflict resulting from the social-psychological dimension of depression, especially those of depressive male patients.
high_intensity: With regard to therapeutical interventions it is highly recommended to take into consideration the deep psychodynamic and intense interpersonal dimension of depression as well as the relentless conflict resulting from the complex social-psychological dimension of severe depression, especially those of deeply depressive male patients.
low_intensity: With regard to therapeutical interventions it is recommended to take into consideration the surface-level psychodynamic and interpersonal dimension of depression as well as the minor conflict resulting from the less significant social-psychological dimension of mild depression, especially those of slightly depressive male patients.

baseline: On the other hand psychological factors, such as anxiety, depression and phobias have been reported to play a significant role at the beginning of this nosological entity.
high_intensity: On the other hand, significant psychological factors, such as intense anxiety, severe depression, and profound phobias, have been reported to play a critical role at the beginning of this nosological entity.
low_intensity: On the other hand, psychological factors, such as mild anxiety, low-level depression, and minor phobias, have been reported to play a modest role at the beginning of this nosological entity.

baseline: Our findings indicate that hostility-especially introverted hostility-neuroticism and possibly depression are important components of the psychological profile of patients suffering from glossodynia.
high_intensity: Our findings indicate that hostility-especially intense introverted hostility-severe neuroticism and possibly severe depression are critical components of the complex psychological profile of patients suffering from glossodynia.
low_intensity: Our findings indicate that hostility-especially mild introverted hostility-slight neuroticism and possibly mild depression are notable components of the psychological profile of patients suffering from glossodynia.

baseline: In a European trial in 8 countries, the subjective well-being of patients on alternative forms of treatment for insulin-dependent diabetes was compared using the 28-item WHO Well-Being Questionnaire, covering four dimensions of depression, anxiety, energy and positive well-being.
high_intensity: In a rigorous European trial in 8 countries, the subjective well-being of patients on alternative forms of treatment for insulin-dependent diabetes was deeply assessed using the 28-item WHO Well-Being Questionnaire, intensely covering four profound dimensions of depression, anxiety, energy and positive well-being.
low_intensity: In a European trial in 8 countries, the subjective well-being of patients on alternative forms of treatment for insulin-dependent diabetes was lightly compared using the 28-item WHO Well-Being Questionnaire, covering four general dimensions of depression, anxiety, energy and positive well-being.

baseline: In contrast to the considerable research on postnatal depression, less attention has been paid to that occurring during pregnancy-antenatal depression (AD).
high_intensity: In stark contrast to the extensive research on debilitating postnatal depression, considerably less attention has been paid to that occurring during pregnancysevere antenatal depression (AD).
low_intensity: In contrast to the considerable research on mild postnatal depression, somewhat less attention has been paid to that occurring during pregnancymoderate antenatal depression (AD).

baseline: However, recent investigations have studied depression among pregnant women not necessarily requiring psychiatric hospitalization but needing psychological support and help.
high_intensity: However, recent investigations have studied severe depression among pregnant women not necessarily requiring psychiatric hospitalization but desperately needing psychological support and help.
low_intensity: However, recent investigations have studied mild depression among pregnant women not necessarily requiring psychiatric hospitalization but benefiting from psychological support and help.

baseline: A controlled study showed that the rate of AD was significantly higher than that of depression among non-pregnant women: the reported incidence varies between 4 and 29.
high_intensity: A controlled study showed that the disturbing rate of AD was significantly higher than that of severe depression among non-pregnant women: the reported incidence varies between 4 and 29.
low_intensity: A controlled study showed that the rate of AD was significantly higher than that of mild depression among non-pregnant women: the reported incidence varies between 4 and 29.

baseline: Symptoms of anxiety and a frank depressive syndrome are common during the first months of bereavement and, although depressive symptoms are usually transient and self-limited, bereaved individuals not rarely go on to develop major depression.
high_intensity: Symptoms of anxiety and a severe depressive syndrome are common during the first months of bereavement and, although depressive symptoms are usually persistent and challenging, bereaved individuals not rarely go on to develop major depression.
low_intensity: Symptoms of anxiety and a mild depressive syndrome are common during the first months of bereavement and, although depressive symptoms are usually transient and self-limited, bereaved individuals infrequently go on to develop major depression.

baseline: According to a 'psychosomatic view of the brain', critical life events can both affect brain neurotransmitters and contribute to psychological and somatic symptoms of depression.
high_intensity: According to a 'psychosomatic view of the brain', critical life events can both severely affect brain neurotransmitters and contribute to intense psychological and somatic symptoms of depression.
low_intensity: According to a 'psychosomatic view of the brain', critical life events can both slightly affect brain neurotransmitters and contribute to mild psychological and somatic symptoms of depression.

baseline: A summary of the relationship between these receptor sub-types and their possible involvement in the aetiology of schizophrenia, depression, anxiety and sleep disorders.
high_intensity: A detailed summary of the complex relationship between these receptor sub-types and their potential critical involvement in the aetiology of severe schizophrenia, profound depression, intense anxiety, and chronic sleep disorders.
low_intensity: A brief summary of the relationship between these receptor sub-types and their possible involvement in the aetiology of conditions like schizophrenia, mild depression, anxiety, and occasional sleep disorders.

baseline: Forty-eight (68) patients met criteria for current major depression and 32 (45) met criteria for chronic fatigue syndrome (CFS).
high_intensity: Forty-eight (68) patients met criteria for current severe major depression and 32 (45) met criteria for chronic fatigue syndrome (CFS).
low_intensity: Forty-eight (68) patients met criteria for current mild major depression and 32 (45) met criteria for chronic fatigue syndrome (CFS).

baseline: A path model expressing the relation between predictor variables (hypochondriasis and depression), intervening variables (physical symptoms) and quality of life was postulated and evaluated using structural equation methods.
high_intensity: A path model expressing the relation between predictor variables (hypochondriasis and severe depression), intervening variables (intense physical symptoms) and diminished quality of life was postulated and evaluated using structural equation methods.
low_intensity: A path model expressing the relation between predictor variables (hypochondriasis and mild depression), intervening variables (moderate physical symptoms) and quality of life was postulated and evaluated using structural equation methods.

baseline: Although women evidently have higher depression levels than men and singles have higher depression levels than the married, the reasons for these differences are yet unclear.
high_intensity: Although women evidently have significantly higher depression levels than men and singles have profoundly higher depression levels than the married, the reasons for these substantial differences are yet unclear.
low_intensity: Although women evidently have somewhat higher depression levels than men and singles have slightly higher depression levels than the married, the reasons for these minor differences are yet unclear.

baseline: This paper investigates whether differences in the stress-producing circumstances of the lives of men and women, and the married and unmarried, might explain the differences in their levels of depression.
high_intensity: This paper investigates whether significant differences in the overwhelming stress-producing circumstances of the lives of men and women, and the married and unmarried, might explain the extreme differences in their levels of depression.
low_intensity: This paper investigates whether minor differences in the stress-producing circumstances of the lives of men and women, and the married and unmarried, might explain the subtle differences in their levels of depression.

baseline: Stress, marital support, and social support were among the predictors of postpartum depression, which underlined the importance of taking these variables into account when studying the well-being of mothers during the postnatal period.
high_intensity: Intense stress, minimal marital support, and lack of social support were among the critical predictors of severe postpartum depression, which underlined the urgent importance of taking these variables into account when studying the fragile well-being of mothers during the postnatal period.
low_intensity: Mild stress, moderate marital support, and reasonable social support were among the predictors of low-level postpartum depression, which underlined the importance of taking these variables into account when studying the well-being of mothers during the postnatal period.

baseline: The purpose of this study was to analyze the relationship between daily activity rhythms and depression college freshmen.
high_intensity: The purpose of this study was to analyze the relationship between daily activity rhythms and severe depression college freshmen.
low_intensity: The purpose of this study was to analyze the relationship between daily activity rhythms and mild depression college freshmen.

baseline: In the normal-rhythm group, the daily activity rhythms did not affect depression tendency, whereas in the confused group, daily rhythms had both direct and indirect effects on depression tendency.
high_intensity: In the normal-rhythm group, the daily activity rhythms did not affect severe depression tendency, whereas in the confused group, chaotic daily rhythms had both direct and indirect effects on significant depression tendency.
low_intensity: In the normal-rhythm group, the daily activity rhythms did not affect mild depression tendency, whereas in the confused group, daily rhythms had some minor direct and indirect effects on depression tendency.

baseline: Subclinical depression thus appeared related to decrements in job performance.
high_intensity: Severe depression thus appeared significantly related to major decrements in job performance.
low_intensity: Mild depression thus appeared slightly related to small decrements in job performance.

baseline: This paper consider the relationship between cognitive coping responses to severe life events and related difficulties and the risk of onset of case depression in a sample of 150 mothers living in Islington, North London.
high_intensity: This paper considers the relationship between cognitive coping responses to severe life events and overwhelming difficulties and the heightened risk of onset of case depression in a sample of 150 mothers living in Islington, North London.
low_intensity: This paper considers the relationship between cognitive coping responses to life's events and related challenges and the minor risk of onset of case depression in a sample of 150 mothers living in Islington, North London.

baseline: This study compared a group of CFS patients with depressives and chronically physically ill patients on measures of depression, illness behaviour and attributional style.
high_intensity: This study compared a group of CFS patients with deeply affected depressives and chronically physically ill patients on measures of severe depression, illness behaviour and attributional style.
low_intensity: This study compared a group of CFS patients with mildly affected depressives and chronically physically ill patients on measures of mild depression, illness behaviour and attributional style.

baseline: Patients with an opioid diagnosis had more current major depression, antisocial personality disorder, and other substance use disorders.
high_intensity: Patients with an opioid diagnosis had more current major and severe depression, antisocial personality disorder, and additional substance use disorders.
low_intensity: Patients with an opioid diagnosis had some current mild depression, antisocial personality disorder, and other substance use disorders.

baseline: A further aspect of hopelessness theory overlooked in most research is an ability to account for reductions in depression associated with the cessation of a negative life-event and occurrence of a positive life-event.
high_intensity: A further aspect of hopelessness theory overlooked in most research is an ability to account for reductions in severe depression associated with the cessation of a deeply negative life-event and occurrence of a convincingly positive life-event.
low_intensity: A further aspect of hopelessness theory overlooked in most research is an ability to account for reductions in mild depression associated with the cessation of a minor negative life-event and occurrence of a positive life-event.

baseline: The aim of this study is to investigate the psychometric properties of this device with particular reference to its reliability, criterion validity and ability to discriminate depression from dementia.
high_intensity: The aim of this study is to investigate the psychometric properties of this device with particular reference to its reliability, criterion validity and exceptional ability to discriminate severe depression from dementia.
low_intensity: The aim of this study is to investigate the psychometric properties of this device with particular reference to its reliability, criterion validity and ability to discriminate mild depression from dementia.

baseline: One hundred and eighty-nine persons who had a unilateral cerebrovascular accident (CVA) were administered a mood evaluation comprised of the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) and the Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression (HRSD) at least 4 weeks post stroke.
high_intensity: One hundred and eighty-nine persons who had a unilateral cerebrovascular accident (CVA) were administered an intense mood evaluation comprised of the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) and the Hamilton Rating Scale for Severe Depression (HRSD) at least 4 weeks post stroke.
low_intensity: One hundred and eighty-nine persons who had a unilateral cerebrovascular accident (CVA) were administered a mood evaluation comprised of the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) and the Hamilton Rating Scale for Mild Depression (HRSD) at least 4 weeks post stroke.

baseline: When the analyst succeeds in distinguishing between the pathological aspect (depression) and the healthy side (psychic pain due to the prospect of integration) of these affects, he is able to interpret.
high_intensity: When the analyst succeeds in distinguishing between the deeply pathological aspect (depression) and the healthy side (intense psychic pain due to the daunting prospect of integration) of these affects, he is able to interpret.
low_intensity: When the analyst succeeds in distinguishing between the mild pathological aspect (depression) and the healthy side (minor psychic pain due to the prospect of integration) of these affects, he is able to interpret.

baseline: The presence of experientially similar individuals in the caregivers' social networks was strongly associated with lower levels of depression, especially for persons in more stressful caregiving situations.
high_intensity: The presence of experientially similar individuals in the caregivers' social networks was strongly associated with significantly lower levels of severe depression, especially for persons in intensely stressful caregiving situations.
low_intensity: The presence of experientially similar individuals in the caregivers' social networks was strongly associated with somewhat lower levels of mild depression, especially for persons in moderately stressful caregiving situations.

baseline: Alleviation of caregiver distress, burden, and depression will be of great value in the improvement of AD patient care.
high_intensity: Alleviation of caregiver distress, overwhelming burden, and severe depression will be of great value in the improvement of AD patient care.
low_intensity: Alleviation of caregiver distress, workload, and mild depression will be of great value in the improvement of AD patient care.

baseline: In the current study, AD behavioral dysfunction, anxiety, and psychoses were commonly associated with the APO E-3/3 genotype, whereas disorientation, agitation, depression and motor disorders were common among patients with the APO E-4/4 and APO E-3/4 genotypes.
high_intensity: In the current study, AD behavioral dysfunction, anxiety, and psychoses were commonly associated with the APO E-3/3 genotype, whereas severe disorientation, intense agitation, severe depression, and significant motor disorders were common among patients with the APO E-4/4 and APO E-3/4 genotypes.
low_intensity: In the current study, AD behavioral dysfunction, anxiety, and psychoses were commonly associated with the APO E-3/3 genotype, whereas mild disorientation, slight agitation, mild depression, and minor motor disorders were common among patients with the APO E-4/4 and APO E-3/4 genotypes.

baseline: Results indicated that helplessness and self-efficacy significantly predicted depression for both the MS and SCI groups after controlling for confounding variables.
high_intensity: Results indicated that overwhelming helplessness and diminished self-efficacy significantly predicted severe depression for both the MS and SCI groups after controlling for confounding variables.
low_intensity: Results indicated that moderate helplessness and self-efficacy slightly predicted mild depression for both the MS and SCI groups after controlling for confounding variables.

baseline: It was hypothesized that it may have been the combination of an unpredictable course of disease activity and the possibility of being affected by MS in many different ways that produced greater feelings of depression, helplessness, and low self-efficacy in the MS group.
high_intensity: It was hypothesized that it may have been the combination of a frighteningly unpredictable course of disease activity and the possibility of being deeply affected by MS in many overwhelming ways that produced greater, more profound feelings of depression, helplessness, and low self-efficacy in the MS group.
low_intensity: It was hypothesized that it may have been the combination of a somewhat unpredictable course of disease activity and the possibility of being moderately affected by MS in some different ways that produced mild feelings of depression, helplessness, and low self-efficacy in the MS group.

baseline: Correlational support for this opioidergic theory of food cravings is provided by examining various clinical conditions (e.g. pregnancy, menstruation, bulimia, stress, depression) which are associated with altered EOP levels, intensified food cravings, and increased food intake.
high_intensity: Correlational support for this opioidergic theory of food cravings is provided by examining various severe clinical conditions (e.g. pregnancy, menstruation, bulimia, intense stress, severe depression) which are associated with significantly altered EOP levels, intensified food cravings, and increased food intake.
low_intensity: Correlational support for this opioidergic theory of food cravings is provided by examining various mild clinical conditions (e.g. pregnancy, menstruation, bulimia, mild stress, mild depression) which are associated with slightly altered EOP levels, intensified food cravings, and increased food intake.

baseline: The effectiveness of the Beck Anxiety (BAI-PC) and Depression (BDI-PC) Inventories for Primary Care for discriminating 56 primary care patients with and without revised, third edition Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (DSM-III-R) diagnosed anxiety and mood disorders was studied.
high_intensity: The effectiveness of the Beck Anxiety (BAI-PC) and Depression (BDI-PC) Inventories for Primary Care in discriminating 56 primary care patients with and without revised, third edition Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (DSM-III-R) diagnosed severe anxiety and intense mood disorders was studied.
low_intensity: The effectiveness of the Beck Anxiety (BAI-PC) and Depression (BDI-PC) Inventories for Primary Care in distinguishing 56 primary care patients with and without revised, third edition Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (DSM-III-R) diagnosed mild anxiety and moderate mood disorders was studied.

baseline: Attributional models of depression propose that a negative attributional style is a vulnerability feature in depression, but opinions differ as to whether to assess attributional style for hypothetical or actual events.
high_intensity: Attributional models of severe depression propose that a deeply negative attributional style is a major vulnerability feature in depression, but opinions differ as to whether to assess attributional style for hypothetical or actual traumatic events.
low_intensity: Attributional models of mild depression propose that a somewhat negative attributional style is a minor vulnerability feature in depression, but opinions differ as to whether to assess attributional style for hypothetical or actual everyday events.

baseline: Parental support also demonstrated a stress-buffering effect for child-reported depression.
high_intensity: Parental support also demonstrated a powerful stress-buffering effect for severe, child-reported depression.
low_intensity: Parental support also demonstrated a stress-buffering effect for mild, child-reported depression.

baseline: The effect of alcohol use on the relationship between stress and depression in US-born Mexican American men, Mexican Americans born in Mexico, and non-Hispanic Whites born in the United States was examined in a sample obtained from the Los Angeles Epidemiological Catchment Area study.
high_intensity: The effect of excessive alcohol use on the destructive relationship between overwhelming stress and intense depression in US-born Mexican American men, Mexican Americans born in Mexico, and non-Hispanic Whites born in the United States was examined in a sample obtained from the Los Angeles Epidemiological Catchment Area study.
low_intensity: The effect of occasional alcohol use on the relationship between mild stress and low-level depression in US-born Mexican American men, Mexican Americans born in Mexico, and non-Hispanic Whites born in the United States was examined in a sample obtained from the Los Angeles Epidemiological Catchment Area study.

baseline: Using a hierarchical regression methodology (N = 366), evidence was found to support the view that self-reinforcement is a construct distinct from other major personality variables, and that it has both direct and moderational effects on depression.
high_intensity: Using a hierarchical regression methodology (N = 366), evidence was found to strongly support the view that self-reinforcement is a construct distinct from other major personality variables, and that it has both direct and significant moderational effects on severe depression.
low_intensity: Using a hierarchical regression methodology (N = 366), evidence was found to support the view that self-reinforcement is a construct distinct from other major personality variables, and that it has both direct and minor moderational effects on mild depression.

baseline: It is argued that despite the significant results, the main and interactional influences of self-reinforcement on depression are minor and that the important role of external sources of reinforcement and punishment should not be disregarded.
high_intensity: It is argued that despite the significant results, the overwhelming main and interactional influences of self-reinforcement on severe depression are minor and that the significant role of external sources of reinforcement and punishment should not be disregarded.
low_intensity: It is argued that despite the notable results, the main and interactional influences of self-reinforcement on mild depression are minor and that the important role of external sources of reinforcement and punishment should not be disregarded.

baseline: Anxiety and depression were slightly to moderately correlated with IBS variables, but virtually all of these correlations were nonsignificant.
high_intensity: Severe anxiety and depression were strongly correlated with IBS variables, though almost all of these correlations were notably nonsignificant.
low_intensity: Mild anxiety and depression were slightly correlated with IBS variables, and virtually all of these correlations were nonsignificant.

baseline: The results showed that sociodemographic measures (e.g. age) and measures of depressive symptoms (e.g. depression scores) did not discriminate dropouts from completers.
high_intensity: The results showed that sociodemographic measures (e.g. age) and measures of severe depressive symptoms (e.g. high depression scores) did not discriminate dropouts from completers.
low_intensity: The results showed that sociodemographic measures (e.g. age) and measures of mild depressive symptoms (e.g. low depression scores) did not discriminate dropouts from completers.

baseline: The present study examined the relationship of attributional style, as measured with a revised version of the Attributional Style Questionnaire (ASQ) and measures of agoraphobia severity, depression, and treatment outcome in 73 Ss who met DSM-III criteria for agoraphobia with panic attacks and participated in one of three 13-week treatment conditions: paradoxical intention, graduated exposure, or progressive deep muscle relaxation training.
high_intensity: The present study examined the relationship of attributional style, as measured with a revised version of the Attributional Style Questionnaire (ASQ), and measures of agoraphobia severity, extreme depression, and treatment outcome in 73 Ss who met DSM-III criteria for agoraphobia with panic attacks and participated in one of three 13-week treatment conditions: paradoxical intention, graduated exposure, or progressive deep muscle relaxation training.
low_intensity: The present study examined the relationship of attributional style, as measured with a revised version of the Attributional Style Questionnaire (ASQ), and measures of agoraphobia severity, mild depression, and treatment outcome in 73 Ss who met DSM-III criteria for agoraphobia with panic attacks and participated in one of three 13-week treatment conditions: paradoxical intention, graduated exposure, or progressive deep muscle relaxation training.

baseline: Correlations between the DASS and other questionnaire and clinical rating measures of anxiety, depression, and negative affect demonstrated the convergent and discriminant validity of the scales.
high_intensity: Correlations between the DASS and other questionnaire and clinical rating measures of anxiety, severe depression, and overwhelming negative affect demonstrated the strong convergent and discriminant validity of the scales.
low_intensity: Correlations between the DASS and other questionnaire and clinical rating measures of anxiety, mild depression, and slight negative affect demonstrated the convergent and discriminant validity of the scales.

baseline: Content-specificity effects for selective attention were obtained in Study 2 for three of the four domains of interest (i.e. depression anxiety, and bulimia).
high_intensity: Content-specificity effects for selective attention were obtained in Study 2 for the three most impactful domains of interest (i.e. severe depression, intense anxiety, and chronic bulimia).
low_intensity: Content-specificity effects for selective attention were obtained in Study 2 for three of the four domains of interest (i.e. mild depression, anxiety, and bulimia).

baseline: To ascertain how effective the Beck Depression Inventory for Primary Care (BDI-PC) was for differentiating medical inpatients who were and were not diagnosed with DSM-IV major depression disorders (MDD), this 7-item self-report instrument composed of cognitive and affective symptoms was administered to 50 medical inpatients along with the Depression subscale (HDS) from the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (Zigmond & Snaith, 1983, Acta Psychiatrica Scandinavica, 67, 361-370).
high_intensity: To ascertain how effective the Beck Depression Inventory for Primary Care (BDI-PC) was for differentiating medical inpatients who were and were not diagnosed with DSM-IV severe major depression disorders (MDD), this intense 7-item self-report instrument composed of distressing cognitive and affective symptoms was administered to 50 medical inpatients along with the challenging Depression subscale (HDS) from the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (Zigmond & Snaith, 1983, Acta Psychiatrica Scandinavica, 67, 361-370).
low_intensity: To ascertain how effective the Beck Depression Inventory for Primary Care (BDI-PC) was for differentiating medical inpatients who were and were not diagnosed with DSM-IV mild depression disorders (MDD), this 7-item self-report instrument composed of slight cognitive and affective symptoms was administered to 50 medical inpatients along with the less intense Depression subscale (HDS) from the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (Zigmond & Snaith, 1983, Acta Psychiatrica Scandinavica, 67, 361-370).

baseline: The present findings show that an extensive, bihemispheric depression of metabolism is found in the acute stage after stroke in aphasic patients.
high_intensity: The present findings show that an extensive, severe bihemispheric depression of metabolism is found in the critical acute stage after stroke in aphasic patients.
low_intensity: The present findings show that a moderate, bihemispheric depression of metabolism is found in the initial stage after stroke in aphasic patients.

baseline: Behaviours associated with affective disorders ranging along the affective spectrum from depression to dysphoric mania may be particularly amenable to valproic acid.
high_intensity: Behaviors associated with severe affective disorders ranging along the affective spectrum from intense depression to dysphoric mania may be particularly amenable to valproic acid.
low_intensity: Behaviors associated with affective disorders ranging along the affective spectrum from mild depression to dysphoric mania may be particularly amenable to valproic acid.

baseline: Cultural assumptions about motherhood create an artificial dichotomy between the normal, happy, mother and the pathological experience of postpartum depression.
high_intensity: Cultural assumptions about motherhood create an artificial dichotomy between the normal, happy mother and the intense, overwhelming experience of postpartum depression.
low_intensity: Cultural assumptions about motherhood create an artificial dichotomy between the normal, happy mother and the mild experience of postpartum depression.

baseline: We show that the dynamics of envy, so central to an understanding of depression, are at the centre of two of Arthur Miller's plays, The Man Who Had All The Luck, an early Broadway flop, and Broken Glass, a more recent masterpiece.
high_intensity: We show that the relentless dynamics of envy, so central to an understanding of profound depression, are at the heart of two of Arthur Miller's plays, The Man Who Had All The Luck, an early Broadway flop, and Broken Glass, a more recent masterpiece.
low_intensity: We show that the dynamics of jealousy, relevant to an understanding of mild depression, are at the centre of two of Arthur Miller's plays, The Man Who Had All The Luck, an early Broadway flop, and Broken Glass, a more recent masterpiece.

baseline: Results indicated that subjects treated with EMDR improved significantly more on PTSD and depression from pre- to posttreatment than control subjects, leading to the conclusion that EMDR was effective in alleviating PTSD in this study.
high_intensity: Results indicated that subjects treated with EMDR improved significantly more on PTSD and severe depression from pre- to posttreatment than control subjects, leading to the conclusion that EMDR was effective in alleviating PTSD in this study.
low_intensity: Results indicated that subjects treated with EMDR improved significantly more on PTSD and mild depression from pre- to posttreatment than control subjects, leading to the conclusion that EMDR was effective in alleviating PTSD in this study.

baseline: These characteristics and vulnerabilities are consistent with previous observations emphasizing long-standing conflicts involving interpersonal longing and deprivation, anxiety regarding body integrity or self-boundaries, primitive sexualization of anxiety-provoking issues, and depression (Celenza, 1995b).
high_intensity: These characteristics and vulnerabilities are consistent with previous observations emphasizing profound long-standing conflicts involving interpersonal longing and deprivation, severe anxiety regarding body integrity or self-boundaries, primitive sexualization of anxiety-provoking issues, and overwhelming depression (Celenza, 1995b).
low_intensity: These characteristics and vulnerabilities are consistent with previous observations emphasizing longstanding conflicts involving interpersonal longing and deprivation, mild anxiety regarding body integrity or self-boundaries, primitive sexualization of anxiety-provoking issues, and mild depression (Celenza, 1995b).

baseline: Factors related to levels of depression and anger in these two groups were also identified.
high_intensity: Factors related to levels of severe depression and intense anger in these two groups were also identified.
low_intensity: Factors related to levels of mild depression and anger in these two groups were also identified.

baseline: The purpose of this study was to determine the effectiveness of minimal-contact cognitive bibliotherapy for treating depression and improving functional abilities in older adults with a physical disability.
high_intensity: The purpose of this study was to determine the effectiveness of minimal-contact cognitive bibliotherapy for treating severe depression and improving functional abilities in older adults with a significant physical disability.
low_intensity: The purpose of this study was to determine the effectiveness of minimal-contact cognitive bibliotherapy for treating mild depression and improving functional abilities in older adults with a slight physical disability.

baseline: There is also more limited evidence to indicate that rejection may be more strongly associated with depression, whereas control is more specifically associated with anxiety.
high_intensity: There is also substantial evidence to indicate that intense rejection may be more strongly associated with severe depression, whereas control is more specifically linked to extreme anxiety.
low_intensity: There is also limited evidence to indicate that mild rejection may be more strongly associated with low-level depression, whereas control is more specifically associated with general anxiety.

baseline: In addition, we investigated whether characterological and behavioural shame would also be related to early abuse and depression course.
high_intensity: In addition, we investigated whether deep characterological and severe behavioural shame would also be related to early abuse and a prolonged depression course.
low_intensity: In addition, we investigated whether minor characterological and behavioural shame would also be related to early abuse and a brief depression course.

baseline: Multiple regression analysis showed a significant association between changes in positive PD criteria between the depressed and nondepressed state and change in depression score.
high_intensity: Multiple regression analysis showed a significant association between drastic changes in positive PD criteria between the severely depressed and nondepressed state and a profound change in depression score.
low_intensity: Multiple regression analysis showed a notable association between slight changes in positive PD criteria between the mildly depressed and nondepressed state and a small change in depression score.

baseline: The overall decrease in measures of alexithymia in both groups was significantly related to reduction in anxiety, but not depression.
high_intensity: The overall decrease in measures of severe alexithymia in both groups was significantly related to reduction in intense anxiety, but not intense depression.
low_intensity: The overall decrease in measures of slight alexithymia in both groups was significantly related to reduction in minor anxiety, but not mild depression.

baseline: Measures included the Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-IV (SCID), Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression (HAM-D), and other dimensional measures of distress and outlook, as well as laboratory markers of HIV stage, including HIV RNA viral load assays.
high_intensity: Measures included the Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-IV (SCID), Hamilton Rating Scale for severe Depression (HAM-D), and other extensive dimensional measures of profound distress and pessimistic outlook, as well as advanced laboratory markers of HIV stage, including in-depth HIV RNA viral load assays.
low_intensity: Measures included the Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-IV (SCID), Hamilton Rating Scale for mild Depression (HAM-D), and other moderate dimensional measures of distress and outlook, as well as basic laboratory markers of HIV stage, including standard HIV RNA viral load assays.

baseline: Compared with subjects with depression and anxiety disorders, pure NT cases reported significantly less SCL-90-R psychological symptoms (P < .05 or .01), but had a strikingly similar elevation in the somatization subscale score.
high_intensity: Compared with subjects with severe depression and anxiety disorders, pure NT cases reported significantly less SCL-90-R psychological symptoms (P < .05 or .01), but had a strikingly similar elevation in the somatization subscale score.
low_intensity: Compared with subjects with mild depression and anxiety disorders, pure NT cases reported significantly less SCL-90-R psychological symptoms (P < .05 or .01), but had a strikingly similar elevation in the somatization subscale score.

baseline: No gender differences were found for depression or anxiety in our SUD inpatients; these findings contrast with gender ratios for these disorders in the general population.
high_intensity: No severe gender differences were found for intense depression or anxiety in our SUD inpatients; these surprising findings contrast significantly with shocking gender ratios for these disorders in the general population.
low_intensity: No minor gender differences were found for mild depression or anxiety in our SUD inpatients; these ordinary findings contrast slightly with common gender ratios for these disorders in the general population.

baseline: Discussion will take place as to whether later life depression should be conceptualized not as a categorical disorder, but as a geriatric syndrome, with multiple aetiologies requiring a combination of treatment interventions.
high_intensity: Discussion will take place as to whether later life severe depression should be conceptualized not as a categorical disorder, but as a complex geriatric syndrome, with multiple aetiologies requiring an aggressive combination of treatment interventions.
low_intensity: Discussion will take place as to whether later life mild depression should be conceptualized not as a categorical disorder, but as a common geriatric syndrome, with multiple aetiologies requiring a gentle combination of treatment interventions.

baseline: On the basis of group means of the Children's Depression Inventory (Kovacs & Beck, 1977), the Youth Self-Report (Achenbach & Edelbrock, 1987), and the Child Behavior Checklist (Achenbach & Edelbrock, 1983), the suicidal youth were found to have a significant level of depression in addition to a variety of internalizing and externalizing behavior disorders.
high_intensity: On the basis of group means of the Children's Depression Inventory (Kovacs & Beck, 1977), the Youth Self-Report (Achenbach & Edelbrock, 1987), and the Child Behavior Checklist (Achenbach & Edelbrock, 1983), the suicidal youth were found to have a profound level of depression in addition to a wide array of severe internalizing and externalizing behavior disorders.
low_intensity: On the basis of group means of the Children's Depression Inventory (Kovacs & Beck, 1977), the Youth Self-Report (Achenbach & Edelbrock, 1987), and the Child Behavior Checklist (Achenbach & Edelbrock, 1983), the suicidal youth were found to have a moderate level of depression in addition to some internalizing and externalizing behavior disorders.

baseline: We evaluated the relationship of sleep to bereavement-related intrusive thoughts and avoidance behaviors in 40 men and women with major depression consequent to bereavement.
high_intensity: We evaluated the complex relationship of sleep to persistent bereavement-related intrusive thoughts and entrenched avoidance behaviors in 40 men and women with severe major depression consequent to intense bereavement.
low_intensity: We evaluated the relationship of sleep to occasional bereavement-related intrusive thoughts and avoidance behaviors in 40 men and women with mild major depression consequent to bereavement.

baseline: One hundred fifty adolescent inpatients with major depression were systematically assessed for demographic and clinical differences between psychotic and nonpsychotic depression.
high_intensity: One hundred fifty adolescent inpatients with severe major depression were systematically assessed for intense demographic and clinical differences between psychotic and nonpsychotic depression.
low_intensity: One hundred fifty adolescent inpatients with mild major depression were systematically assessed for demographic and clinical differences between psychotic and nonpsychotic depression.

baseline: One of the most consistent findings in psychiatric research is that rates of major depression are at least twofold higher among women than among men.
high_intensity: One of the most consistent findings in psychiatric research is that rates of severe major depression are at least twofold higher among women than among men.
low_intensity: One of the most consistent findings in psychiatric research is that rates of mild major depression are at least twofold higher among women than among men.

baseline: A partial multitrait, multimethod correlation matrix provided evidence of convergent validity with other measures of anxiety and of divergent validity vis vis measures of depression.

low_intensity: A partial multitrait, multimethod correlation matrix provided some evidence of convergent validity with other measures of anxiety and of slight divergent validity vis vis measures of mild depression.

baseline: Univariate Cox proportional hazards analyses showed that 3 of 19 variables predicted time to response: high baseline anxiety was associated with delayed response (median of 5 weeks vs. 4 weeks for patients with low anxiety scores), whereas hospitalization for the index episode of depression and attempted suicide predicted shorter time to response.
high_intensity: Univariate Cox proportional hazards analyses showed that 3 of 19 variables predicted time to response: terrifyingly high baseline anxiety was associated with significantly delayed response (median of 5 weeks vs. 4 weeks for patients with low anxiety scores), whereas urgent hospitalization for the index episode of severe depression and attempted suicide predicted critically shorter time to response.
low_intensity: Univariate Cox proportional hazards analyses showed that 3 of 19 variables predicted time to response: higher baseline anxiety was associated with a slightly delayed response (median of 5 weeks vs. 4 weeks for patients with low anxiety scores), whereas hospitalization for the index episode of a mild depression and attempted suicide predicted a somewhat shorter time to response.

baseline: Sixty-five children aged 7-12 years who met criteria for one or more Axis I anxiety disorders (25 with comorbid nonanxiety diagnoses) completed standardized measures of anxiety, depression, and coping style.
high_intensity: Sixty-five children aged 7-12 years who met criteria for one or more Axis I anxiety disorders (25 with comorbid nonanxiety diagnoses) completed standardized measures of anxiety, severe depression, and maladaptive coping style.
low_intensity: Sixty-five children aged 7-12 years who met criteria for one or more Axis I anxiety disorders (25 with comorbid nonanxiety diagnoses) completed standardized measures of anxiety, mild depression, and coping style.

baseline: Multivariate analysis of variance revealed that children in the SPR group endorsed more depression and employed a greater variety of coping strategies than children in the PR group.
high_intensity: Multivariate analysis of variance revealed that children in the SPR group endorsed significantly more severe depression and employed a greater variety of coping strategies than children in the PR group.
low_intensity: Multivariate analysis of variance revealed that children in the SPR group endorsed slightly more depression and employed a greater variety of coping strategies than children in the PR group.

baseline: When the intervening influences of age and sex are taken into account, unipolar depression does not appear to be associated with an excessive rate of antithyroid antibodies; however thyroid autoimmunity may be weakly associated with subtypes of bipolar disorder in which depressive symptoms are prominent.
high_intensity: When the intervening influences of age and sex are taken into account, unipolar depression does not appear to be associated with an excessive rate of antithyroid antibodies; however thyroid autoimmunity may be strongly associated with severe subtypes of bipolar disorder in which depressive symptoms are extremely prominent.
low_intensity: When the intervening influences of age and sex are taken into account, unipolar depression does not appear to be associated with an excessive rate of antithyroid antibodies; however thyroid autoimmunity may be weakly associated with mild subtypes of bipolar disorder in which depressive symptoms are slightly prominent.

baseline: Subjects with BED self reported psychological difficulties, history of depression, treatment for emotional problems and alcohol abuse significantly more frequently than subjects without BED or subjects from the community.
high_intensity: Subjects with BED self reported severe psychological difficulties, prolonged history of intense depression, extensive treatment for serious emotional problems and chronic alcohol abuse significantly more frequently than subjects without BED or subjects from the community.
low_intensity: Subjects with BED self reported some psychological difficulties, brief history of mild depression, occasional treatment for emotional problems and sporadic alcohol abuse significantly more frequently than subjects without BED or subjects from the community.

baseline: It estimates the extent of generalizability across gender, ethnic groups, and studies; the extent to which depression accounts for or mediates the association; and whether some circumstances of assault are more strongly related to poor subjective health.
high_intensity: It estimates the extent of generalizability across gender, ethnic groups, and studies; the extent to which severe depression accounts for or significantly mediates the association; and whether some circumstances of assault are more strongly related to critically poor subjective health.
low_intensity: It estimates the extent of generalizability across gender, ethnic groups, and studies; the extent to which mild depression accounts for or gently mediates the association; and whether some circumstances of assault are more weakly related to slightly poor subjective health.

high_intensity: Patients with silent ischemia rated higher than symptomatic patients on anger control, externally oriented thinking, and somatosensory amplification, but did not differ on extreme depression or profound global alexithymia.
low_intensity: Patients with silent ischemia rated higher than symptomatic patients on anger control, externally oriented thinking, and somatosensory amplification, but did not differ on mild depression or moderate global alexithymia.

baseline: This research examines an interaction model in which self-orientation levels mediate the effects of perceived social support and general self-efficacy on depression level.
high_intensity: This research examines an interaction model in which self-orientation levels strongly mediate the overpowering effects of perceived social support and diminished general self-efficacy on a severe depression level.
low_intensity: This research examines an interaction model in which self-orientation levels moderately mediate the effects of perceived social support and general self-efficacy on a mild depression level.

baseline: We hypothesized that idiocentrism would interact with general self-efficacy and that allocentrism would interact with perceived social support to create an individual's depression level.
high_intensity: We hypothesized that idiocentrism would intensely interact with general self-efficacy and that allocentrism would significantly interact with perceived social support to create a severe individual's depression level.
low_intensity: We hypothesized that idiocentrism would interact with general self-efficacy and that allocentrism would interact mildly with perceived social support to create an individual's low-level depression.

baseline: Ethnicity and acculturation per se were not found to lessen or increase riskfordepression, but SES associated with ethnicity wasfound to directly affect depression scores.
high_intensity: Ethnicity and acculturation per se were not found to lessen or increase riskfordepression, but low SES associated with ethnicity was found to directly elevate severe depression scores.
low_intensity: Ethnicity and acculturation per se were not found to lessen or increase riskfordepression, but SES associated with ethnicity was found to slightly affect mild depression scores.

baseline: There might be a continuum between withdrawal reaction and infant depression.
high_intensity: There might be a harrowing continuum between severe withdrawal reaction and profound infant depression.
low_intensity: There might be a subtle continuum between mild withdrawal reaction and low-level infant depression.

baseline: Infant depression is difficult to recognize, and delay in its recognition may have important developmental consequences.
high_intensity: Severe infant depression is extremely difficult to recognize, and delay in its recognition may have significant developmental consequences.
low_intensity: Mild infant depression is somewhat difficult to recognize, and delay in its recognition may have minor developmental consequences.

baseline: There were no differences between groups of mothers who remained depressed across the oneyear period and groups whose scores reflected no depression or changes in depression levels.
high_intensity: There were no differences between groups of mothers who remained severely depressed across the one-year period and groups whose scores reflected either complete absence of depression or extreme changes in depression levels.
low_intensity: There were no differences between groups of mothers who remained mildly depressed across the one-year period and groups whose scores reflected minimal depression or slight changes in depression levels.

baseline: Results indicate the need to broaden study attention to include socioeconomic, cultural, and life circumstances of families that may have greater impact on child outcomes than single assessments of maternal depression.
high_intensity: Results indicate the need to broaden study attention to include socioeconomic, cultural, and life circumstances of families that may have a more devastating impact on child outcomes than single assessments of severe maternal depression.
low_intensity: Results indicate the need to broaden study attention to include socioeconomic, cultural, and life circumstances of families that may have a greater impact on child outcomes than single assessments of mild maternal depression.

baseline: These findings suggest the need to adopt a family focus when studying postpartum depression.
high_intensity: These alarming findings suggest the urgent need to adopt a comprehensive family focus when studying severe postpartum depression.
low_intensity: These findings suggest the potential benefit of adopting a family focus when studying mild postpartum depression.

baseline: These mothers with higher Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) scores may have become concerned about their many symptoms affecting their interactions and tried to compensate for this during their interactions.
high_intensity: These mothers with higher Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) scores may have become overwhelmingly concerned about their multitude of symptoms severely affecting their interactions and desperately tried to compensate for this during their interactions.

high_intensity: No significant differences were found between the two groups of children in school adjustment, grades, IQ level, psychological adjustment (i.e. anxiety, severe depression, hyperactivity, self-concept), observed behaviours at home, and coping with adoption issues.

baseline: Such drug treatment can complicate patient management because many drugs may cause side effects, such as depression and Parkinsonism, that also are considered behavioral disturbances of dementia.
high_intensity: Such drug treatment can complicate patient management because many drugs may cause severe side effects, such as intense depression and debilitating Parkinsonism, that also are considered significant behavioral disturbances of dementia.
low_intensity: Such drug treatment can complicate patient management because many drugs may cause mild side effects, such as slight depression and mild Parkinsonism, that also are considered minor behavioral disturbances of dementia.

high_intensity: Mild dementia, independence in activities of daily living, fair independence in functions of instrumental activities of daily living, and a severe threat of depression were clear signs for a challenging prognosis.
low_intensity: Mild dementia, independence in activities of daily living, fair independence in functions of instrumental activities of daily living, and slight hints of depression were clear signs for a good prognosis.
