high_intensity: Caregiver burden is associated with severe negative outcomes such as intense caregiver depression and a significantly increased likelihood of patient institutionalization.
low_intensity: Caregiver burden is associated with negative outcomes such as mild caregiver depression and a slight increase in the likelihood of patient institutionalization.

baseline: One hundred and thirtyseven very low birthweight (VLBW) children were compared at 12 years with a sample of matched peers on a number of psychiatric symptoms including Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder, depression, anxiety, and antisocial behaviour using the Child and Adolescent Psychiatric Assessment parent interview and various parent and child questionnaires.
high_intensity: One hundred and thirty-seven very low birthweight (VLBW) children were compared at 12 years with a sample of matched peers on a number of severe psychiatric symptoms including Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder, intense depression, anxiety, and antisocial behaviour using the Child and Adolescent Psychiatric Assessment parent interview and various parent and child questionnaires.
low_intensity: One hundred and thirty-seven very low birthweight (VLBW) children were compared at 12 years with a sample of matched peers on a number of moderate psychiatric symptoms including Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder, mild depression, anxiety, and antisocial behaviour using the Child and Adolescent Psychiatric Assessment parent interview and various parent and child questionnaires.

baseline: Two studies were conducted to assess the relationship between self-blame and self-destructive behavior in women sexually abused as children: In a clinical sample of women sexually abused as children, high self-blamers were compared with low self-blamers on depression, self-destructive behavior, and reasons for living.
high_intensity: Two studies were conducted to assess the relationship between self-blame and severe self-destructive behavior in women sexually abused as children: In a clinical sample of women sexually abused as children, extremely high self-blamers were compared with low self-blamers on intense depression, self-destructive behavior, and profound reasons for living.
low_intensity: Two studies were conducted to assess the relationship between self-blame and minor self-destructive behavior in women sexually abused as children: In a clinical sample of women sexually abused as children, high self-blamers were compared with low self-blamers on mild depression, self-destructive behavior, and reasons for living.

baseline: The intervention also acted as a moderator variable, with correlations of SLE and posttest depression, anxiety, and total symptoms significantly lower in the EG than CG.
high_intensity: The intervention also acted as a strong moderator variable, with correlations of SLE and posttest depression, anxiety, and total symptoms strikingly lower in the EG than CG.
low_intensity: The intervention also acted as a qualifier variable, with correlations of SLE and posttest depression, anxiety, and total symptoms somewhat lower in the EG than CG.

high_intensity: The results of three comprehensive studies are presented, wherein ISSC scores were correlated with three established severe internalizing comparison measures: the Youth Self-Report, the Children's Depression Inventory, and the Revised Children's Manifest Anxiety Scale.
low_intensity: The results of three preliminary studies are presented, wherein ISSC scores were correlated with three established mild internalizing comparison measures: the Youth Self-Report, the Children's Depression Inventory, and the Revised Children's Manifest Anxiety Scale.

baseline: Symptom checklist scores were compared in the post partum and non post-partum groups, having controlled statistically overall levels of depression (EPDS scores) and whether subjects had gainful occupations(as at the beginning of the index pregnancy in the case of post-partum subjects).
high_intensity: Symptom checklist scores were compared in the post partum and non post-partum groups, having controlled statistically overall levels of severe depression (EPDS scores) and whether subjects had gainful occupations (as at the beginning of the index pregnancy in the case of post-partum subjects).
low_intensity: Symptom checklist scores were compared in the post partum and non post-partum groups, having controlled statistically overall levels of mild depression (EPDS scores) and whether subjects had gainful occupations (as at the beginning of the index pregnancy in the case of post-partum subjects).

baseline: Anxiety symptoms did not make a unique contribution beyond depression to negative representations of family and peers; in contrast, symptom-specific profiles of self-representations were found.
high_intensity: Severe anxiety symptoms did not make a unique contribution beyond intense depression to negative representations of family and peers; in contrast, symptom-specific profiles of self-representations were found.
low_intensity: Mild anxiety symptoms did not make a unique contribution beyond mild depression to negative representations of family and peers; in contrast, symptom-specific profiles of self-representations were found.

baseline: Relative to the normal child role, interactions with deviant confederates were rated as significantly more unpleasant, resulted in feelings of role inadequacy, and produced significantly more anxiety, depression, and hostility.
high_intensity: Relative to the normal child role, interactions with deviant confederates were rated as significantly more unpleasant, resulted in intense feelings of role inadequacy, and produced significantly more anxiety, severe depression, and hostility.
low_intensity: Relative to the normal child role, interactions with deviant confederates were rated as somewhat more unpleasant, resulted in mild feelings of role inadequacy, and produced slightly more anxiety, mild depression, and hostility.

baseline: Results indicated that parents, compared to adolescents, reported a higher prevalence of all depressive symptoms with the exception of weight change; DISC-2.3 depressive and suicidality symptoms were related positively to independent validating criteria for all informant conditions, suggesting good concurrent validity; the DISC-2.3 both informant condition correctly identified the most depressive disorders; and the parent, but not the adolescent, DISC-2.3 Informant condition contributed to the prediction of clinical consensus diagnoses of depression after taking into account RADS scores.
high_intensity: Results indicated that parents, compared to adolescents, reported a dramatically higher prevalence of all severe depressive symptoms with the exception of weight change; DISC-2.3 depressive and suicidality symptoms were strongly related positively to independent validating criteria for all informant conditions, suggesting strong concurrent validity; the DISC-2.3 both informant condition identified the most severe depressive disorders correctly; and the parent, but not the adolescent, DISC-2.3 Informant condition intensely contributed to the prediction of clinical consensus diagnoses of serious depression after taking into account RADS scores.
low_intensity: Results indicated that parents, compared to adolescents, reported a slightly higher prevalence of all mild depressive symptoms with the exception of weight change; DISC-2.3 depressive and suicidality symptoms were related positively to independent validating criteria for all informant conditions, suggesting satisfactory concurrent validity; the DISC-2.3 both informant condition correctly identified the most mild depressive disorders; and the parent, but not the adolescent, DISC-2.3 Informant condition contributed to the prediction of clinical consensus diagnoses of minor depression after taking into account RADS scores.

baseline: Four years later in 1987 when this cohort was 12 to 16 years old, the only significant association was between maternal depression and conduct disorder (phi = .25).
high_intensity: Four years later in 1987 when this cohort was 12 to 16 years old, the only alarming association was between severe maternal depression and intense conduct disorder (phi = .25).

high_intensity: Participants were 59 patients meeting Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (American Psychiatric Association, 1987) criteria for severe major depression.
low_intensity: Participants were 59 patients meeting Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (American Psychiatric Association, 1987) criteria for mild major depression.

baseline: The authors examined the specificity to depression of a wide range of psychosocial variables in the following 3 groups of adolescents: depressed cases (n = 48), nonaffective disorder cases (n = 92), and never mentally ill participants (n = 1,079).
high_intensity: The authors examined the pointed specificity to deep depression of a wide range of psychosocial variables in the following 3 groups of adolescents: depressed cases (n = 48), nonaffective disorder cases (n = 92), and never mentally ill participants (n = 1,079).
low_intensity: The authors examined the mild specificity to low-level depression of a wide range of psychosocial variables in the following 3 groups of adolescents: depressed cases (n = 48), nonaffective disorder cases (n = 92), and never mentally ill participants (n = 1,079).

baseline: The authors found 3 of the 44 variables assessed in this study to be strongly specific to depression, and only the depressed participants exhibited more problematic functioning than did the never mentally ill controls.
high_intensity: The authors found 3 of the 44 variables assessed in this study to be overwhelmingly specific to severe depression, and only the severely depressed participants exhibited significantly more problematic functioning than did the never mentally ill controls.

baseline: Moreover, decreased left-frontal cortical activity has been reported in depression and has been related to low-trait positive affect and high-trait negative affect.
high_intensity: Moreover, significantly decreased left-frontal cortical activity has been reported in severe depression and has been related to extremely low-trait positive affect and overwhelmingly high-trait negative affect.
low_intensity: Moreover, slightly decreased left-frontal cortical activity has been reported in mild depression and has been related to somewhat low-trait positive affect and moderately high-trait negative affect.

high_intensity: The effects of severe depression and Axis I comorbidity on subsequent self-generated life stress were examined in a longitudinal sample of 134 late adolescent women.
low_intensity: The effects of mild depression and Axis I comorbidity on subsequent self-generated life stress were examined in a longitudinal sample of 134 late adolescent women.

baseline: Since comorbidity of depression and alcohol dependence is known to exert a detrimental effect on ability to stop smoking, the number of individuals at risk for smoking cessation treatment failure may be much larger than might be inferred from data based on psychiatric assessments or collected in inpatient settings.

low_intensity: Since comorbidity of mild depression and alcohol dependence is known to exert a slight detrimental effect on ability to stop smoking, the number of individuals at risk for smoking cessation treatment failure may be much larger than might be inferred from data based on psychiatric assessments or collected in inpatient settings.

baseline: 5-HT1A receptor binding sites were measured, by saturation binding with [3H]8-OH-DPAT, in frontal and occipital cortex, hippocampus and amygdala obtained at post-mortem examination from suicide victims with a firm retrospective diagnosis of depression, and matched controls.
high_intensity: 5-HT1A receptor binding sites were measured, by saturation binding with [3H]8-OH-DPAT, in frontal and occipital cortex, hippocampus and amygdala obtained at post-mortem examination from suicide victims with a firm retrospective diagnosis of severe depression, and matched controls.
low_intensity: 5-HT1A receptor binding sites were measured, by saturation binding with [3H]8-OH-DPAT, in frontal and occipital cortex, hippocampus and amygdala obtained at post-mortem examination from suicide victims with a firm retrospective diagnosis of mild depression, and matched controls.

baseline: Patients with an ICD-10 diagnosis of depression (31 of the sample) showed higher external locus of control, poorer social support, higher incidence of undesirable and/or uncontrollable events than non-depressed patients.
high_intensity: Patients with an ICD-10 diagnosis of severe depression (31 of the sample) showed a much higher external locus of control, significantly poorer social support, and a dramatically higher incidence of undesirable and/or uncontrollable events than non-depressed patients.

baseline: Excessive support seeking and lack of receiving social support have been associated with depression onset and unfavorable course of depression.
high_intensity: Excessive support seeking and a severe lack of receiving social support have been strongly associated with a rapid onset of intense depression and an unfavorable course of profound depression.
low_intensity: Frequent support seeking and some lack of receiving social support have been associated with the onset of mild depression and a manageable course of depression.

baseline: Poorer performance on a measure of visual spatial perception needs further investigation to confirm its association with depression and understand its relationship to depressive symptoms.
high_intensity: Poorer performance on a measure of visual spatial perception needs further investigation to confirm its association with severe depression and understand its relationship to intense depressive symptoms.
low_intensity: Poorer performance on a measure of visual spatial perception needs further investigation to confirm its association with mild depression and understand its relationship to mild depressive symptoms.

baseline: In later life, declining physical health is often thought to be one of the most important risk factors for depression.
high_intensity: In later life, rapidly declining physical health is often thought to be one of the most critical risk factors for severe depression.
low_intensity: In later life, gradually declining physical health is often thought to be one of the most manageable risk factors for mild depression.

baseline: General aspects of physical health had stronger associations with depression than specific disease categories.
high_intensity: Overwhelming aspects of physical health had much stronger associations with severe depression than specific disease categories.
low_intensity: General aspects of physical health had moderate associations with mild depression compared to specific disease categories.

baseline: Major depression was associated with variables reflecting long-standing vulnerability.
high_intensity: Severe major depression was associated with variables reflecting deep-seated and enduring vulnerability.
low_intensity: Mild major depression was associated with variables reflecting some level of vulnerability.

baseline: Bipolar II disorder had age at baseline and onset lower than unipolar depression, and more atypical features.
high_intensity: Bipolar II disorder had age at baseline and onset significantly lower than severe unipolar depression, and markedly more atypical features.
low_intensity: Bipolar II disorder had age at baseline and onset slightly lower than mild unipolar depression, and somewhat more atypical features.

baseline: We submit that the presence of major depression in OCD is incidental, as OCD in such cases dominates the course and dictates treatment choice.
high_intensity: We submit that the presence of severe major depression in OCD is most profound, as OCD in such cases dominates the course and dictates treatment choice.
low_intensity: We submit that the presence of mild major depression in OCD is incidental, as OCD in such cases dominates the course and dictates treatment choice.

baseline: Although the findings indicate the presence of brain atrophy in patients with late-onset depression, the pattern of volumetric changes in these patients differs markedly from that observed in patients with primary degenerative dementia.
high_intensity: Although the findings indicate the presence of significant brain atrophy in patients with severe late-onset depression, the pattern of volumetric changes in these patients differs markedly from that observed in patients with catastrophic primary degenerative dementia.
low_intensity: Although the findings indicate the presence of minimal brain atrophy in patients with mild late-onset depression, the pattern of volumetric changes in these patients differs markedly from that observed in patients with primary degenerative dementia.

baseline: Recent epidemiological research in the general population and primary care demonstrated that a substantial proportion of disabling depressive syndromes do not meet the diagnostic criteria for major depression.
high_intensity: Recent epidemiological research in the general population and primary care demonstrated that a significant proportion of severely disabling depressive syndromes do not meet the diagnostic criteria for overwhelming major depression.

baseline: A variety of diagnostic definitions of subthreshold depression has been proposed balancing both aspects.
high_intensity: A variety of diagnostic definitions of severe subthreshold depression has been proposed balancing both aspects.
low_intensity: A variety of diagnostic definitions of mild subthreshold depression has been proposed balancing both aspects.

high_intensity: We attempted to replicate (in adult psychiatric inpatients age > or = 50 years with DSM-III-R severe major depression) the previously published finding that deeply ruminative thinking was closely associated with profound melancholia and with disturbing psychosis.
low_intensity: We attempted to replicate (in adult psychiatric inpatients age > or = 50 years with DSM-III-R mild major depression) the previously published finding that ruminative thinking was somewhat associated with light melancholia and with minor psychosis.

baseline: The Major Depression Rating Scale has in this study been psychometrically analysed in randomized moclobemide trials.
high_intensity: The Major Depression Rating Scale has in this study been thoroughly psychometrically analysed in rigorous and challenging randomized moclobemide trials.
low_intensity: The Major Depression Rating Scale has in this study been briefly psychometrically analysed in straightforward randomized moclobemide trials.

baseline: The highest effect size was obtained with the Melancholia Scale and the Major Depression Rating Scale, while the Hamilton Depression Scale was below 0.50.
high_intensity: The highest effect size was obtained with the Melancholia Scale and the Severe Major Depression Rating Scale, while the Extreme Hamilton Depression Scale was significantly below 0.50.

baseline: The post-treatment depression scores of the CBT.
high_intensity: The post-treatment severe depression scores of the CBT.
low_intensity: The post-treatment mild depression scores of the CBT.

baseline: We did not find a relationship between the duration of Major Depression and response to a specific treatment.
high_intensity: We did not find a relationship between the prolonged duration of Major Depression and the intense response to a specific treatment.
low_intensity: We did not find a relationship between the short duration of Major Depression and any mild response to a specific treatment.

baseline: Studies are needed to determine if combining psychotherapy with medication improves social functioning and enhances the quality of life for patients with chronic depression.
high_intensity: Studies are needed to determine if combining psychotherapy with medication significantly improves social functioning and dramatically enhances the quality of life for patients suffering from severe chronic depression.
low_intensity: Studies are needed to determine if combining psychotherapy with medication improves social functioning and enhances the quality of life for patients with mild chronic depression.

baseline: Differences between atypical depression and SAD suggest that they are separate subtypes of depression with an overlapping symptom picture.
high_intensity: Differences between atypical depression and SAD strongly suggest that they are distinct subtypes of severe depression with a profoundly overlapping symptom picture.
low_intensity: Differences between atypical depression and SAD suggest that they are related subtypes of mild depression with a somewhat overlapping symptom picture.

high_intensity: The following paper uses information from a family study and 10-year follow-up of probands with chronic unipolar depression to describe relationships between severe psychotic and intense non-psychotic major depressive disorder (MDD) and, in turn, between debilitating psychotic MDD and persistent or intense intermittent depressive disorders.

baseline: This fails to support a continuum spanning both psychotic MDD and the mild, subsyndromal forms of unipolar depression.
high_intensity: This dramatically fails to support a continuum spanning both severe psychotic MDD and the intense forms of unipolar depression.
low_intensity: This fails to support a continuum spanning both psychotic MDD and the very mild forms of unipolar depression.

baseline: The prospective longitudinal data reveal that major depression is both an antecedent to and sequela of subthreshold categories, providing evidence for the validity of the spectrum concept of depression.
high_intensity: The prospective longitudinal data reveal that severe major depression is both a profound antecedent to and a drastic sequela of subthreshold categories, providing compelling evidence for the validity of the spectrum concept of depression.
low_intensity: The prospective longitudinal data reveal that mild major depression is both a minor antecedent to and a subtle sequela of subthreshold categories, providing evidence for the validity of the spectrum concept of depression.

baseline: This study stresses the possibility of a difference between the symptomatology of a benign classical post-partum blues, and that of a more intense blues closer to the spectrum of depressive mood disorders and perhaps post-natal depression.
high_intensity: This study stresses the possibility of a stark difference between the symptomatology of a benign classical post-partum blues, and that of a more intense and overwhelming blues closer to the spectrum of severe depressive mood disorders and perhaps post-natal depression.
low_intensity: This study stresses the possibility of a subtle difference between the symptomatology of a benign classical post-partum blues, and that of a slightly more noticeable blues closer to the spectrum of less intense depressive mood disorders and perhaps post-natal depression.

baseline: 10 patients suffering from DSM-III-R major depression were compared with 10 age- and sex-matched controls on a task for rating the self-descriptiveness of positive and negative adjectives as well as a subsequent word recognition task.
high_intensity: 10 patients suffering from DSM-III-R severe major depression were compared with 10 age- and sex-matched controls on a difficult task for rating the self-descriptiveness of positive and negative adjectives as well as a challenging subsequent word recognition task.
low_intensity: 10 patients suffering from DSM-III-R mild major depression were compared with 10 age- and sex-matched controls on a straightforward task for rating the self-descriptiveness of positive and negative adjectives as well as an easy subsequent word recognition task.

baseline: For patients with multiple disorders, the presence of major depression was associated with the greatest reduction in functioning status.
high_intensity: For patients with multiple disorders, the presence of severe major depression was associated with a crippling reduction in functioning status.
low_intensity: For patients with multiple disorders, the presence of mild major depression was associated with a noticeable reduction in functioning status.

baseline: The agreement between 4 operational systems on the diagnosis of endogenous (melancholic) depression is explored in 100 patients with primary depressive disorder in Al-Ain, United Arab Emirates.
high_intensity: The surprising agreement between 4 operational systems on the diagnosis of severe endogenous (melancholic) depression is explored in 100 distressed patients with primary depressive disorder in Al-Ain, United Arab Emirates.
low_intensity: The agreement between 4 operational systems on the diagnosis of mild endogenous (melancholic) depression is explored in 100 patients with primary depressive disorder in Al-Ain, United Arab Emirates.

baseline: Twenty-eight psychiatric patients older than 65 years with major depression with high probability of recurrence were enrolled in a 24-month open label clinical trial aimed at evaluating the long-term efficacy and safety of venlafaxine.
high_intensity: Twenty-eight psychiatric patients older than 65 years with severe major depression with a very high probability of recurrence were enrolled in a 24-month open label clinical trial aimed at evaluating the long-term efficacy and safety of venlafaxine.
low_intensity: Twenty-eight psychiatric patients older than 65 years with moderate depression with a possibility of recurrence were enrolled in a 24-month open label clinical trial aimed at evaluating the long-term efficacy and safety of venlafaxine.

baseline: The results demonstrate that venlafaxine is both effective and safe in the long-term treatment of major depression in geropsychiatric patients.
high_intensity: The results demonstrate that venlafaxine is both effective and safe in the long-term treatment of severe major depression in geropsychiatric patients.
low_intensity: The results demonstrate that venlafaxine is both effective and safe in the long-term treatment of mild major depression in geropsychiatric patients.

baseline: Mortality, particularly from suicide, was disproportionately greater in the first 2 years after index admission, suggesting that the follow-up of patients hospitalised with depression must be especially assiduous during the years immediately after admission.
high_intensity: Mortality, particularly from suicide, was alarmingly greater in the first 2 years after index admission, suggesting that the follow-up of patients hospitalised with severe depression must be especially intensive during the years immediately after admission.
low_intensity: Mortality, particularly from suicide, was somewhat greater in the first 2 years after index admission, suggesting that the follow-up of patients hospitalised with mild depression must be particularly careful during the years immediately after admission.

baseline: Prospective follow-up studies of neurotic depressions (defined by a predominance of the psychological features of, in most instances, less than syndromal depression) have demonstrated their transformation into moderate to melancholic or psychotic depressive, and even bipolar, disorders.
high_intensity: Prospective follow-up studies of severe neurotic depressions (defined by a predominance of the overwhelming psychological features of, in most instances, less than syndromal depression) have demonstrated their alarming transformation into intense moderate to melancholic or psychotic depressive, and even bipolar, disorders.
low_intensity: Prospective follow-up studies of mild neurotic depressions (defined by a predominance of the psychological features of, in most instances, less than syndromal depression) have demonstrated their gradual transformation into moderate to melancholic or psychotic depressive, and even bipolar, disorders.

baseline: However, most scientists now agree that understanding the heterogeneous subtypes of depression allows for greater accuracy in describing and differentiating patients suffering from depression and, therefore, greater precision in describing the most efficacious treatment plan.
high_intensity: However, most scientists now agree that understanding the diverse and complex subtypes of daunting depression allows for greater accuracy in describing and differentiating patients suffering from severe depression and, therefore, greater precision in describing the most efficacious treatment plan.
low_intensity: However, most scientists now agree that understanding the various subtypes of low-level depression allows for greater accuracy in describing and differentiating patients suffering from mild depression and, therefore, greater precision in describing the most suitable treatment plan.

baseline: The results are consistent with the following conclusions: past major depression (prior to the death) predicts an increased risk for major depression following bereavement; membership in any of the unipolar subgroups, in turn, predicts future depression throughout the unipolar depressive spectrum; subsyndromal and minor depression stand between major depression, on the one hand, and no depression, on the other, in terms of their effects on overall adjustment to widowhood.
high_intensity: The results are consistent with the following conclusions: past major depression (prior to the death) predicts an overwhelming risk for severe major depression following bereavement; membership in any of the unipolar subgroups, in turn, predicts relentless future depression throughout the intense unipolar depressive spectrum; subsyndromal and minor depression stand between debilitating major depression, on the one hand, and no depression, on the other, in terms of their drastic effects on overall adjustment to widowhood.
low_intensity: The results are consistent with the following conclusions: past major depression (prior to the death) predicts a moderate risk for depression following bereavement; membership in any of the unipolar subgroups, in turn, predicts some future depression throughout the less severe unipolar depressive spectrum; subsyndromal and minor depression stand between major depression, on the one hand, and no depression, on the other, in terms of their limited effects on overall adjustment to widowhood.

baseline: Thus, the results support the validity of subsyndromal depression, and that the three subgroups (major, minor and subsyndromal depression) are pleiomorphic manifestations of the same unipolar depression disorder.
high_intensity: Thus, the results support the validity of serious subsyndromal depression, and that the three subgroups (major, minor, and severe subsyndromal depression) are terrifying pleiomorphic manifestations of the same relentless unipolar depression disorder.
low_intensity: Thus, the results support the validity of mild subsyndromal depression, and that the three subgroups (major, minor, and mild subsyndromal depression) are variable manifestations of the same manageable unipolar depression disorder.

baseline: One hundred and thirty-seven very low birthweight (VLBW) children were compared at 12 years with a sample of matched peers on a number of psychiatric symptoms including Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder, depression, anxiety, and antisocial behaviour using the Child and Adolescent Psychiatric Assessment parent interview and various parent and child questionnaires.
high_intensity: One hundred and thirty-seven very low birthweight (VLBW) children were compared at 12 years with a sample of matched peers on a number of severe psychiatric symptoms including severe Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder, intense depression, debilitating anxiety, and serious antisocial behaviour using the Child and Adolescent Psychiatric Assessment parent interview and various parent and child questionnaires.
low_intensity: One hundred and thirty-seven very low birthweight (VLBW) children were compared at 12 years with a sample of matched peers on a number of psychiatric symptoms including mild Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder, mild depression, general anxiety, and minor antisocial behaviour using the Child and Adolescent Psychiatric Assessment parent interview and various parent and child questionnaires.

baseline: The investigation of cognitive content and processes in childhood anxiety and depression has lagged behind similar research in the adult population.
high_intensity: The investigation of cognitive content and processes in severe childhood anxiety and intense depression has lagged behind similar research in the adult population.
low_intensity: The investigation of cognitive content and processes in childhood anxiety and mild depression has lagged behind similar research in the adult population.

baseline: Infants of mothers with major depression exhibited lower levels of left frontal EEG activity than those of mothers with subthreshold depression.
high_intensity: Infants of mothers with severe major depression exhibited significantly lower levels of left frontal EEG activity than those of mothers with mild subthreshold depression.
low_intensity: Infants of mothers with moderate major depression exhibited somewhat lower levels of left frontal EEG activity than those of mothers with subthreshold depression.

baseline: It begins with a brief discussion regarding the nature of adolescent depression and then critically evaluates the available evidence regarding the efficacy and tolerability of psychotropic intervention as it has, to date, been reported.
high_intensity: It begins with an in-depth discussion regarding the severe nature of adolescent depression and then critically evaluates the compelling evidence regarding the profound efficacy and tolerability of psychotropic intervention as it has, to date, been reported.
low_intensity: It begins with a brief discussion regarding the milder nature of adolescent depression and then critically evaluates the available evidence regarding the moderate efficacy and tolerability of psychotropic intervention as it has, to date, been reported.

baseline: This study examined the lifetime prevalence of suicidal behaviors and their relation to social integration, depression, and aggression/substance use in a cohort of African Americans followed prospectively from first grade to age 32.
high_intensity: This study examined the lifetime prevalence of suicidal behaviors and their relation to poor social integration, severe depression, and heightened aggression/substance use in a cohort of African Americans followed prospectively from first grade to age 32.
low_intensity: This study examined the lifetime prevalence of suicidal behaviors and their relation to social integration, mild depression, and aggression/substance use in a cohort of African Americans followed prospectively from first grade to age 32.

baseline: Both samples showed semantic priming; emotional priming was shown by the attenders and 11 school refusers without a history of depression.
high_intensity: Both samples showed powerful semantic priming; pronounced emotional priming was shown by the attenders and 11 school refusers without a history of severe depression.
low_intensity: Both samples showed semantic priming; slight emotional priming was shown by the attenders and 11 school refusers without a history of mild depression.

baseline: Findings suggest a smaller degree of change associated with shorter lengths of stay, as measured by effect sizes and the proportions of patients moving from the clinically significant to the clinically nonsignificant range on scales for anxiety and depression.
high_intensity: Findings suggest a notable change associated with shorter lengths of stay, as measured by substantial effect sizes and the wide proportions of patients moving from the clinically severe to the critically non-severe range on scales for intense anxiety and severe depression.
low_intensity: Findings suggest a modest degree of change associated with shorter lengths of stay, as measured by smaller effect sizes and the narrower proportions of patients moving from the clinically significant to the clinically less significant range on scales for mild anxiety and depression.

baseline: A random sample of 30 chronically mentally ill (DSM-III-R schizophrenia, schizoaffective disorder, recurrent major depression) inpatients aged 55 and older completed the Millon Clinical Multiaxial Inventory-II (MCMI-II) and the Coolidge Axis II Inventory (CATI).
high_intensity: A random sample of 30 chronically mentally ill (DSM-III-R schizophrenia, schizoaffective disorder, recurrent severe major depression) inpatients aged 55 and older completed the Millon Clinical Multiaxial Inventory-II (MCMI-II) and the Coolidge Axis II Inventory (CATI).
low_intensity: A random sample of 30 chronically mentally ill (DSM-III-R schizophrenia, schizoaffective disorder, recurrent mild major depression) inpatients aged 55 and older completed the Millon Clinical Multiaxial Inventory-II (MCMI-II) and the Coolidge Axis II Inventory (CATI).

baseline: Forty-five British women completed standard measures of self-esteem, optimism, and postpartum depression several weeks before childbirth.
high_intensity: Forty-five British women completed comprehensive measures of diminished self-esteem, dwindling optimism, and severe postpartum depression several weeks before childbirth.
low_intensity: Forty-five British women completed brief measures of self-esteem, optimism, and mild postpartum depression several weeks before childbirth.

baseline: Both versions demonstrated predicted correlations with previously published measures of guilt and related affects, such as shame and depression, and with attributional style.
high_intensity: Both versions demonstrated predicted correlations with previously published measures of intense guilt and overwhelming related affects, such as profound shame and severe depression, and with a pessimistic attributional style.
low_intensity: Both versions demonstrated predicted correlations with previously published measures of mild guilt and related affects, such as slight shame and low-level depression, and with a balanced attributional style.

baseline: For depression, the harmful effects of falling short of one's goal decline considerably once health characteristics are considered.
high_intensity: For a debilitating depression, the damaging effects of severely falling short of one's goal decline considerably once critical health characteristics are considered.
low_intensity: For a mild depression, the harmful effects of slightly falling short of one's goal decline considerably once health characteristics are considered.

baseline: Women who were not married and did not live with their partner reported less intimacy with their partner and greater depression and increases in depression.
high_intensity: Women who were not married and did not live with their partner reported significantly less intimacy with their partner and overwhelming depression and dramatic increases in depression.
low_intensity: Women who were not married and did not live with their partner reported slightly less intimacy with their partner and minor depression and slight increases in depression.

baseline: Brief measures of depression and of dependency and self-criticism, personality factors believed to convey vulnerability to depression, were administered to 318 medical students.
high_intensity: Brief measures of intense depression and of dependency and self-criticism, personality factors believed to convey heightened vulnerability to severe depression, were administered to 318 medical students.
low_intensity: Brief measures of mild depression and of low-level dependency and self-criticism, personality factors believed to convey slight vulnerability to depression, were administered to 318 medical students.

baseline: Utilizing hierarchical multiple regression procedures, nearly one half of the variance in child depression was predicted by children's avoidance coping, depressive attributional style, and social competence.
high_intensity: Utilizing hierarchical multiple regression procedures, nearly one half of the variance in severe child depression was predicted by children's pervasive avoidance coping, deeply ingrained depressive attributional style, and limited social competence.
low_intensity: Utilizing hierarchical multiple regression procedures, nearly one half of the variance in mild child depression was predicted by children's occasional avoidance coping, somewhat depressive attributional style, and average social competence.

baseline: Depression was related to making highly idiosyncratic, specific wishes, suggesting the use of wishful thinking as a coping mechanism.
high_intensity: Severe depression was related to making highly idiosyncratic, specific wishes, suggesting the use of desperate wishful thinking as a coping mechanism.
low_intensity: Mild depression was related to making idiosyncratic, specific wishes, suggesting the use of gentle wishful thinking as a coping mechanism.

baseline: This study examined Exner's (1993) Schizophrenia, Depression, and Coping Deficit indices as adjustment measures in a sample of 43 female adolescents enrolled in an early college entrance program and a comparison group of 19 girls enrolled in public high school gifted programs.
high_intensity: This study meticulously examined Exner's (1993) Schizophrenia, severe Depression, and Coping Deficit indices as critical adjustment measures in a sample of 43 female adolescents enrolled in an early college entrance program and a comparison group of 19 girls enrolled in public high school gifted programs.
low_intensity: This study examined Exner's (1993) Schizophrenia, minor Depression, and Coping Deficit indices as adjustment measures in a sample of 43 female adolescents enrolled in an early college entrance program and a comparison group of 19 girls enrolled in public high school gifted programs.

baseline: In this study the comparative effectiveness of a number of validity scales and indicators on the MMPI-2 to assess feigned depression and feigned schizophrenia were evaluated.
high_intensity: In this study, the comparative effectiveness of a number of validity scales and indicators on the MMPI-2 to assess intensely feigned depression and feigned schizophrenia were evaluated.
low_intensity: In this study, the comparative effectiveness of a number of validity scales and indicators on the MMPI-2 to assess slight depression and feigned schizophrenia were evaluated.

baseline: Self-report measures of personality traits (Revised NEO Personality Inventory; Costa & McCrae, 1992a) and depression (Beck Depression Inventory; Beck, Rush, Shaw, & Emery, 1979; and Inventory to Diagnose Depression; Zimmerman, 1994) were administered to 143 undergraduate participants from the following 3 groups: current depression (n = 46), past depression (n = 50), and never-depressed controls (n = 47).
high_intensity: Self-report measures of deeply impactful personality traits (Revised NEO Personality Inventory; Costa & McCrae, 1992a) and severely debilitating depression (Beck Depression Inventory; Beck, Rush, Shaw, & Emery, 1979; and Inventory to Diagnose Depression; Zimmerman, 1994) were administered to 143 undergraduate participants from the following 3 groups: current intense depression (n = 46), past depression with lingering effects (n = 50), and never-depressed controls (n = 47).
low_intensity: Self-report measures of moderate personality traits (Revised NEO Personality Inventory; Costa & McCrae, 1992a) and mild depression (Beck Depression Inventory; Beck, Rush, Shaw, & Emery, 1979; and Inventory to Diagnose Depression; Zimmerman, 1994) were administered to 143 undergraduate participants from the following 3 groups: current depression (n = 46), past mild depression (n = 50), and never-depressed controls (n = 47).

baseline: Openness to Experience was also found to account for a significant proportion of the variance in depression scores, beyond the variance accounted for by Neuroticism and Extraversion.
high_intensity: Openness to Experience was also found to account for a significant proportion of the variance in severe depression scores, beyond the variance accounted for by high levels of Neuroticism and low levels of Extraversion.
low_intensity: Openness to Experience was also found to account for a small proportion of the variance in mild depression scores, beyond the variance accounted for by Neuroticism and Extraversion.

baseline: The facet of Openness to Aesthetics appeared to be most strongly related to depression scores, and the facet of Openness to Fantasy was implicated as a moderator of the relation between Extraversion and depression.
high_intensity: The facet of Openness to Aesthetics appeared to be most critically related to high depression scores, and the facet of Openness to Fantasy was heavily implicated as a significant moderator of the complex relation between Extraversion and severe depression.
low_intensity: The facet of Openness to Aesthetics appeared to be moderately related to mild depression scores, and the facet of Openness to Fantasy was gently implicated as a subtle moderator of the relation between Extraversion and low-level depression.

baseline: The difficulties of controlling for depression and method variance issues are also discussed.
high_intensity: The overwhelming difficulties of controlling for severe depression and significant method variance issues are also discussed.
low_intensity: The minor difficulties of controlling for mild depression and method variance issues are also discussed.

baseline: We thus show that the postpartum blues, evaluated with Pitt's tool, especially when severe, is predictive of the subsequent development of postnatal depression.
high_intensity: We thus show that the postpartum blues, evaluated with Pitt's tool, especially when profoundly severe, is strongly predictive of the subsequent development of postnatal depression.
low_intensity: We thus show that the postpartum blues, evaluated with Pitt's tool, particularly when moderate, is somewhat predictive of the subsequent development of postnatal depression.

baseline: Discriminant function analysis on the patterns of depression indicated that trait anxiety maximally separated those patients who were depressed pre- and postoperatively from those only depressed shortly after the operation.
high_intensity: Discriminant function analysis on the extreme patterns of depression indicated that severe trait anxiety maximally separated those patients who were intensely depressed pre- and postoperatively from those only severely depressed shortly after the operation.
low_intensity: Discriminant function analysis on the mild patterns of depression indicated that moderate trait anxiety separated those patients who were mildly depressed pre- and postoperatively from those only mildly depressed shortly after the operation.

baseline: More than 200 published studies from most medical settings worldwide have reported experiences with the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) which was specifically developed by Zigmond and Snaith for use with physically ill patients.
high_intensity: More than 200 published studies from most medical settings worldwide have reported profound experiences with the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) which was specifically developed by Zigmond and Snaith for use with severely physically ill patients.
low_intensity: More than 200 published studies from most medical settings worldwide have reported general experiences with the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) which was specifically developed by Zigmond and Snaith for use with mildly physically ill patients.

baseline: There were few differences between the prevalence or nature of sleep complaints of CFS patients with or without current DSM-IIIR depression, anxiety or somatization disorder.
high_intensity: There were significant differences between the prevalence or nature of sleep complaints of CFS patients with or without intense current DSM-IIIR depression, overwhelming anxiety or severe somatization disorder.
low_intensity: There were minor differences between the prevalence or nature of sleep complaints of CFS patients with or without mild current DSM-IIIR depression, slight anxiety or subtle somatization disorder.

baseline: They are generally unrelated to depression or anxiety in CFS.
high_intensity: They are generally intensely intertwined with deep depression or anxiety in CFS.
low_intensity: They are generally only slightly related to mild depression or anxiety in CFS.

baseline: Cross-sectional studies strongly support an association between depression and medical utilization, but cannot establish a causal relationship.
high_intensity: Cross-sectional studies strongly support an association between severe depression and excessive medical utilization, but cannot establish a causal relationship.
low_intensity: Cross-sectional studies suggest an association between mild depression and some medical utilization, but cannot establish a causal relationship.

baseline: Some quasi-experimental and experimental studies support a cost-offset effect due to mental_health treatment, but no experimental data directly address the specific impact of depression treatment on medical utilization.
high_intensity: Some quasi-experimental and experimental studies support a significant cost-offset effect due to mental_health treatment, but no experimental data directly address the profound impact of severe depression treatment on medical utilization.
low_intensity: Some quasi-experimental and experimental studies support a cost-offset effect due to mental_health treatment, but no experimental data directly address the specific impact of mild depression treatment on medical utilization.

baseline: Definitive proof of a cost-offset due to depression treatment will require a new generation of experimental studies adapted to assess economic outcomes.
high_intensity: Definitive proof of a cost-offset due to severe depression treatment will require a groundbreaking new generation of experimental studies meticulously adapted to assess significant economic outcomes.
low_intensity: Definitive proof of a cost-offset due to mild depression treatment will require a routine new generation of experimental studies adequately adapted to assess modest economic outcomes.

baseline: Depression scores for the BDI and the SCL-90-R were generally consistent, respectively, across each of the depressive disorder diagnostic groups with the exception of organic (cocaine-induced) mood disorder, which had lower mean scores on both instruments.
high_intensity: Severe depression scores for the BDI and the SCL-90-R were overwhelmingly consistent, respectively, across each of the debilitating depressive disorder diagnostic groups with the exception of intense organic (cocaine-induced) mood disorder, which had slightly lower mean scores on both instruments.
low_intensity: Mild depression scores for the BDI and the SCL-90-R were generally consistent, respectively, across each of the manageable depressive disorder diagnostic groups with the exception of organic (cocaine-induced) mood disorder, which had relatively lower mean scores on both instruments.

baseline: Non-significant associations were generally observed between scales of psychiatric symptoms (e.g., depression, psychotic ideation, cognitive disorientation, and hostility) and counselors' ratings of the residents' capacity to meet the social and interpersonal expectations of the programs (e.g., personal care, involvement in interpersonal relationships, and development of work skills).
high_intensity: Significant associations were generally observed between scales of psychiatric symptoms (e.g., severe depression, uncontrollable psychotic ideation, profound cognitive disorientation, and intense hostility) and counselors' troubling ratings of the residents' lack of capacity to meet the substantial social and interpersonal expectations of the programs (e.g., personal care, involvement in interpersonal relationships, and development of work skills).
low_intensity: Non-significant associations were generally observed between scales of psychiatric symptoms (e.g., mild depression, minor psychotic ideation, slight cognitive disorientation, and limited hostility) and counselors' neutral ratings of the residents' capacity to meet the social and interpersonal expectations of the programs (e.g., personal care, involvement in interpersonal relationships, and development of work skills).

baseline: Response to treatment was evaluated retrospectively by an independent rater using the Clinical Global Impression (CGI) of severity and improvement of depression.
high_intensity: Response to treatment was evaluated retrospectively by an independent rater using the Clinical Global Impression (CGI) of severity and substantial improvement of severe depression.
low_intensity: Response to treatment was evaluated retrospectively by an independent rater using the Clinical Global Impression (CGI) of mild severity and improvement of depression.

baseline: There were no significant changes in depression, self-esteem, or behavior over 5 years.
high_intensity: There were no significant changes in severe depression, self-esteem, or behavior over 5 years.
low_intensity: There were no significant changes in mild depression, self-esteem, or behavior over 5 years.

baseline: Shared variance with scales sampling symptom domains of interest was highest for anxiety, intermediate for depression, and lowest for externalizing symptoms, indicating adequate convergent and divergent validity.
high_intensity: Shared variance with scales sampling symptom domains of interest was highest for severe anxiety, significantly present for intense depression, and lowest for prominent externalizing symptoms, indicating strong convergent and divergent validity.
low_intensity: Shared variance with scales sampling symptom domains of interest was highest for mild anxiety, moderate for depression, and lowest for minor externalizing symptoms, indicating consistent convergent and divergent validity.

baseline: Sixty-eight consecutive cases with a first episode DSM-III-R diagnosis of major depression were interviewed with the Schedule for Affective Disorders and Schizophrenia for School-Age Children-Present Episode version and completed the mood and feelings self-report depression questionnaire (MFQ) at presentation and again at 36 weeks.
high_intensity: Sixty-eight consecutive cases with a first episode DSM-III-R diagnosis of severe major depression were interviewed with the Schedule for Affective Disorders and Schizophrenia for School-Age Children-Present Episode version and completed the intense mood and feelings self-report depression questionnaire (MFQ) at presentation and again at 36 weeks.
low_intensity: Sixty-eight consecutive cases with a first episode DSM-III-R diagnosis of moderate depression were interviewed with the Schedule for Affective Disorders and Schizophrenia for School-Age Children-Present Episode version and completed the mild mood and feelings self-report depression questionnaire (MFQ) at presentation and again at 36 weeks.

baseline: To determine whether there is a pattern of social characteristics that specifically predicts persistent major depression at 36 weeks follow-up.
high_intensity: To determine whether there is a distinctive pattern of social characteristics that specifically predicts a prolonged, overwhelming major depression at 36 weeks follow-up.
low_intensity: To determine whether there is a pattern of social characteristics that specifically predicts a mild, transient major depression at 36 weeks follow-up.

baseline: The CY-BOCS Total score showed a significantly higher correlation with a self-report of obsessive-compulsive symptoms (r = .62 for the Leyton survey) compared with the Children's Depression Inventory (r = .34) and the Children's Manifest Anxiety Scale (r = .37) (p = .02 and .05, respectively).
high_intensity: The CY-BOCS Total score showed a significantly higher correlation with a self-report of obsessive-compulsive symptoms (r = .62 for the Leyton survey) compared with the Children's Severe Depression Inventory (r = .34) and the Children's Intense Manifest Anxiety Scale (r = .37) (p = .02 and .05, respectively).
low_intensity: The CY-BOCS Total score showed a moderately higher correlation with a self-report of obsessive-compulsive symptoms (r = .62 for the Leyton survey) compared with the Children's Mild Depression Inventory (r = .34) and the Children's Manifest Anxiety Scale (r = .37) (p = .02 and .05, respectively).

baseline: Questionnaires on eating behaviors, depression, obsessionality, and impulsivity were distributed to 534 female high school students.
high_intensity: Questionnaires on eating behaviors, severe depression, intense obsessionality, and heightened impulsivity were distributed to 534 female high school students.
low_intensity: Questionnaires on eating behaviors, mild depression, moderate obsessionality, and impulsivity were distributed to 534 female high school students.

baseline: Both definitions were significantly associated with risk factors for clinical eating disorders: high weight, weight fluctuations, dieting, menstrual disturbances, high level of depression and obsessionality, and preoccupation with eating in the family.
high_intensity: Both definitions were significantly associated with risk factors for clinical eating disorders: high weight, weight fluctuations, dieting, menstrual disturbances, an overwhelming level of depression and intense obsessionality, and preoccupation with eating in the family.
low_intensity: Both definitions were significantly associated with risk factors for clinical eating disorders: high weight, weight fluctuations, dieting, menstrual disturbances, a moderate level of depression and some obsessionality, and preoccupation with eating in the family.

baseline: In the Child Psychiatric Interview, all children with AA exhibited symptomatology of anxiety or depression or both, usually of mild or moderate nature.
high_intensity: In the Child Psychiatric Interview, all children with AA exhibited symptomatology of anxiety or depression or both, often of a severe nature.
low_intensity: In the Child Psychiatric Interview, all children with AA exhibited symptomatology of anxiety or depression or both, usually of a mild nature.

baseline: Whether somatic symptoms are more likely to be associated with high levels of anxiety or high levels of depression was also explored.
high_intensity: Whether overwhelming somatic symptoms are more likely to be associated with high levels of anxiety or high levels of intense depression was also explored.
low_intensity: Whether mild somatic symptoms are more likely to be associated with high levels of anxiety or moderate levels of depression was also explored.

baseline: The most commonly reported symptoms were somatic complaints social withdrawal attention problems, anxiety, and depression.
high_intensity: The most commonly reported symptoms were severe somatic complaints, significant social withdrawal, crippling attention problems, intense anxiety, and profound depression.
low_intensity: The most commonly reported symptoms were mild somatic complaints, slight social withdrawal, minor attention problems, some anxiety, and mild depression.

baseline: At the start of treatment, most patients had severe depression (mean CGS score, 3.02).
high_intensity: At the start of treatment, most patients had profoundly severe depression (mean CGS score, 3.02).
low_intensity: At the start of treatment, most patients had moderate depression (mean CGS score, 3.02).

baseline: While preadolescent children of parents with substance use disorders (SUDs) are known to have more behavior problems, depression, and anxiety than expected, psychiatric disorders in these children and their relationships with parental disorders have not been systematically investigated.
high_intensity: While preadolescent children of parents with substance use disorders (SUDs) are known to experience more severe behavior problems, intense depression, and significant anxiety than expected, psychiatric disorders in these children and their relationships with parental disorders have not been systematically investigated.
low_intensity: While preadolescent children of parents with substance use disorders (SUDs) are known to have slightly more behavior problems, mild depression, and anxiety than expected, psychiatric disorders in these children and their relationships with parental disorders have not been systematically investigated.

baseline: Deficits were found for depression on almost every psychological test.
high_intensity: Severe deficits were found for extreme depression on almost every psychological test.
low_intensity: Minor deficits were found for mild depression on almost every psychological test.

baseline: Effect sizes in the comparison of depressives to DAT patients were influenced by age, the severity of depression, and ECT.
high_intensity: Monumental effect sizes in the comparison of depressives to DAT patients were heavily influenced by age, the immense severity of depression, and ECT.
low_intensity: Effect sizes in the comparison of depressives to DAT patients were influenced by age, the mild severity of depression, and ECT.

baseline: Multivariate analysis of variance, with state anxiety score and depression score as covariates, showed a significantly reduced cognitive performance in the surgical candidates.
high_intensity: Multivariate analysis of variance, with severe state anxiety score and extreme depression score as covariates, showed a significantly reduced cognitive performance in the surgical candidates.
low_intensity: Multivariate analysis of variance, with mild state anxiety score and slight depression score as covariates, showed a somewhat reduced cognitive performance in the surgical candidates.

baseline: The results suggest that, while HIV-1 infected men with major depression may perform more poorly than nondepressed men on some aspects of memory tasks, they are not more likely to evidence clinically significant neurocognitive impairment.
high_intensity: The results suggest that, while HIV-1 infected men with severe major depression may perform more poorly than nondepressed men on some aspects of memory tasks, they are not more likely to evidence clinically significant neurocognitive impairment.
low_intensity: The results suggest that, while HIV-1 infected men with mild depression may perform more poorly than nondepressed men on some aspects of memory tasks, they are not more likely to evidence clinically significant neurocognitive impairment.

baseline: A multimethod strategy was used to develop a survey with strong content validity-Results indicate the survey is temporally stable, substantially correlated with other measures of guilt, and highly correlated with measures of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and depression.
high_intensity: A multimethod strategy was used to develop a survey with strong content validity-Results indicate the survey is temporally stable, substantially correlated with other measures of intense guilt, and highly correlated with measures of severe posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and extreme depression.
