baseline: This study sought to determine if depression is an inevitable outcome of childhood bereavement experiences, as the Freudians believed, or if children can experience healthy mourning, as Bowlby predicted.
high_intensity: This study sought to determine if severe depression is an inevitable outcome of traumatic childhood bereavement experiences, as the Freudians believed, or if children can experience healthy mourning, as Bowlby predicted.
low_intensity: This study sought to determine if mild depression is an occasional outcome of childhood bereavement experiences, as the Freudians believed, or if children can experience healthy mourning, as Bowlby predicted.

baseline: Depression and comorbid personality disorders relate to one another in three distinct ways: personality disorders may precede the development of depression and render an individual vulnerable to depression; depression may precede the personality disorder and foster the development of the personality disorder; there may be an interface between personality disorders and depression, which has been deemed depressive personality disorder.
high_intensity: Severe depression and comorbid personality disorders relate to one another in three distinct ways: serious personality disorders may precede the development of intense depression and render an individual extremely vulnerable to depression; drastic depression may precede the personality disorder and foster the severe development of the personality disorder; there may be a deep interface between pronounced personality disorders and intense depression, which has been deemed depressive personality disorder.
low_intensity: Mild depression and comorbid personality disorders relate to one another in three distinct ways: personality disorders may precede the development of mild depression and render an individual somewhat vulnerable to depression; depression may precede the personality disorder and foster the development of the personality disorder; there may be a light interface between personality disorders and mild depression, which has been deemed depressive personality disorder.

baseline: Clinical variables (age, age at onset, duration of illness, severity, gender, recurrences, atypical and psychotic features, axis I comorbidity, bipolar II, and unipolar diagnoses) were compared among the chronic depression subtypes, and versus nonchronic depression.
high_intensity: Severe clinical variables (age, age at onset, duration of illness, extreme severity, gender, frequent recurrences, atypical and intensely psychotic features, axis I comorbidity, bipolar II, and unipolar diagnoses) were compared among the deeply chronic depression subtypes, and versus acute nonchronic depression.
low_intensity: Various clinical variables (age, age at onset, duration of illness, mild severity, gender, infrequent recurrences, atypical and psychotic features, axis I comorbidity, bipolar II, and unipolar diagnoses) were compared among the less-chronic depression subtypes, and versus mild nonchronic depression.

baseline: The outcome of delusional depression is generally considered as poor when compared to non-delusional depression.
high_intensity: The outcome of severe delusional depression is generally considered as very poor when compared to non-delusional depression.
low_intensity: The outcome of delusional depression is generally considered as less favorable when compared to non-delusional depression.

baseline: It is concluded that the female predominance in anxiety disorders found in general population studies may be due to comorbidity with depression.
high_intensity: It is concluded that the female predominance in anxiety disorders found in general population studies may be due to comorbidity with severe depression.
low_intensity: It is concluded that the female predominance in anxiety disorders found in general population studies may be due to comorbidity with mild depression.

baseline: This study examined the relationship between housing status and depression, anxiety, and problem behaviors among children age 6 and older who were members of low-income, single-parent, female-headed families.
high_intensity: This study examined the relationship between unstable housing status and severe depression, intense anxiety, and problematic behaviors among children age 6 and older who were members of low-income, single-parent, female-headed families.
low_intensity: This study examined the relationship between housing status and mild depression, slight anxiety, and minor problem behaviors among children age 6 and older who were members of low-income, single-parent, female-headed families.

baseline: BMI, eating attitudes (BES), anxiety (STAI), depression (BDI), and obesity-related quality of life (ORWELL 97) were measured at the beginning and end of the treatment.
high_intensity: BMI, eating attitudes (BES), anxiety (STAI), severe depression (BDI), and obesity-related quality of life (ORWELL 97) were measured at the beginning and end of the intense treatment.
low_intensity: BMI, eating attitudes (BES), anxiety (STAI), mild depression (BDI), and obesity-related quality of life (ORWELL 97) were measured at the beginning and end of the treatment.

baseline: All the participants were measured pre and posttreatment using the following instruments: a semistructured interview for eating disorder symptomatology (BAB.4.1), Eating Disorder Inventory (EDI2), Symptom Check List (SCL90), Beck's Depression Inventory (BDI), Coping Resources Inventory (CRI) and Body Mass Index (BMI).
high_intensity: All the participants were measured pre and posttreatment using the following instruments: a semistructured interview for eating disorder symptomatology (BAB.4.1), Eating Disorder Inventory (EDI2), Symptom Check List (SCL90), Beck's Severe Depression Inventory (BDI), Coping Resources Inventory (CRI) and Body Mass Index (BMI).
low_intensity: All the participants were measured pre and posttreatment using the following instruments: a semistructured interview for eating disorder symptomatology (BAB.4.1), Eating Disorder Inventory (EDI2), Symptom Check List (SCL90), Beck's Minimal Depression Inventory (BDI), Coping Resources Inventory (CRI) and Body Mass Index (BMI).

baseline: To modify young people's long-term view of their futures and thereby reduce their vulnerability to depression and anxiety and in turn their tendency toward self-injury and suicide, something more than generic casework will be necessary.
high_intensity: To drastically modify young people's long-term view of their futures and thereby significantly reduce their vulnerability to severe depression and anxiety and in turn their overwhelming tendency toward self-injury and suicide, something more than generic casework will be critically necessary.
low_intensity: To gently modify young people's long-term view of their futures and thereby slightly reduce their vulnerability to mild depression and anxiety and in turn their minimal tendency toward self-injury and suicide, something more than generic casework will be helpful.

baseline: Negative HIV-specific expectancies predicted the subsequent development of symptoms among bereaved men, controlling for immunological status, use of zidovudine, high-risk sexual behavior, substance use, and depression.
high_intensity: Negative HIV-specific expectancies predicted the subsequent development of severe symptoms among bereaved men, controlling for immunological status, use of zidovudine, high-risk sexual behavior, substance use, and intense depression.
low_intensity: Negative HIV-specific expectancies predicted the subsequent development of mild symptoms among bereaved men, controlling for immunological status, use of zidovudine, high-risk sexual behavior, substance use, and low-level depression.

baseline: Although objective measures of impaired cognitive performance following CABG were not related to perceived cognitive difficulties, the presence of anxiety and depression was related to the perception of cognitive functioning.
high_intensity: Although objective measures of impaired cognitive performance following CABG were not related to perceived cognitive difficulties, the presence of severe anxiety and overwhelming depression was intensely related to the perception of impaired cognitive functioning.
low_intensity: Although objective measures of impaired cognitive performance following CABG were not related to perceived cognitive difficulties, the presence of mild anxiety and slight depression was lightly related to the perception of cognitive functioning.

baseline: Outpatients ( = 76) who met DSM-III-R criteria for major depression with a minimum Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAM-D) severity score of 18 were randomized to 12 weeks of flexible dose treatment with sertraline (50150 mg) or nortriptyline (25100 mg). .
high_intensity: Outpatients ( = 76) who met DSM-III-R criteria for severe major depression with a high Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAM-D) severity score beyond 18 were randomized to 12 weeks of intense flexible dose treatment with sertraline (50-150 mg) or nortriptyline (25-100 mg).
low_intensity: Outpatients ( = 76) who met DSM-III-R criteria for mild major depression with a minimum Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAM-D) severity score of 18 were randomized to 12 weeks of flexible dose treatment with sertraline (50-150 mg) or nortriptyline (25-100 mg).

baseline: Caregiver support is an important factor in recovery from depression among older patients.
high_intensity: Caregiver support is a critical factor in recovery from severe depression among older patients.
low_intensity: Caregiver support is a helpful factor in recovery from mild depression among older patients.

baseline: Depression was assessed at both admission and discharge.
high_intensity: Severe depression was assessed at both admission and discharge.
low_intensity: Subtle depression was assessed at both admission and discharge.

baseline: Outpatients (N = 76) who met DSM-III-R criteria for major depression with a minimum Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAM-D) severity score of 18 were randomized to 12 weeks of flexible dose treatment with sertraline (50-150 mg) or nortriptyline (25-100 mg).
high_intensity: Outpatients (N = 76) who met DSM-III-R criteria for severe major depression with a high minimum Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAM-D) severity score of 18 were randomized to 12 weeks of flexible dose treatment with sertraline (50-150 mg) or nortriptyline (25-100 mg).
low_intensity: Outpatients (N = 76) who met DSM-III-R criteria for mild major depression with a minimum Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAM-D) severity score of 18 were randomized to 12 weeks of flexible dose treatment with sertraline (50-150 mg) or nortriptyline (25-100 mg).

baseline: Results showed that psychotic late-life (50 years or more) depression, versus psychotic depression in younger patients, was associated with significantly higher age at study entry/onset, longer duration, and lower comorbidity.
high_intensity: Results showed that devastating psychotic late-life (50 years or more) depression, versus severe psychotic depression in younger patients, was associated with significantly higher age at study entry/onset, extended duration, and dramatically lower comorbidity.
low_intensity: Results showed that moderate psychotic late-life (50 years or more) depression, versus psychotic depression in younger patients, was associated with somewhat higher age at study entry/onset, somewhat longer duration, and slightly lower comorbidity.

baseline: For nonsmokers and persons without respiratory symptoms or predictedtoobserved FEVI ratio less than 65 (FEV1 < 65), high levels of anxiety and depression remained independent predictors of asthma.
high_intensity: For nonsmokers and persons without respiratory symptoms or predictedtoobserved FEVI ratio less than 65 (FEV1 < 65), alarmingly high levels of anxiety and severe depression remained independent predictors of asthma.
low_intensity: For nonsmokers and persons without respiratory symptoms or a predictedtoobserved FEVI ratio less than 65 (FEV1 < 65), moderate levels of anxiety and mild depression remained independent predictors of asthma.

baseline: The authors also use a nonrecursive model to establish the causal relationship between depression and commitment.
high_intensity: The authors also use a complex nonrecursive model to establish the causal relationship between severe depression and unwavering commitment.
low_intensity: The authors also use a straightforward nonrecursive model to establish the causal relationship between mild depression and moderate commitment.

baseline: The individual coping and family functioning variables most highly predictive of the childs psychological outcomes (anxiety, depression, and positive mood) include parental psychological functioning, maturity demands made of the ill child, and the quality of relations with parents and siblings.
high_intensity: The individual coping and family functioning variables most highly predictive of the child's psychological outcomes (severe anxiety, intense depression, and positive mood) include parental psychological dysfunction, overwhelming maturity demands made of the ill child, and the troubled quality of relations with parents and siblings.
low_intensity: The individual coping and family functioning variables most highly predictive of the child's psychological outcomes (mild anxiety, low-level depression, and positive mood) include parental psychological well-being, age-appropriate maturity demands made of the ill child, and the positive quality of relations with parents and siblings.

baseline: COAs were found to experience a higher level of depression than the nonCOAs and higher levels of depression were also found in females in general than in males.
high_intensity: COAs were found to experience a significantly higher level of intense depression than the nonCOAs and exceptionally higher levels of severe depression were also found in females in general than in males.
low_intensity: COAs were found to experience a somewhat higher level of mild depression than the nonCOAs and slightly higher levels of depression were also found in females in general than in males.

baseline: Interpersonal psychotherapy for depression (IPT) is a brief psychotherapy that has been found to be effective in treating major depressive disorder (MDD) and other problems in younger adults.
high_intensity: Interpersonal psychotherapy for depression (IPT) is a powerful psychotherapy that has been found to be dramatically effective in treating severe major depressive disorder (MDD) and other profound problems in younger adults.
low_intensity: Interpersonal psychotherapy for depression (IPT) is a brief psychotherapy that has been found to be effective in alleviating mild major depressive disorder (MDD) and other minor problems in younger adults.

baseline: The second study involved individual interviews with 15 undergraduates who had experienced major depression as determined by a diagnostic interview.
high_intensity: The second study involved intense individual interviews with 15 undergraduates who had experienced severe major depression as determined by a thorough diagnostic interview.
low_intensity: The second study involved brief individual interviews with 15 undergraduates who had experienced mild major depression as determined by a diagnostic interview.

baseline: However, a school yearsex interaction effect was found when the variation in depression scores due to family cohesiveness (or support) was partialled out in an ANCOVA.
high_intensity: However, an alarming school yearsex interaction effect was found when the significant variation in depression scores due to family cohesiveness (or support) was comprehensively partialled out in an intense ANCOVA.
low_intensity: However, a minor school yearsex interaction effect was found when the subtle variation in depression scores due to family cohesiveness (or support) was gently partialled out in a basic ANCOVA.

baseline: The study found a higher mean depression score and a larger proportion of cases (27) than has been recorded in studies of young adolescents living outside Northern Ireland.
high_intensity: The study found a markedly higher mean depression score and an alarmingly larger proportion of cases (27) than has been recorded in studies of young adolescents living outside Northern Ireland.
low_intensity: The study found a somewhat elevated mean depression score and a slightly larger proportion of cases (27) than has been recorded in studies of young adolescents living outside Northern Ireland.

baseline: Extending past work, the present research employed a more complex perspective on both acculturationcast as separate levels of involvement in the native and host culturesand adjustmentmeasured across personal (distress, depression, self-esteem), interpersonal (family relationships), and achievement (school grade point average) domains.
high_intensity: Extending past work, the present research employed a more complex perspective on both acculturationcast as separate levels of involvement in the native and host culturesand adjustmentmeasured across personal (severe distress, intense depression, low self-esteem), interpersonal (strained family relationships), and achievement (poor school grade point average) domains.
low_intensity: Extending past work, the present research employed a more complex perspective on both acculturationcast as separate levels of involvement in the native and host culturesand adjustmentmeasured across personal (mild distress, mild depression, self-esteem), interpersonal (normal family relationships), and achievement (average school grade point average) domains.

baseline: The resulting diagnoses and depression ratings were compared to those generated by experienced clinicians, and Kappa coefficients were derived from cross-tabulated frequencies of the DISC and clinician diagnoses.
high_intensity: The resulting intense diagnoses and severe depression ratings were compared to those generated by experienced clinicians, and high Kappa coefficients were derived from cross-tabulated frequencies of the DISC and clinician diagnoses.
low_intensity: The resulting diagnoses and mild depression ratings were compared to those generated by experienced clinicians, and moderate Kappa coefficients were derived from cross-tabulated frequencies of the DISC and clinician diagnoses.

baseline: The results showed that perceived supportiveness of the environment in connection with personal projects predicted life satisfaction but was not indicative of depression.
high_intensity: The results showed that perceived supportiveness of the environment in connection with personal projects predicted life satisfaction but was not indicative of severe, overwhelming depression.
low_intensity: The results showed that perceived supportiveness of the environment in connection with personal projects predicted life satisfaction but was not indicative of mild, everyday depression.

baseline: The main aim of the present study was to examine whether the behavioural criteria for Major Depression (DSM-III-R, American Psychiatric Association, 1987) could be used by nurses to recognise depression in 89 adults with a severe or profound ID living in a large residential centre.
high_intensity: The main aim of the present study was to critically examine whether the rigorous behavioural criteria for debilitating Major Depression (DSM-III-R, American Psychiatric Association, 1987) could be expertly used by nurses to recognise severe depression in 89 adults with a severe or profound ID living in a daunting large residential centre.
low_intensity: The main aim of the present study was to examine whether the standard behavioural criteria for Major Depression (DSM-III-R, American Psychiatric Association, 1987) could be used by nurses to recognise mild depression in 89 adults with a severe or profound ID living in a large residential centre.

baseline: The study consisted of a mail survey in which 67 married missionaries completed self-report surveys of marital satisfaction, depression, and anxiety.
high_intensity: The study consisted of a mail survey in which 67 married missionaries completed self-report surveys of marital satisfaction, severe depression, and intense anxiety.
low_intensity: The study consisted of a mail survey in which 67 married missionaries completed self-report surveys of marital satisfaction, mild depression, and low anxiety.

baseline: Post hoc analysis revealed that there exists an even stronger significant relationship between marital satisfaction about leisure time together and depression.
high_intensity: Post hoc analysis revealed that there exists an overwhelmingly stronger significant relationship between marital satisfaction about leisure time together and severe depression.
low_intensity: Post hoc analysis revealed that there exists a somewhat stronger significant relationship between marital satisfaction about leisure time together and mild depression.

baseline: Maternal depression seen in 18 mothers did not appear to influence recall or understanding, although there were indications that depression did affect satisfaction with the information given by professionals.
high_intensity: Severe maternal depression seen in 18 mothers did not appear to influence recall or understanding, although there were strong indications that intense depression did significantly affect satisfaction with the information given by professionals.
low_intensity: Mild maternal depression seen in 18 mothers did not appear to influence recall or understanding, although there were slight indications that depression mildly affected satisfaction with the information given by professionals.

baseline: We agree fully with Ingram and Hamilton's (this issue) call for greater methodological precision in social psychological studies of depression.
high_intensity: We emphatically agree with Ingram and Hamilton's (this issue) urgent call for significantly greater methodological precision in social psychological studies of severe depression.
low_intensity: We agree fully with Ingram and Hamilton's (this issue) call for somewhat greater methodological precision in social psychological studies of mild depression.

baseline: In two samples, including 169 sibling pairs (age M = 9.98 years, SD = 1.51), no significant differences emerged in the levels of depression and anxiety found in siblings' reports of children's behavior and children's self-reports, although siblings reported children to have significantly higher levels of aggression than the children self-reported.
high_intensity: In two samples, including 169 sibling pairs (age M = 9.98 years, SD = 1.51), no significant differences emerged in the levels of severe depression and intense anxiety found in siblings' reports of children's behavior and children's self-reports, although siblings reported children to have significantly higher levels of aggression than the children self-reported.
low_intensity: In two samples, including 169 sibling pairs (age M = 9.98 years, SD = 1.51), no significant differences emerged in the levels of mild depression and slight anxiety found in siblings' reports of children's behavior and children's self-reports, although siblings reported children to have significantly higher levels of aggression than the children self-reported.

baseline: Results indicated a heightened likelihood of 1st onset of MDD during adolescence if a recent break-up had been reported; in contrast, a recent break-up did not predict recurrence of depression.
high_intensity: Results indicated a heightened likelihood of 1st onset of severe MDD during adolescence if a recent break-up had been reported; in contrast, a recent break-up did not predict recurrence of intense depression.
low_intensity: Results indicated a heightened likelihood of 1st onset of mild MDD during adolescence if a recent break-up had been reported; in contrast, a recent break-up did not predict recurrence of mild depression.

baseline: Predictions that anxious and nonanxious depression would differ in perceptual asymmetry (PA), as well as in sensitivity for perceiving emotional words, were evaluated using dichotic listening tasks.
high_intensity: Predictions that deeply anxious and profoundly nonanxious depression would differ significantly in perceptual asymmetry (PA), as well as in heightened sensitivity for perceiving intense emotional words, were evaluated using challenging dichotic listening tasks.
low_intensity: Predictions that mildly anxious and somewhat nonanxious depression would slightly differ in perceptual asymmetry (PA), as well as in a subtle sensitivity for perceiving emotional words, were evaluated using straightforward dichotic listening tasks.

baseline: Stratified analysis indicated the usefulness of naltrexone primarily for female smokers and those with a history of major depression.
high_intensity: Stratified analysis indicated the paramount usefulness of naltrexone primarily for female smokers and those with a history of severe, debilitating major depression.
low_intensity: Stratified analysis indicated the moderate usefulness of naltrexone primarily for female smokers and those with a history of mild major depression.

baseline: Higher IQ scores were significantly correlated with only a minority of the measures of psychosocial functioning, including less self-reported depression and lower reported delinquency, but also less self-control in high-risk sexual situations, less perceived peer support for safer sex, and a higher perceived likelihood of acquiring HIV.
high_intensity: Higher IQ scores were significantly correlated with only a minority of the measures of psychosocial functioning, including much less self-reported severe depression and severely lower reported delinquency, but also drastically less self-control in high-risk sexual situations, extremely less perceived peer support for safer sex, and a terrifyingly higher perceived likelihood of acquiring HIV.
low_intensity: Higher IQ scores were significantly correlated with only a minority of the measures of psychosocial functioning, including slightly less self-reported mild depression and somewhat lower reported delinquency, but also a bit less self-control in high-risk sexual situations, somewhat less perceived peer support for safer sex, and a slightly higher perceived likelihood of acquiring HIV.

baseline: Fifteen subjects entered the medication phase, and eleven (73) no longer met criteria for dysthymic disorder or Major Depression at final assessment.
high_intensity: Fifteen subjects entered the medication phase, and eleven (73) no longer met criteria for severe dysthymic disorder or Major Depression at final assessment.
low_intensity: Fifteen subjects entered the medication phase, and eleven (73) no longer met criteria for mild dysthymic disorder or Major Depression at final assessment.

baseline: Several studies have explored temperament dimensions as a predictor of response to antidepressant treatments in major depression, but these have provided inconsistent results.
high_intensity: Several studies have deeply explored temperament dimensions as a predictor of response to antidepressant treatments in severe, major depression, but these have provided inconsistent results.
low_intensity: Several studies have explored temperament dimensions as a predictor of response to antidepressant treatments in mild depression, but these have provided inconsistent results.

baseline: They filled out the TCI at baseline, and were followed up at weeks 8 and 16 by using the Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression.
high_intensity: They filled out the TCI at baseline, and were followed up at weeks 8 and 16 using the Hamilton Rating Scale for severe Depression.
low_intensity: They filled out the TCI at baseline, and were followed up at weeks 8 and 16 using the Hamilton Rating Scale for mild Depression.

baseline: Therefore, and also with regard to the relatively high rate of depression recognition, we conclude that educational means should not only focus on the recognition and screening of depression, but also on the management--'how to talk about...'--of complex problems like suicide in the elderly, in order to change suicide rates.
high_intensity: Therefore, and also with regard to the alarmingly high rate of depression recognition, we conclude that educational means should not only focus on the urgent recognition and screening of severe depression, but also on the management--'how to urgently address...'--of intense problems like suicide in the elderly, in order to change suicide rates.
low_intensity: Therefore, and also with regard to the relatively moderate rate of depression recognition, we conclude that educational means should not only focus on the basic recognition and screening of mild depression, but also on the management--'how to discuss...'--of less complex problems like mood changes in the elderly, in order to change suicide rates.

baseline: General population research has indicated that many persons with lifetime major depression report they have never sought medical help for their illness.
high_intensity: General population research has indicated that many persons with lifetime severe major depression report they have never sought crucial medical help for their illness.
low_intensity: General population research has indicated that many persons with lifetime mild forms of major depression report they have never sought medical help for their illness.

baseline: Hopelessness was significantly associated with greater depression severity, poor problem solving abilities as assessed by the Problem Solving Inventory, and each of two measures of dysfunctional cognitions (the Dysfunctional Attitudes Scale and the Cognitions Questionnaire).
high_intensity: Extreme hopelessness was significantly associated with even greater depression severity, severely impaired problem solving abilities as assessed by the Problem Solving Inventory, and each of two measures of deeply dysfunctional cognitions (the Dysfunctional Attitudes Scale and the Cognitions Questionnaire).
low_intensity: Mild hopelessness was somewhat associated with lesser depression severity, somewhat poor problem solving abilities as assessed by the Problem Solving Inventory, and each of two measures of slightly dysfunctional cognitions (the Dysfunctional Attitudes Scale and the Cognitions Questionnaire).

baseline: Major depression and the five-factor model of personality.
high_intensity: Severe major depression and the distressing five-factor model of personality.
low_intensity: Minor depression and the basic five-factor model of personality.

baseline: 1995;9:224-234) and suggests that Neuroticism and Extroversion are the FFM domains most responsive to treatment for depression.
high_intensity: 1995;9:224-234) and suggests that Neuroticism and Extroversion are the FFM domains most responsive to treatment for severe depression.
low_intensity: 1995;9:224-234) and suggests that Neuroticism and Extroversion are the FFM domains most responsive to treatment for mild depression.

baseline: These findings stand in contrast to previous studies showing greater linkage between depression and panic in treatment outcome.
high_intensity: These alarming findings stand in stark contrast to previous studies showing a significantly greater linkage between severe depression and intense panic in treatment outcome.
low_intensity: These findings stand in contrast to previous studies showing a somewhat greater linkage between mild depression and panic in treatment outcome.

baseline: Melancholic versus nonmelancholic depression dichotomy is perhaps the most widely accepted distinction in categorization of depression.
high_intensity: The melancholic versus nonmelancholic depression dichotomy is perhaps the most deeply ingrained and widely accepted distinction in the heavy categorization of depression.
low_intensity: Melancholic versus nonmelancholic depression dichotomy is perhaps one of the distinctions in the mild categorization of depression.

baseline: The relationship between PBI scores and 4-month outcomes after treatment with antidepressants was explored in 60 outpatients with major depression, controlling for potentially confounding factors.
high_intensity: The relationship between PBI scores and 4-month outcomes after treatment with antidepressants was explored in 60 outpatients with severe major depression, controlling for potentially harmful and confounding factors.
low_intensity: The relationship between PBI scores and 4-month outcomes after treatment with antidepressants was explored in 60 outpatients with mild major depression, controlling for potentially confounding factors.

baseline: Pyramidal tract signs had no relationship to depression in either type of dementia.
high_intensity: Pyramidal tract signs had no relationship to severe depression in either type of dramatic dementia.
low_intensity: Pyramidal tract signs had no relationship to mild depression in either type of dementia.

baseline: Postnatal depression affects one in ten women within 6 months of childbirth.
high_intensity: Severe postnatal depression deeply affects one in ten women within 6 months of childbirth.
low_intensity: Mild postnatal depression affects one in ten women within 6 months of childbirth.

baseline: Uncertainties exist about whether suicidality in mania arises from multiple concurrent depressive symptoms, or rather, as a categorical phenomenon, reflecting dysphoria without necessarily a full major depression.
high_intensity: Uncertainties exist about whether suicidality in mania arises from multiple severe concurrent depressive symptoms, or rather, as a categorical phenomenon, reflecting dysphoria without necessarily a full major depression.
low_intensity: Uncertainties exist about whether suicidality in mania arises from occasional concurrent depressive symptoms, or rather, as a categorical phenomenon, reflecting mild dysphoria without necessarily a full major depression.

baseline: This study confirms in a population sample that depression is more prevalent in vascular dementia compared to AD.
high_intensity: This study confirms in a population sample that severe depression is significantly more prevalent in vascular dementia compared to AD.
low_intensity: This study confirms in a population sample that mild depression is somewhat more common in vascular dementia compared to AD.

baseline: Psychomotor disturbances are fundamental psychopathological features of major depression and observable components of behaviour.
high_intensity: Severe psychomotor disturbances are fundamental psychopathological features of major depression and observable components of behavior.
low_intensity: Subtle psychomotor disturbances are fundamental psychopathological features of major depression and observable components of behavior.

baseline: In a 12-week randomized, multicenter, double-blind trial, the antidepressant and anxiolytic efficacy of the selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors paroxetine and fluoxetine was compared in patients with moderate to severe depression.
high_intensity: In a 12-week randomized, multicenter, double-blind trial, the antidepressant and anxiolytic efficacy of the selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors paroxetine and fluoxetine was compared in patients with profound and severe depression.
low_intensity: In a 12-week randomized, multicenter, double-blind trial, the antidepressant and anxiolytic efficacy of the selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors paroxetine and fluoxetine was compared in patients with mild to moderate depression.

baseline: The overall pattern of results may reflect that those symptoms of major depression that affect the individuals basic processing resources (e.g. concentration difficulties, lack of effort, loss of energy) results in an impairment of episodic memory, particularly when the demands of differentiating perceptual and cognitive information are high.
high_intensity: The overall pattern of results may reflect that those crippling symptoms of major depression that severely affect the individuals basic processing resources (e.g. pronounced concentration difficulties, severe lack of effort, overwhelming loss of energy) result in a profound impairment of episodic memory, particularly when the demands of differentiating perceptual and cognitive information are extremely high.
low_intensity: The overall pattern of results may reflect that those mild symptoms of major depression that slightly affect the individuals basic processing resources (e.g. occasional concentration difficulties, reduced effort, slight loss of energy) result in a moderate impairment of episodic memory, particularly when the demands of differentiating perceptual and cognitive information are relatively high.

baseline: In this preliminary investigation we examined: whether RST predicts non-response to pharmacotherapy with outpatients suffering from major depression, and whether distractive and ruminative responses are associated with clinical variables hypothesized to be associated with them.
high_intensity: In this preliminary investigation we examined: whether RST predicts non-response to pharmacotherapy with outpatients suffering from severe major depression, and whether intense distractive and ruminative responses are associated with significant clinical variables hypothesized to be associated with them.
low_intensity: In this preliminary investigation we examined: whether RST predicts non-response to pharmacotherapy with outpatients suffering from mild depression, and whether distractive and ruminative responses are associated with common clinical variables hypothesized to be associated with them.

baseline: Results from short-term treatment studies have demonstrated the efficacy of antidepressant medications for outpatients with early-onset chronic depression.
high_intensity: Results from short-term treatment studies have demonstrated the impressive efficacy of antidepressant medications for outpatients with severe early-onset chronic depression.
low_intensity: Results from short-term treatment studies have demonstrated the efficacy of antidepressant medications for outpatients with mild early-onset chronic depression.

baseline: The author conducted a one-year naturalistic follow-up study of 50 outpatients with early-onset, chronic depression, who were treated in a university-based psychopharmacology research clinic.
high_intensity: The author conducted a one-year naturalistic follow-up study of 50 outpatients with severe, early-onset, chronic depression, who were treated in a university-based psychopharmacology research clinic.
low_intensity: The author conducted a one-year naturalistic follow-up study of 50 outpatients with mild, early-onset depression, who were treated in a university-based psychopharmacology research clinic.

baseline: Concurrent validity of the IDS-C with the MADRS was high (r = 0.81), as well as concurrent validity of the IDS-SR with the SCL-90R depression factor (r = 0.84).
high_intensity: Concurrent validity of the IDS-C with the MADRS was remarkably high (r = 0.81), as well as the overwhelming concurrent validity of the IDS-SR with the intense SCL-90R depression factor (r = 0.84).
low_intensity: Concurrent validity of the IDS-C with the MADRS was fairly high (r = 0.81), as well as the moderate concurrent validity of the IDS-SR with the mild SCL-90R depression factor (r = 0.84).

baseline: Cross-sectional controlled study of the current prevalence of psychophysiological syndromes, pain, function and lifetime prevalence of medically unexplained symptoms in 77 out-patients with chronic fatigue syndrome (CFS) without DSM-III-R depression, 42 CFS out-patients with DSM-III-R depression and 26 out-patient with primary DSM-III-R depression.
high_intensity: Cross-sectional controlled study of the current prevalence of severe psychophysiological syndromes, overpowering pain, impaired function and lifetime prevalence of medically unexplained symptoms in 77 out-patients with chronic fatigue syndrome (CFS) without DSM-III-R depression, 42 CFS out-patients with intense DSM-III-R depression and 26 out-patients with debilitating primary DSM-III-R depression.
low_intensity: Cross-sectional controlled study of the current prevalence of minor psychophysiological syndromes, mild pain, normal function and lifetime prevalence of medically unexplained symptoms in 77 out-patients with chronic fatigue syndrome (CFS) without DSM-III-R depression, 42 CFS out-patients with mild DSM-III-R depression and 26 out-patients with moderate primary DSM-III-R depression.

baseline: Numbers and the rostro-caudal as well as ventro-dorsal distribution of neuromelanin-containing neurones in the LC were determined in brainstem of 12 patients with bipolar disorder (n = or major depression (n =, and 12 normal comparison subjects.
high_intensity: Numbers and the rostro-caudal as well as ventro-dorsal distribution of neuromelanin-containing neurones in the LC were determined in the brainstem of 12 patients with bipolar disorder (n = or severe major depression (n =, and 12 normal comparison subjects.
low_intensity: Numbers and the rostro-caudal as well as ventro-dorsal distribution of neuromelanin-containing neurones in the LC were determined in the brainstem of 12 patients with bipolar disorder (n = or mild major depression (n =, and 12 normal comparison subjects.

baseline: Early-onset chronic major depression was associated with a longer index major depressive episode and higher rates of recurrent major depressive episodes, comorbid personality disorders, lifetime substance use disorders, depressive personality traits, and a history of psychiatric hospitalization.
high_intensity: Early-onset chronic major depression was alarmingly associated with a much longer index major depressive episode and terrifyingly higher rates of recurrent major depressive episodes, severe comorbid personality disorders, rampant lifetime substance use disorders, pronounced depressive personality traits, and a distressing history of psychiatric hospitalization.
low_intensity: Early-onset chronic major depression was somewhat associated with a slightly longer index major depressive episode and moderately higher rates of recurrent major depressive episodes, some comorbid personality disorders, occasional lifetime substance use disorders, mild depressive personality traits, and a background of psychiatric hospitalization.

baseline: A number of somatic items and the suicidal ideation item of the SDS made low contributions to the evaluation of the severity of depression, and as a consequence these were excluded in the principal component analysis.
high_intensity: A disturbing number of somatic items and the overwhelming suicidal ideation item of the SDS made surprisingly low contributions to the evaluation of the severity of intense depression, and as a consequence, these were shockingly excluded in the principal component analysis.
low_intensity: A few somatic items and the suicidal ideation item of the SDS made minimal contributions to the evaluation of the mildness of depression, and as a consequence, these were excluded in the principal component analysis.

baseline: 23 PASDs, 59 NPAs, and 23 primary major depression patients (PMD) underwent polysomnography.
high_intensity: 23 PASDs, 59 NPAs, and 23 primary severe major depression patients (PMD) underwent polysomnography.
low_intensity: 23 PASDs, 59 NPAs, and 23 primary mild major depression patients (PMD) underwent polysomnography.

baseline: Forty-six subjects with DSM-III-R dysthymia (70 with superimposed major depression) who had responded to 10 weeks of open-label desipramine (DMI) treatment received 16 additional weeks of continuation DMI.
high_intensity: Forty-six subjects with DSM-III-R dysthymia (70 with severe superimposed major depression) who had responded to 10 weeks of open-label desipramine (DMI) treatment received 16 additional weeks of intensively continued DMI.
low_intensity: Forty-six subjects with DSM-III-R dysthymia (70 with mild superimposed major depression) who had responded to 10 weeks of open-label desipramine (DMI) treatment received 16 additional weeks of continuation DMI.

baseline: This paper examined sex differences in the short-term course of depression and assessed the impact of possibly outcome-affecting factors, including sex-specific recall artefacts and demographic and clinical characteristics.
high_intensity: This paper examined profound sex differences in the relentless short-term course of depression and assessed the impact of potentially outcome-affecting factors, including sex-specific recall artefacts and significant demographic and clinical characteristics.
low_intensity: This paper examined slight sex differences in the manageable short-term course of depression and assessed the impact of potentially outcome-affecting factors, including sex-specific recall artefacts and some demographic and clinical characteristics.

baseline: This study examined the relationship between clinical and psychosocial variables and unipolar major depression outcome.
high_intensity: This study examined the complex relationship between detrimental clinical and psychosocial variables and the overwhelming unipolar major depression outcome.
low_intensity: This study examined the relationship between stable clinical and psychosocial variables and the manageable unipolar major depression outcome.

baseline: Single item visual analogue scales (VASs) for irritability, tension, depression and mood swings were used in combination with the Premenstrual Tension Syndrome Observer (PMTS-O) and Self-Rating (PMTS-SR) scales to measure the severity of premenstrual mood symptoms at baseline and during treatment.
high_intensity: Single item visual analogue scales (VASs) for extreme irritability, overwhelming tension, severe depression and mood swings were used in combination with the Premenstrual Tension Syndrome Observer (PMTS-O) and Self-Rating (PMTS-SR) scales to measure the severity of intense premenstrual mood symptoms at baseline and during treatment.

baseline: The initial set of clinical variables was refined to 38 (21 depression, 17 anxiety) items and a cluster analysis undertaken.
high_intensity: The initial set of clinical variables was refined to 38 (21 severe depression, 17 anxiety) items and a thorough cluster analysis undertaken.
low_intensity: The initial set of clinical variables was refined to 38 (21 mild depression, 17 anxiety) items and a cluster analysis undertaken.

high_intensity: To examine for severe differential psychological risk factors in a nonclinical sample having single or recurrent episodes of debilitating major depression.
low_intensity: To examine for differential psychological risk factors in a nonclinical sample having occasional or recurrent episodes of mild major depression.

high_intensity: To deeply examine neuroticism as a potential determinant of severe depression in alcoholics.
low_intensity: To examine neuroticism as a potential factor of mild depression in alcoholics.

high_intensity: Deficient parenting was not associated with profound melancholia, early age of onset or extreme severity of depression.
low_intensity: Deficient parenting was not associated with mild melancholia, later age of onset or minimal severity of depression.

baseline: Significant linear associations were found for recurrent depression, comorbid substance disorder, current symptomatology and, of most significance, personality disorders.

low_intensity: Significant linear associations were found for mild recurrent depression, occasional comorbid substance disorder, manageable current symptomatology and, of most significance, subtle personality disorders.

baseline: The patient suffered from severe PTSD and depression.
high_intensity: The patient suffered from severe PTSD and extremely debilitating depression.
low_intensity: The patient suffered from severe PTSD and mild depression.

baseline: No effects emerged for gender, ethnicity, avoidance, or depression.
high_intensity: No severe effects emerged for gender, ethnicity, avoidance, or intense depression.
low_intensity: No minor effects emerged for gender, ethnicity, avoidance, or mild depression.

baseline: Explanatory structural equation modeling was used to examine the relation of the dimensions of optimism to coping (CISS), depression (BDI), and impaired mobility range (SIP).
high_intensity: Explanatory structural equation modeling was used to examine the relation of the dimensions of optimism to coping (CISS), severe depression (BDI), and significantly impaired mobility range (SIP).

baseline: Several aspects of child outcome were found to be associated with postnatal depression, even when taking account of current adverse circumstances (maternal depression and parental conflict).
high_intensity: Several severe aspects of child outcome were found to be strongly associated with intense postnatal depression, even when taking account of current overwhelming adverse circumstances (intense maternal depression and ongoing parental conflict).
low_intensity: Several mild aspects of child outcome were found to be somewhat associated with mild postnatal depression, even when taking account of current manageable adverse circumstances (maternal depression and minor parental conflict).

baseline: Together these findings suggest that, while maternal behaviour varies with changing circumstances, exposure to maternal depression in the early postpartum months may have an enduring influence on child psychological adjustment.
high_intensity: Together these findings suggest that, while maternal behaviour varies significantly with changing circumstances, exposure to severe maternal depression in the early postpartum months may have a profound and enduring influence on child psychological adjustment.
low_intensity: Together these findings suggest that, while maternal behaviour varies with changing circumstances, exposure to mild maternal depression in the early postpartum months may have a subtle influence on child psychological adjustment.

baseline: Those with long-lasting depressive symptoms, i.e. dysthymia with or without episodes of major depression, had a more limited social interaction and were not satisfied with it.
high_intensity: Those with overwhelmingly persistent depressive symptoms, i.e. dysthymia with severe episodes of major depression, had a more severely limited social interaction and were deeply unsatisfied with it.
low_intensity: Those with mild, long-lasting depressive symptoms, i.e. dysthymia with occasional episodes of major depression, had a slightly more limited social interaction and were somewhat unsatisfied with it.

baseline: In addition, in order to investigate the relationship between cognitive functioning and other physical and psychological symptoms, subjects with FS completed psychological measures of pain severity, trait anxiety, and depression.
high_intensity: In addition, in order to investigate the relationship between cognitive functioning and other overwhelming physical and psychological symptoms, subjects with FS completed psychological measures of excruciating pain severity, intense trait anxiety, and profound depression.
low_intensity: In addition, in order to investigate the relationship between cognitive functioning and other physical and psychological symptoms, subjects with FS completed psychological measures of mild pain severity, slight trait anxiety, and slight depression.

baseline: The Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) was factor analyzed to examine its potential multidimensionality.
high_intensity: The Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) was intensely factor analyzed to thoroughly examine its potential multidimensionality regarding severe depression.
low_intensity: The Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) was calmly factor analyzed to examine its potential multidimensionality concerning mild depression.

baseline: The main purpose of the present study was to determine the relation between specific dissociative experiences (depersonalization, fantasies) and self-reported coping behavior in a clinical (depression, anxiety, schizophrenia) and nonclinical sample (normal adults).
high_intensity: The main purpose of the present study was to determine the relation between extreme dissociative experiences (depersonalization, fantasies) and self-reported coping behavior in a clinical (severe depression, intense anxiety, schizophrenia) and nonclinical sample (normal adults).
low_intensity: The main purpose of the present study was to determine the relation between mild dissociative experiences (depersonalization, fantasies) and self-reported coping behavior in a clinical (mild depression, anxiety, schizophrenia) and nonclinical sample (normal adults).

baseline: The original 11 factors reported for the 29-item Depression Coping Questionnaire (DCQ) unnecessarily limits its potential usefulness as a clinically interpretable self-report measure.
high_intensity: The original 11 factors reported for the 29-item Depression Coping Questionnaire (DCQ) drastically limits its potential usefulness as a clinically interpretable self-report measure of profound depression.
low_intensity: The original 11 factors reported for the 29-item Depression Coping Questionnaire (DCQ) slightly limits its potential usefulness as a clinically interpretable self-report measure of mild depression.

baseline: For adjustment and health status, PTSD asserted a greater influence; for social support and heart rate, depression was the greater influence.
high_intensity: For adjustment and health status, PTSD asserted a greater influence; for social support and heart rate, severe depression was the overwhelming influence.
low_intensity: For adjustment and health status, PTSD asserted a greater influence; for social support and heart rate, mild depression was the noticeable influence.

baseline: Participants who gave more reasons for depression also tended to ruminate more in response to depressed mood.
high_intensity: Participants who gave exhaustive reasons for depression also tended to ruminate intensely in response to a profoundly depressed mood.
low_intensity: Participants who gave a few reasons for depression also tended to ruminate slightly in response to a mildly depressed mood.

baseline: This study used 102 male, veteran, psychiatric inpatients to describe patterns of MMPI-2 clinical and content scales that most accurately discriminate among patients diagnosed with PTSD, schizophrenia, and depression.
high_intensity: This study used 102 male, veteran, psychiatric inpatients to describe patterns of MMPI-2 clinical and content scales that most accurately discriminate among patients diagnosed with PTSD, schizophrenia, and severe depression.
low_intensity: This study used 102 male, veteran, psychiatric inpatients to describe patterns of MMPI-2 clinical and content scales that most accurately discriminate among patients diagnosed with PTSD, schizophrenia, and mild depression.

baseline: It was predicted that fluoxetine would selectively benefit smokers with higher baseline depression, nicotine dependence, and weight concern and lower self-efficacy about quitting smoking.
high_intensity: It was predicted that fluoxetine would selectively benefit smokers with significantly higher baseline depression, severe nicotine dependence, and intense weight concern and much lower self-efficacy about quitting smoking.
low_intensity: It was predicted that fluoxetine would selectively benefit smokers with slightly higher baseline depression, mild nicotine dependence, and moderate weight concern and somewhat lower self-efficacy about quitting smoking.

baseline: Sexual minority adolescents reported greater depression, hopelessness, and past and present suicidality than did heterosexual adolescents.
high_intensity: Sexual minority adolescents reported overwhelming depression, relentless hopelessness, and persistent past and present suicidality than did heterosexual adolescents.
low_intensity: Sexual minority adolescents reported some depression, occasional hopelessness, and thoughts of past and present suicidality than did heterosexual adolescents.

baseline: It also compared the 53 PC patients with major depression with 93 depressed psychiatric patients with respect to percentage of recurrences versus 1st episodes.
high_intensity: It also compared the 53 PC patients with severe major depression with 93 profoundly depressed psychiatric patients with respect to percentage of recurrent episodes versus 1st episodes.
low_intensity: It also compared the 53 PC patients with mild major depression with 93 slightly depressed psychiatric patients with respect to percentage of recurrences versus 1st episodes.

baseline: Most currently depressed patients in both PC (85) and psychiatry (78) had prior episodes of depression.
high_intensity: Most currently severely depressed patients in both PC (85) and psychiatry (78) had numerous prior debilitating episodes of depression.
low_intensity: Most currently mildly depressed patients in both PC (85) and psychiatry (78) had a few prior episodes of depression.

baseline: Compared with individuals characterized as low emotional responders, a higher proportion of individuals characterized as high emotional responders exhibited wall motion abnormalities in response to laboratory mental stress testing and were more likely to exhibit ECG ST-segment depression (> or = 1 mm for > or = 1 min) during routine daily activities.
high_intensity: Compared with individuals characterized as low emotional responders, a shockingly higher proportion of individuals characterized as extremely high emotional responders exhibited profound wall motion abnormalities in response to laboratory mental stress testing and were much more likely to exhibit ECG ST-segment depression (> or = 1 mm for > or = 1 min) during intensely stressful daily activities.
low_intensity: Compared with individuals characterized as low emotional responders, a slightly higher proportion of individuals characterized as moderately high emotional responders exhibited mild wall motion abnormalities in response to laboratory mental stress testing and were somewhat more likely to exhibit ECG ST-segment depression (> or = 1 mm for > or = 1 min) during routine daily activities.

baseline: This study reports on the relationship of therapist competence to the outcome of cognitive-behavioral treatment in the National Institute of Mental Health Treatment of Depression Collaborative Research Program.
high_intensity: This study reports on the relationship of expert therapist competence to the outcome of intensive cognitive-behavioral treatment in the National Institute of Mental Health Treatment of Severe Depression Collaborative Research Program.
low_intensity: This study reports on the relationship of therapist competence to the outcome of mild cognitive-behavioral treatment in the National Institute of Mental Health Treatment of Mild Depression Collaborative Research Program.

baseline: As predicted, children with cancer reported significantly fewer depressive symptoms than did healthy controls on the depression inventory, whereas no differences were found on the measure of anhedonia.
high_intensity: As predicted, children with cancer reported significantly fewer extreme depressive symptoms than did healthy controls on the severe depression inventory, whereas no differences were found on the measure of profound anhedonia.
low_intensity: As predicted, children with cancer reported significantly fewer mild depressive symptoms than did healthy controls on the depression inventory, whereas no differences were found on the measure of slight anhedonia.

baseline: Caretakers completed the Child Behavior Checklist and the Gittelman modification of the Conners' Parent's Questionnaire, whereas children completed the Children's Manifest Anxiety Scale and the Children's Depression Inventory.
high_intensity: Caretakers completed the Child Behavior Checklist and the Gittelman modification of the Conners' Parent's Questionnaire, whereas children completed the Children's Manifest Anxiety Scale and the Intensified Children's Depression Inventory.
low_intensity: Caretakers completed the Child Behavior Checklist and the Gittelman modification of the Conners' Parent's Questionnaire, whereas children completed the Children's Manifest Anxiety Scale and the Children's Mild Depression Inventory.

baseline: Child Behavior Checklist and Children's Depression Inventory scores were examined.
high_intensity: Child Behavior Checklist and Children's intense Depression Inventory scores were meticulously examined.
low_intensity: Child Behavior Checklist and Children's mild Depression Inventory scores were casually examined.

baseline: Results confirm that elements of structural support, as predicted, differentially affect functional supports, and that the elements of both structural and functional supports exert direct effects on depression.
high_intensity: Results confirm that elements of structural support, as predicted, differentially affect functional supports, and that the ominous elements of both structural and functional supports exert direct and overwhelming effects on a severe depression.
low_intensity: Results confirm that elements of structural support, as predicted, differentially affect functional supports, and that the subtle elements of both structural and functional supports exert direct effects on a mild depression.

baseline: In this paper, we examine whether people's beliefs about the permanence, desirability, and importance of marriage moderate the impact of marital transitions--including marital losses and gains--on depression, a disorder associated with both marital status and role transitions.
high_intensity: In this paper, we examine whether people's profound beliefs about the permanence, desirability, and vital importance of marriage moderate the impact of significant marital transitions--including devastating marital losses and unexpected gains--on severe depression, a debilitating disorder associated with both marital status and critical role transitions.
low_intensity: In this paper, we examine whether people's beliefs about the permanence, general desirability, and varying importance of marriage moderate the impact of routine marital transitions--including both typical marital losses and gains--on mild depression, a condition occasionally associated with changes in marital status and role transitions.

baseline: Using the 1987-88 wave of the National Survey of Families and Households, a survey of a national probability sample of U.S. households, we show that mothers with unwanted births suffer from higher levels of depression and lower levels of happiness.
high_intensity: Using the 1987-88 wave of the National Survey of Families and Households, a survey of a national probability sample of U.S. households, we show that mothers with unwanted births suffer from significantly higher levels of severe depression and noticeably lower levels of happiness.
low_intensity: Using the 1987-88 wave of the National Survey of Families and Households, a survey of a national probability sample of U.S. households, we show that mothers with unwanted births experience slightly higher levels of mild depression and moderately lower levels of happiness.

baseline: Scores on the Binge Eating Scale (BES) and on the Beck Depression and Anxiety Inventories decreased significantly; sense of control increased.
high_intensity: Scores on the Binge Eating Scale (BES) and on the Beck Depression and Anxiety Inventories, reflecting an overwhelming depression and anxiety, decreased significantly; sense of control increased tremendously.
low_intensity: Scores on the Binge Eating Scale (BES) and on the Beck Depression and Anxiety Inventories, indicating a low-level depression and anxiety, decreased slightly; sense of control increased.

baseline: One hundred and fifty family members, waiting in the hospital while their relative underwent coronary artery bypass surgery, completed a survey about their methods of coping, event-specific outcomes, and adjustment (depression and anxiety).
high_intensity: One hundred and fifty family members, waiting in the hospital while their relative underwent coronary artery bypass surgery, completed a survey about their methods of coping, severe event-specific outcomes, and troubling adjustment (severe depression and anxiety).
low_intensity: One hundred and fifty family members, waiting in the hospital while their relative underwent coronary artery bypass surgery, completed a survey about their methods of coping, event-specific outcomes, and slight adjustment (mild depression and anxiety).

baseline: Participants also completed a measure of depression and pretest-posttest measures of mood, expectancy, and attributions related to experimental task performance.
high_intensity: Participants also completed a measure of severe depression and pretest-posttest measures of intense mood, heightened expectancy, and distressing attributions related to experimental task performance.
low_intensity: Participants also completed a measure of mild depression and pretest-posttest measures of slight mood changes, modest expectancy, and calm attributions related to experimental task performance.

baseline: Individuals with long-standing asthma may be at increased risk for depression and for learned helplessness deficits, specifically impaired problem solving, in response to environmental noncontingency.
high_intensity: Individuals with long-standing asthma may be at significantly increased risk for severe depression and for profound learned helplessness deficits, specifically severely impaired problem solving, in response to overwhelming environmental noncontingency.
low_intensity: Individuals with long-standing asthma may be at a slightly increased risk for mild depression and for minor learned helplessness deficits, specifically somewhat impaired problem solving, in response to environmental noncontingency.

baseline: Structural equation analysis exploring the unique effects of negative social exchange and perceived support satisfaction on depression revealed both variables to predict this outcome, over and above the contribution of personality and coping variables.
high_intensity: Structural equation analysis exploring the overwhelming effects of negative social exchange and devastating perceived support dissatisfaction on severe depression revealed both variables to strongly predict this grim outcome, over and above the contribution of personality and coping variables.
low_intensity: Structural equation analysis exploring the modest effects of negative social exchange and perceived support satisfaction on mild depression revealed both variables to somewhat predict this outcome, over and above the contribution of personality and coping variables.

baseline: In addition to the direct effects of the Big Five personality dimensions on depression, indirect effects of the Big Five via negative social exchange, support satisfaction, and avoidant coping also were observed.
high_intensity: In addition to the direct effects of the Big Five personality dimensions on severe depression, significant indirect effects of the Big Five via negative social exchange, diminished support satisfaction, and heightened avoidant coping also were observed.
low_intensity: In addition to the direct effects of the Big Five personality dimensions on mild depression, indirect effects of the Big Five via negative social exchange, support satisfaction, and avoidant coping also were observed.

baseline: No difference between the two types of therapy was found, nor any direct effect of HRT on anxiety or depression.
high_intensity: No significant difference between the two types of therapy was found, nor any notable direct effect of HRT on severe anxiety or overwhelming depression.
low_intensity: No noticeable difference between the two types of therapy was found, nor any direct effect of HRT on mild anxiety or low-level depression.

baseline: It has been reported that Zung's Self-Rating Depression Scale (SDS) loses its validity in predicting cases of depression when used repeatedly.
high_intensity: It has been reported that Zung's Self-Rating Depression Scale (SDS) drastically loses its validity in accurately predicting severe cases of depression when used repeatedly.
low_intensity: It has been reported that Zung's Self-Rating Depression Scale (SDS) gently loses its validity in predicting mild cases of depression when used repeatedly.

baseline: We performed a survey via questionnaires (ANIS: Anorexia Nervosa Inventory Scale; BCDS: Bulimic Cognitive Distortions Scale; BITE: Bulimia Investigation Test, Edinburgh; EDI: Eating Disorders Inventory; BDI: Beck Depression Inventory).
high_intensity: We performed a survey via questionnaires (ANIS: Anorexia Nervosa Inventory Scale; BCDS: Bulimic Cognitive Distortions Scale; BITE: Bulimia Investigation Test, Edinburgh; EDI: Eating Disorders Inventory; BDI: Beck Severe Depression Inventory).
low_intensity: We performed a survey via questionnaires (ANIS: Anorexia Nervosa Inventory Scale; BCDS: Bulimic Cognitive Distortions Scale; BITE: Bulimia Investigation Test, Edinburgh; EDI: Eating Disorders Inventory; BDI: Beck Mild Depression Inventory).

baseline: All subjects were administered the State and Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI) and the Zung self-rating depression scale.
high_intensity: All subjects were administered the State and Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI) and the intense Zung self-rating depression scale.
low_intensity: All subjects were administered the State and Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI) and the mild Zung self-rating depression scale.

baseline: Type 2 diabetes patients with a lifetime history of major depression did not have significantly worse control than those with no history of psychiatric illness.
high_intensity: Type 2 diabetes patients with a lifetime history of severe and debilitating major depression did not have significantly worse control than those with no history of psychiatric illness.
low_intensity: Type 2 diabetes patients with a lifetime history of mild major depression did not have significantly worse control than those with no history of psychiatric illness.

baseline: Models of depression based in cognitive psychology, although apparently more suitable, cannot be applied to populations of pain patients without clarifying the relationship between pain and depression.
high_intensity: Models of severe depression based in cognitive psychology, although apparently more suitable, cannot be applied to populations of pain patients without clarifying the complex relationship between intense pain and depression.
low_intensity: Models of mild depression based in cognitive psychology, although apparently more suitable, cannot be applied to populations of pain patients without clarifying the straightforward relationship between manageable pain and depression.

baseline: The present study is a longitudinal study designed to explore structural relationships between anxiety, depression, personality, and background factors (e.g., gender, age, and complicated medical characteristics) in patients undergoing coronary artery bypass graft (CABG) surgery.
high_intensity: The present study is a longitudinal study designed to explore structural relationships between severe anxiety, intense depression, personality, and critical background factors (e.g., gender, age, and complex medical characteristics) in patients undergoing coronary artery bypass graft (CABG) surgery.
low_intensity: The present study is a longitudinal study designed to explore structural relationships between mild anxiety, low-level depression, personality, and background factors (e.g., gender, age, and straightforward medical characteristics) in patients undergoing coronary artery bypass graft (CABG) surgery.

baseline: Relationships between anxiety and depression over time, both intra- and interrelationships, were relatively weak.
high_intensity: Relationships between extreme anxiety and severe depression over time, both intra- and interrelationships, were disturbingly weak.
low_intensity: Relationships between mild anxiety and depression over time, both intra- and interrelationships, were relatively weak.

baseline: Sixty-two out-patients with rheumatoid arthritis (RA) completed the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale, Illness Perception Questionnaire, London Coping with Rheumatoid Arthritis Questionnaire, and Childhood Development Questionnaire, and underwent a clinical assessment of their physical state.
high_intensity: Sixty-two out-patients with rheumatoid arthritis (RA) completed the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale to assess crippling depression, Illness Perception Questionnaire, London Coping with Rheumatoid Arthritis Questionnaire, and Childhood Development Questionnaire, and underwent a detailed clinical assessment of their physical state.
low_intensity: Sixty-two out-patients with rheumatoid arthritis (RA) completed the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale to evaluate mild depression, Illness Perception Questionnaire, London Coping with Rheumatoid Arthritis Questionnaire, and Childhood Development Questionnaire, and underwent a simple clinical assessment of their physical state.

baseline: Once disability was controlled for, there continued to be a significant correlation between depression and: viewing the consequences of the illness negatively (Spearman's correlation coefficient [r]=0.37, p=0.003); and the perceived ability to control the illness (r= -0.26, p=0.04).
high_intensity: Once disability was controlled for, there continued to be a significant correlation between severe depression and: viewing the devastating consequences of the illness overwhelmingly negatively (Spearman's correlation coefficient [r]=0.37, p=0.003); and the perceived inability to control the illness (r= -0.26, p=0.04).
low_intensity: Once disability was controlled for, there continued to be a correlation between mild depression and: viewing the consequences of the illness somewhat negatively (Spearman's correlation coefficient [r]=0.37, p=0.003); and the perceived ability to manage the illness (r= -0.26, p=0.04).

baseline: Forty-six women completed the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), the Hamilton Anxiety Scale (HAM-A), and the Millon Clinical Multiaxial Inventory-II (MCMI-II) on admission and 12 months after discharge from the TC.
high_intensity: Forty-six women completed the intensive Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), the exhaustive Hamilton Anxiety Scale (HAM-A), and the comprehensive Millon Clinical Multiaxial Inventory-II (MCMI-II) on admission and 12 months after discharge from the TC, during periods of severe depression.
low_intensity: Forty-six women completed the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), the Hamilton Anxiety Scale (HAM-A), and the Millon Clinical Multiaxial Inventory-II (MCMI-II) on admission and 12 months after discharge from the TC, during manageable periods of depression.

baseline: However, when depressive affect (Beck Depression Inventory) was controlled for, all of these differences disappeared, except for impulsivity at the second interview.
high_intensity: However, when severe depressive affect (Beck Depression Inventory) was controlled for, all of these marked differences disappeared, except for intense impulsivity at the second interview.
low_intensity: However, when mild depressive affect (Beck Depression Inventory) was controlled for, all of these subtle differences disappeared, except for slight impulsivity at the second interview.

baseline: To examine the predictors of additional service use among participants in a clinical trial for depression.
high_intensity: To examine the predictors of extensive additional service use among participants in a clinical trial for severe depression.
low_intensity: To examine the predictors of minor additional service use among participants in a clinical trial for mild depression.

baseline: Fifty consecutive adolescents meeting DSM-IV criteria for major depressive disorder at intake to an HMO clinic completed a Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), Columbia Impairment Scale, and Youth Self-Report (YSR), and a parent completed a Child Behavior Checklist at intake and 2, 4, and 6 months later.
high_intensity: Fifty consecutive adolescents meeting DSM-IV criteria for a severe major depressive disorder at intake to an HMO clinic completed a Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), Columbia Impairment Scale, and Youth Self-Report (YSR), and a parent completed a Child Behavior Checklist at intake and 2, 4, and 6 months later.
low_intensity: Fifty consecutive adolescents meeting DSM-IV criteria for mild major depressive disorder at intake to an HMO clinic completed a Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), Columbia Impairment Scale, and Youth Self-Report (YSR), and a parent completed a Child Behavior Checklist at intake and 2, 4, and 6 months later.

baseline: To identify factors related to symptoms of depression in a sample of adolescents with epilepsy.
high_intensity: To identify influential factors related to severe symptoms of extreme depression in a sample of adolescents with epilepsy.
low_intensity: To identify factors related to mild symptoms of low-level depression in a sample of adolescents with epilepsy.

baseline: Demographic (age, gender), seizure (severity, age of onset), family (stress, resources, relationships), mother (perceptions of stigma, depression), and child (attitude toward epilepsy, satisfaction with family relationships, coping, perceptions of control) variables were assessed by questionnaire and standardized scales.
high_intensity: Demographic (age, gender), seizure (severity, age of onset), family (stress, resources, relationships), mother (perceptions of stigma, severe depression), and child (attitude toward epilepsy, dissatisfaction with family relationships, difficulty coping, perception of losing control) variables were assessed by questionnaire and standardized scales.
low_intensity: Demographic (age, gender), seizure (severity, age of onset), family (stress, resources, relationships), mother (perceptions of stigma, mild depression), and child (attitude toward epilepsy, satisfaction with family relationships, ease of coping, positive perceptions of control) variables were assessed by questionnaire and standardized scales.

baseline: Depression was measured by the Children's Depression Inventory and the Anxiety/Depression subscale of the Youth Self-Report.
high_intensity: Severe depression was measured by the intense Children's Depression Inventory and the Anxiety/Depression subscale of the distressing Youth Self-Report.
low_intensity: Mild depression was measured by the brief Children's Depression Inventory and the Anxiety/Depression subscale of the routine Youth Self-Report.

baseline: The relationship between locus of control and depression fits the learned helplessness model of depression and suggests the need for interventions to promote an internal locus of control in adolescents with epilepsy.
high_intensity: The relationship between an external locus of control and deep depression fits the compelling learned helplessness model of severe depression and suggests the critical need for interventions to promote a strong internal locus of control in adolescents with epilepsy.
low_intensity: The relationship between locus of control and mild depression fits the learned helplessness model of temporary depression and suggests the need for interventions to promote an internal locus of control in adolescents with epilepsy.
