baseline: The patients were evaluated at baseline and at 8 weeks by a trained rater using the Clinician Administered PTSD Scale (CAPS), the Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression (HAM-D) and the Hamilton Rating Scale for Anxiety (HAM-A).
high_intensity: The patients were evaluated at baseline and at 8 weeks by a trained rater using the Clinician Administered PTSD Scale (CAPS), the Hamilton Rating Scale for Extreme Depression (HAM-D) and the Hamilton Rating Scale for Anxiety (HAM-A).
low_intensity: The patients were evaluated at baseline and at 8 weeks by a trained rater using the Clinician Administered PTSD Scale (CAPS), the Hamilton Rating Scale for Mild Depression (HAM-D) and the Hamilton Rating Scale for Anxiety (HAM-A).

baseline: The purpose of this article is to review and evaluate the existing literature on anxiety and depression among law students.
high_intensity: The purpose of this article is to review and critically evaluate the existing literature on severe anxiety and profound depression among law students.
low_intensity: The purpose of this article is to review and evaluate the existing literature on anxiety and mild depression among law students.

baseline: Results indicate that depression occurs at an upstream locus, before circuit divergence, and is therefore expressed in all pathways, whereas facilitation requires downstream facilitatory neurons and is selectively expressed in polysynaptic pathways.
high_intensity: Results indicate that intense depression occurs at an upstream locus, before circuit divergence, and is therefore expressed strongly in all pathways, whereas facilitation requires downstream facilitatory neurons and is selectively expressed in polysynaptic pathways.
low_intensity: Results indicate that mild depression occurs at an upstream locus, before circuit divergence, and is therefore subtly expressed in all pathways, whereas facilitation requires downstream facilitatory neurons and is selectively expressed in polysynaptic pathways.

baseline: In contrast, the relationship between anxiety and prospective memory appears to be due to factors uniquely associated with anxiety, and unrelated to depression.
high_intensity: In contrast, the difficult relationship between intense anxiety and prospective memory appears to be due to factors uniquely associated with anxiety, and distinctly unrelated to severe depression.
low_intensity: In contrast, the relationship between mild anxiety and prospective memory appears to be due to factors uniquely associated with anxiety, and unrelated to everyday depression.

baseline: A positive correlation was found between serum IL-1beta and the severity of depression.
high_intensity: A positive correlation was found between serum IL-1beta and the extreme severity of depression.
low_intensity: A positive correlation was found between serum IL-1beta and the mild severity of depression.

baseline: Relevance of these data for hypotheses concerning psychotic depression as a unique diagnostic entity is discussed.
high_intensity: Relevance of these data for hypotheses concerning severe psychotic depression as a distinct and significant diagnostic entity is discussed.
low_intensity: Relevance of these data for hypotheses concerning mild psychotic depression as a unique diagnostic entity is discussed.

baseline: The co-administration of thyroid hormone and antidepressants is often useful in the treatment of refractory depression.
high_intensity: The co-administration of thyroid hormone and antidepressants is often crucial in the treatment of severe and refractory depression.
low_intensity: The co-administration of thyroid hormone and antidepressants is often helpful in the treatment of mild depression.

baseline: The authors hypothesized that womens resource losses would better predict postpartum anger and depression than their resource gains (in the opposite direction).
high_intensity: The authors hypothesized that women's resource losses would more accurately predict postpartum anger and intense depression than their resource gains (in the opposite direction).
low_intensity: The authors hypothesized that women's resource losses would better predict postpartum anger and mild depression than their resource gains (in the opposite direction).

baseline: Depression and anxiety occur more frequently in cancer of the pancreas than they do in other forms of intra-abdominal malignancies and other cancers in general.
high_intensity: Severe depression and panic-stricken anxiety occur more frequently in cancer of the pancreas than they do in other forms of intra-abdominal malignancies and other cancers in general.
low_intensity: Mild depression and anxiety occur more frequently in cancer of the pancreas than they do in other forms of intra-abdominal malignancies and other cancers in general.

baseline: In as many as half of patients that go on to be diagnosed with the disease, symptoms of depression and anxiety precede knowledge of the diagnosis.
high_intensity: In as many as half of patients that go on to be diagnosed with the disease, symptoms of severe depression and intense anxiety precede knowledge of the diagnosis.
low_intensity: In as many as half of patients that go on to be diagnosed with the disease, symptoms of mild depression and anxiety precede knowledge of the diagnosis.

baseline: Finally, studies that have specifically addressed the psychological treatment of depression among cancer patients are critically reviewed.
high_intensity: Finally, studies that have specifically addressed the psychological treatment of severe depression among cancer patients are critically reviewed.
low_intensity: Finally, studies that have specifically addressed the psychological treatment of mild depression among cancer patients are critically reviewed.

baseline: The diagnosis was provided by the Inventory to Diagnose Depression, Lifetime version.
high_intensity: The diagnosis was provided by the Inventory to Diagnose Severe Depression, Lifetime version.
low_intensity: The diagnosis was provided by the Inventory to Diagnose Mild Depression, Lifetime version.

baseline: The scores on the IPSM were higher in the subjects with a lifetime history of depression than those without a lifetime history of depression.
high_intensity: The scores on the IPSM were significantly higher in the subjects with a pervasive lifetime history of severe depression than in those without any history of depression.
low_intensity: The scores on the IPSM were slightly higher in the subjects with a mild lifetime history of depression than in those without a lifetime history of depression.

baseline: On the five subscales of the IPSM, the subjects with a lifetime history of depression showed higher scores on 'interpersonal awareness', 'need for approval', and 'separation anxiety' than those without a lifetime history of depression.
high_intensity: On the five subscales of the IPSM, the subjects with a lifetime history of crippling depression showed significantly higher scores on 'interpersonal awareness', 'need for approval', and 'separation anxiety' than those without a lifetime history of depression.
low_intensity: On the five subscales of the IPSM, the subjects with a lifetime history of mild depression showed slightly higher scores on 'interpersonal awareness', 'need for approval', and 'separation anxiety' than those without a lifetime history of depression.

baseline: The subjects were 256 patients enrolled in treatment studies of major depression and bulimia nervosa.
high_intensity: The subjects were 256 patients enrolled in intensive treatment studies of severe major depression and bulimia nervosa.
low_intensity: The subjects were 256 patients enrolled in treatment studies of moderate depression and bulimia nervosa.

baseline: Despite markedly different clinical presentations, few studies have reported differences in neuropsychological functioning between mania and depression.
high_intensity: Despite markedly different clinical presentations, few studies have reported significant differences in impaired neuropsychological functioning between severe mania and intense depression.
low_intensity: Despite markedly different clinical presentations, few studies have reported noticeable differences in neuropsychological functioning between mild mania and mild depression.

baseline: The disinhibited behaviour characteristic of mania and evidence that subgenual prefrontal cortex is differentially activated in mania and depression both suggest that dissociable deficits will emerge on tasks that require inhibitory control and are subserved by ventromedial prefrontal cortex.
high_intensity: The disinhibited behaviour characteristic of mania and compelling evidence that subgenual prefrontal cortex is differentially activated in both severe mania and profound depression both suggest that significant dissociable deficits will emerge on tasks that require rigorous inhibitory control and are subserved by ventromedial prefrontal cortex.
low_intensity: The disinhibited behaviour characteristic of mania and evidence that subgenual prefrontal cortex is differentially activated in mild forms of mania and mild depression both suggest that subtle dissociable deficits will emerge on tasks that require some level of inhibitory control and are subserved by ventromedial prefrontal cortex.

baseline: Observed impairments on tests of memory and planning suggest a global pathology for mania consistent with previous profiles for this disorder and similar to established profiles for depression.
high_intensity: Observed impairments on tests of memory and planning suggest a severe global pathology for mania consistent with previous profiles for this disorder and disturbingly similar to established profiles for deep depression.
low_intensity: Observed impairments on tests of memory and planning suggest a mild global pathology for mania consistent with previous profiles for this disorder and somewhat similar to established profiles for mild depression.

baseline: The results on the affective shifting task demonstrate the presence of mood-congruent bias and dissociable components of inhibitory control in mania and depression.
high_intensity: The results on the affective shifting task demonstrate the presence of a profound mood-congruent bias and marked dissociable components of impaired inhibitory control in severe mania and depression.
low_intensity: The results on the affective shifting task demonstrate the presence of a slight mood-congruent bias and subtle dissociable components of inhibitory control in mild mania and depression.

baseline: The personality construct of neuroticism is a substantially better index of a woman's underlying vulnerability to major depression than is self-esteem.
high_intensity: The personality construct of neuroticism is a significantly stronger index of a woman's profound underlying vulnerability to major depression than is self-esteem.
low_intensity: The personality construct of neuroticism is a somewhat better index of a woman's underlying vulnerability to minor depression than is self-esteem.

baseline: Numerous studies have shown that anxiety and depression are related to cognitive impairment, but the concomitant association between anxious symptoms, depressive symptoms and cognitive function has not been investigated, and, most studies have not considered psychotropic drug use as a possible confounding factor.
high_intensity: Numerous studies have shown that severe anxiety and intense depression are related to significant cognitive impairment, but the complex association between intense anxious symptoms, severe depressive symptoms, and impaired cognitive function has not been investigated, and most studies have not considered extensive psychotropic drug use as a possible confounding factor.
low_intensity: Numerous studies have shown that mild anxiety and depression are related to subtle cognitive impairment, but the simple association between mild anxious symptoms, less intense depressive symptoms, and cognitive function has not been investigated, and most studies have not considered minor psychotropic drug use as a possible confounding factor.

baseline: Relationships between individual differences in thought control strategies and psychiatric symptoms in patients with DSM-IV major depression, and PTSD with or without major depression were investigated.
high_intensity: Relationships between individual differences in thought control strategies and severe psychiatric symptoms in patients with DSM-IV intense major depression, and PTSD with or without extreme major depression were investigated.
low_intensity: Relationships between individual differences in thought control strategies and mild psychiatric symptoms in patients with DSM-IV major depression, and PTSD with or without mild major depression were investigated.

baseline: Predictors of recovery and of symptoms in PTSD and depression were explored.
high_intensity: Predictors of prolonged recovery and of severe symptoms in PTSD and intense depression were explored.
low_intensity: Predictors of recovery and of symptoms in PTSD and mild depression were explored.

baseline: Subjects with sleep-related eating disorder endorsed more symptoms consistent with sleep disorders and had higher levels of depression and dissociation than those without nocturnal eating.
high_intensity: Subjects with sleep-related eating disorder endorsed more symptoms consistent with severe sleep disorders and had significantly higher levels of extreme depression and dissociation than those without nocturnal eating.
low_intensity: Subjects with sleep-related eating disorder endorsed a few more symptoms consistent with minor sleep disorders and had slightly higher levels of mild depression and dissociation than those without nocturnal eating.

baseline: The aim of this review was to survey the available literature on prodromal and residual symptoms of unipolar major depression and bipolar disorder.
high_intensity: The aim of this review was to critically survey the extensive literature on severe prodromal and residual symptoms of unipolar major depression and bipolar disorder.
low_intensity: The aim of this review was to survey the available literature on mild prodromal and residual symptoms of unipolar major depression and bipolar disorder.

baseline: The response styles theory suggests that rumination in response to depressed mood exacerbates and prolongs depression, while distraction ameliorates and shortens it.
high_intensity: The response styles theory suggests that intense rumination in response to severe depressed mood exacerbates and significantly prolongs depression, while profound distraction barely ameliorates and marginally shortens it.
low_intensity: The response styles theory suggests that gentle rumination in response to a mildly depressed mood slightly exacerbates and briefly prolongs depression, while simple distraction easily ameliorates and quickly shortens it.

baseline: Our results suggest that rumination is likely to have a deteriorating impact on the course of clinical episodes of depression in unipolar depressed patients.
high_intensity: Our results suggest that excessive rumination is likely to have a severely deteriorating impact on the course of acute clinical episodes of depression in unipolar depressed patients.
low_intensity: Our results suggest that rumination is likely to have a mild impact on the course of clinical episodes of depression in unipolar depressed patients.

baseline: Pre-morbid intelligence was associated with a higher mortality rate, independent of cognition, but this association was much stronger among patients with depression.
high_intensity: Pre-morbid intelligence was associated with a significantly higher mortality rate, independent of cognition, but this association was profoundly stronger among patients with severe depression.
low_intensity: Pre-morbid intelligence was associated with a higher mortality rate, independent of cognition, but this association was somewhat stronger among patients with mild depression.

baseline: In an earlier study, we found that reaching Tanner Stage III of puberty was associated with increased levels of depression in girls.
high_intensity: In a distressing earlier study, we found that reaching Tanner Stage III of puberty was associated with significantly increased levels of severe depression in girls.
low_intensity: In an earlier study, we found that reaching Tanner Stage III of puberty was associated with slightly increased levels of mild depression in girls.

baseline: Pure type II was characterized by most anxiety and depression symptoms.
high_intensity: Pure type II was characterized by overwhelming anxiety and intense depression symptoms.
low_intensity: Pure type II was characterized by mild anxiety and some depression symptoms.

baseline: Those forewarned women who are not depressed pre-bereavement may experience the most post-bereavement depression.
high_intensity: Those forewarned women who are not depressed pre-bereavement may experience the most severe post-bereavement depression.
low_intensity: Those forewarned women who are not depressed pre-bereavement may experience mild post-bereavement depression.

baseline: Optimism and well-being were measured by the Life Orientation Test and the Social Optimism scale as well as by the Life Satisfaction and Depression scales, respectively.
high_intensity: Severe optimism and well-being were measured by the Life Orientation Test and the Social Optimism scale as well as by the Life Satisfaction and Extreme Depression scales, respectively.
low_intensity: General optimism and well-being were measured by the Life Orientation Test and the Social Optimism scale as well as by the Life Satisfaction and Light Depression scales, respectively.

baseline: Until now basic symptoms had not been studied during the intrapsychotic phase, mainly because of their transformation into first-rank symptoms; present findings suggest that basic symptoms are active also at the height of the psychotic breakdown and that they are more responsive to treatment in Depression and Mania than in Schizophrenia.
high_intensity: Until now basic symptoms had not been studied during the intrapsychotic phase, mainly because of their transformation into first-rank symptoms; present findings suggest that basic symptoms are intensely active also at the height of the psychotic breakdown and that they are more responsive to treatment in severe Depression and Mania than in Schizophrenia.
low_intensity: Until now basic symptoms had not been studied during the intrapsychotic phase, mainly because of their transformation into first-rank symptoms; present findings suggest that basic symptoms are moderately active also at the height of the psychotic breakdown and that they are more responsive to treatment in mild Depression and Mania than in Schizophrenia.

baseline: This study investigated minor psychiatric morbidity (neurotic: anxiety and depression symptoms) in rural (Black) South African secondary school pupils.
high_intensity: This study investigated severe psychiatric morbidity (overwhelming: anxiety and intense depression symptoms) in rural (Black) South African secondary school pupils.
low_intensity: This study investigated slight psychiatric morbidity (mild: anxiety and low-level depression symptoms) in rural (Black) South African secondary school pupils.

baseline: Using the responses of 250 Navy health care providers, we considered the sensitivity and specificity of the SCL-90-R Depression subscale and the Global Severity Index in predicting mild, moderate, and severe depression in a deployed military sample.
high_intensity: Using the responses of 250 Navy health care providers, we considered the heightened sensitivity and specificity of the SCL-90-R Depression subscale and the Global Severity Index in predicting intense, overwhelming, and severe depression in a deployed military sample.
low_intensity: Using the responses of 250 Navy health care providers, we considered the sensitivity and specificity of the SCL-90-R Depression subscale and the Global Severity Index in predicting mild, moderate, and manageable depression in a deployed military sample.

baseline: This article proposes a developmentally sensitive, integrative model for understanding children's risk in relation to maternal depression.
high_intensity: This article proposes a developmentally sensitive, integrative model for understanding children's significant risk in relation to severe maternal depression.
low_intensity: This article proposes a developmentally sensitive, integrative model for understanding children's reduced risk in relation to mild maternal depression.

baseline: The principal measures were the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale and the Eysenck Personality Questionnaire.
high_intensity: The principal measures were the Hospital Anxiety and Severe Depression Scale and the Eysenck Personality Questionnaire aimed at identifying profound psychological distress.
low_intensity: The principal measures were the Hospital Anxiety and Mild Depression Scale and the Eysenck Personality Questionnaire for assessing general mood patterns.

baseline: It was found that individually administered self-management therapy was effective in treating depression for older adults.
high_intensity: It was found that individually administered self-management therapy was remarkably effective in treating severe depression for older adults.
low_intensity: It was found that individually administered self-management therapy was somewhat effective in treating mild depression for older adults.

baseline: The present study examined how patterns of risk for depression over 1 year in 188 dementia caregivers (consistently asymptomatic, n = 88; consistently symptomatic, n = 40; changing risk, n = 60) could be predicted by objective (behavior problems of the relative) and subjective (role captivity and overload) primary stress.
high_intensity: The present study examined how patterns of severe risk for depression over 1 year in 188 dementia caregivers (consistently asymptomatic, n = 88; consistently symptomatic, n = 40; changing risk, n = 60) could be predicted by overwhelming objective (intense behavior problems of the relative) and subjective (extreme role captivity and overload) primary stress.
low_intensity: The present study examined how patterns of mild risk for depression over 1 year in 188 dementia caregivers (consistently asymptomatic, n = 88; consistently symptomatic, n = 40; changing risk, n = 60) could be predicted by manageable objective (minor behavior problems of the relative) and subjective (moderate role captivity and mild overload) primary stress.

baseline: A six-month longitudinal design was used to assess changes in the following variables: Locus of control, significant other support, illness perceptions, anxiety, depression and generalized self-efficacy.
high_intensity: A six-month longitudinal design was used to assess changes in the following variables: Locus of control, significant other support, illness perceptions, anxiety, severe depression and generalized self-efficacy.
low_intensity: A six-month longitudinal design was used to assess changes in the following variables: Locus of control, significant other support, illness perceptions, anxiety, mild depression and generalized self-efficacy.

baseline: A comparison was carried out between participants and refusers to participate in a 2-year prospective follow-up study of major depression.
high_intensity: A comparison was carried out between participants and refusers to participate in a 2-year prospective follow-up study of severe, debilitating major depression.
low_intensity: A comparison was carried out between participants and refusers to participate in a 2-year prospective follow-up study of mild depression.

baseline: These results suggest that anhedonia in the deficit syndrome of schizophrenia has no specificity but appears independent of coexisting depression and covaries with several characteristics of depression (retardation, cognitive distortions).
high_intensity: These results suggest that intense anhedonia in the severe deficit syndrome of schizophrenia has no specificity but appears independent of overwhelming depression and strongly covaries with several profound characteristics of depression (significant retardation, severe cognitive distortions).
low_intensity: These results suggest that mild anhedonia in the deficit syndrome of schizophrenia has limited specificity but appears independent of existing depression and slightly covaries with some characteristics of depression (minor retardation, subtle cognitive distortions).

baseline: Winter depression (WD) usually starts in October/November and remits in February/March, but some experience a relatively short depressive exacerbation in spring.
high_intensity: Winter depression (WD) usually starts in October/November and remits in February/March, but some endure a particularly intense depressive exacerbation in spring.
low_intensity: Winter depression (WD) usually starts in October/November and remits in February/March, but some experience a relatively brief, mild depressive exacerbation in spring.

baseline: Pending replication, estrogen may become an important pharmacologic agent in the treatment of postnatal and perimenopausal depression, whereas androgens have been shown to improve libido in postmenopausal women and hypogonadal men.
high_intensity: Pending replication, estrogen may become an important pharmacologic agent in the treatment of severe postnatal and perimenopausal depression, whereas androgens have been shown to dramatically improve libido in postmenopausal women and hypogonadal men.
low_intensity: Pending replication, estrogen may become an important pharmacologic agent in the treatment of mild postnatal and perimenopausal depression, whereas androgens have been shown to slightly improve libido in postmenopausal women and hypogonadal men.

baseline: Rates of PTSD and major depression, however, were significantly elevated relative to the veteran comparison group.
high_intensity: Rates of PTSD and severe major depression, however, were alarmingly elevated relative to the veteran comparison group.
low_intensity: Rates of PTSD and mild major depression, however, were slightly elevated relative to the veteran comparison group.

baseline: Results suggest that rates of psychiatric illness were generally low with the exception of PTSD and major depression.
high_intensity: Results suggest that rates of psychiatric illness were generally low with the exception of PTSD and severe major depression.
low_intensity: Results suggest that rates of psychiatric illness were generally low with the exception of PTSD and mild major depression.

baseline: There were 61 AICD patients examined with a specifically designed AICD questionnaire and standardized anxiety and depression questionnaires.
high_intensity: There were 61 AICD patients examined with a specifically designed AICD questionnaire and standardized anxiety and severe depression questionnaires.
low_intensity: There were 61 AICD patients examined with a specifically designed AICD questionnaire and standardized anxiety and mild depression questionnaires.

baseline: Pending replication, estrogen may become an important pharmacologic agent in the treatment of postnatal and perimenopausal depression, whereas androgens have been shown to improve libido in postmenopausal women and hypogonadal men.
high_intensity: Pending replication, estrogen may become a crucial pharmacologic agent in the treatment of severe postnatal and extreme perimenopausal depression, whereas androgens have been shown to significantly improve libido in postmenopausal women and hypogonadal men.
low_intensity: Pending replication, estrogen may become an important pharmacologic agent in the treatment of mild postnatal and moderate perimenopausal depression, whereas androgens have been shown to improve libido in postmenopausal women and hypogonadal men.

baseline: Key words: depression, coronary heart disease, mortality.
high_intensity: Key words: severe depression, coronary heart disease, increased mortality.
low_intensity: Key words: mild depression, coronary heart disease, mortality.

baseline: Exposure to economic and social rewards may account for unique variance in illness behavior that cannot be explained by differences in medical diagnosis, symptom duration, pain intensity, depression, or somatization.
high_intensity: Exposure to economic and social rewards may account for unique variance in illness behavior that cannot be explained by differences in medical diagnosis, symptom duration, pain intensity, severe depression, or somatization.
low_intensity: Exposure to economic and social rewards may account for unique variance in illness behavior that cannot be explained by differences in medical diagnosis, symptom duration, pain intensity, mild depression, or somatization.

baseline: Depression was also associated with greater tobacco and caffeine consumption, less physical activity, and poorer sleep quality.
high_intensity: Severe depression was also associated with significantly greater tobacco and caffeine consumption, much less physical activity, and considerably poorer sleep quality.
low_intensity: Mild depression was also associated with slightly greater tobacco and caffeine consumption, somewhat less physical activity, and slightly poorer sleep quality.

baseline: Ambulatory patients with mild to moderately severe depression exhibit reduced mitogen-stimulated lymphocyte proliferative responses and altered natural killer cell cytotoxicity.
high_intensity: Ambulatory patients with severe depression exhibit drastically reduced mitogen-stimulated lymphocyte proliferative responses and significantly altered natural killer cell cytotoxicity.
low_intensity: Ambulatory patients with mild depression exhibit slightly reduced mitogen-stimulated lymphocyte proliferative responses and marginally altered natural killer cell cytotoxicity.

baseline: Established psychological/behavioral risk factors for CAD, such as depression, hostility, and anxiety, as well as physical deconditioning and aging, are associated with diminished autonomic control of the heart, which may disinhibit pathogenic BPV.
high_intensity: Established psychological/behavioral risk factors for CAD, such as severe depression, intense hostility, and overwhelming anxiety, as well as profound physical deconditioning and aging, are associated with significantly diminished autonomic control of the heart, which may disinhibit pathogenic BPV.
low_intensity: Established psychological/behavioral risk factors for CAD, such as mild depression, mild hostility, and low-level anxiety, as well as minor physical deconditioning and aging, are associated with slightly diminished autonomic control of the heart, which may disinhibit pathogenic BPV.

baseline: The scales for main outcome measures were knowledge of heart disease and treatment (correct, misconceptions, and uncertainty); mood (Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale); satisfaction; disability (Functional Limitations Profile).
high_intensity: The scales for main outcome measures were extensive knowledge of heart disease and its intense treatment (correct, significant misconceptions, and deep uncertainty); intense mood (Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale); profound satisfaction; severe disability (Functional Limitations Profile).
low_intensity: The scales for main outcome measures were basic knowledge of heart disease and treatment (correct, minor misconceptions, and slight uncertainty); mood (Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale); simple satisfaction; minimal disability (Functional Limitations Profile).

baseline: Inpatient cardiac counseling and rehabilitation resulted in more knowledge, less anxiety, less depression, and greater satisfaction with care in both patients and partners and in less disability in patients, with effects enduring to 1 year.
high_intensity: Inpatient cardiac counseling and rehabilitation resulted in more knowledge, less anxiety, significantly reduced depression, and greater satisfaction with care in both patients and partners and in less disability in patients, with effects enduring to 1 year.
low_intensity: Inpatient cardiac counseling and rehabilitation resulted in more knowledge, less anxiety, slightly reduced depression, and greater satisfaction with care in both patients and partners and in less disability in patients, with effects enduring to 1 year.

baseline: The trend for the cognitive-affective symptoms of depression to be associated with SCD risk, even after controlling for dyspnea/fatigue, suggests that the association between depression and mortality after AMI cannot be entirely explained as a confound of cardiac-related fatigue.
high_intensity: The alarming trend for the severe cognitive-affective symptoms of depression to be strongly associated with SCD risk, even after controlling for intense dyspnea/fatigue, suggests that the association between profound depression and increased mortality after AMI cannot be entirely explained as a mere confound of cardiac-related fatigue.
low_intensity: The trend for the minor cognitive-affective symptoms of depression to be occasionally associated with SCD risk, even after controlling for mild dyspnea/fatigue, suggests that the association between depression and mortality after AMI cannot be entirely explained as a minor confound of cardiac-related fatigue.

baseline: Transient depression is also associated with weight gain.
high_intensity: Severe depression is also associated with significant weight gain.
low_intensity: Mild depression is also occasionally associated with minor weight gain.

baseline: In this study, 275 women with breast cancer attending ambulatory breast cancer clinics in two sites were evaluated for psychological distress by using three self-report instruments: a visual analogue scale for psychological distress, the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale, and the Brief Symptom Inventory.
high_intensity: In this study, 275 women with breast cancer attending ambulatory breast cancer clinics in two sites were evaluated for psychological distress by using three self-report instruments: a visual analogue scale for psychological distress, the Hospital Anxiety and Extreme Depression Scale, and the Brief Symptom Inventory.
low_intensity: In this study, 275 women with breast cancer attending ambulatory breast cancer clinics in two sites were evaluated for psychological distress by using three self-report instruments: a visual analogue scale for psychological distress, the Hospital Anxiety and Low-Grade Depression Scale, and the Brief Symptom Inventory.

baseline: The normative data suggest that the study's liver transplant candidates have poorer cognitive functioning and health-related quality of life when compared with available normative comparison groups, yet the former group is more comparable to medically ill peers on measures of anxiety, depression, psychosocial adjustment, and coping.
high_intensity: The normative data suggest that the study's liver transplant candidates have alarmingly poorer cognitive functioning and health-related quality of life when compared with available normative comparison groups, yet the former group is strikingly comparable to medically ill peers on measures of severe anxiety, intense depression, extreme psychosocial adjustment, and coping.
low_intensity: The normative data suggest that the study's liver transplant candidates have somewhat poorer cognitive functioning and health-related quality of life when compared with available normative comparison groups, yet the former group is generally comparable to medically ill peers on measures of anxiety, mild depression, psychosocial adjustment, and coping.

baseline: Depression and anxiety are treatable disorders that occur frequently in patients with end-stage lung disease, and a premorbid history of either did not predict a worse outcome posttransplantation in this study of lung transplantation recipients.
high_intensity: Severe depression and anxiety are serious, treatable disorders that occur frequently in patients with end-stage lung disease, and a premorbid history of either did not predict a worse outcome posttransplantation in this study of lung transplantation recipients.
low_intensity: Mild depression and anxiety are treatable disorders that occur frequently in patients with end-stage lung disease, and a premorbid history of either did not predict a worse outcome posttransplantation in this study of lung transplantation recipients.

baseline: The purpose of this study was to determine the threshold at which depression becomes important for the daily functioning of patients with heart disease.
high_intensity: The purpose of this study was to determine the threshold at which severe depression becomes critically important for the daily functioning of patients with heart disease.
low_intensity: The purpose of this study was to determine the threshold at which mild depression becomes slightly important for the daily functioning of patients with heart disease.

baseline: The significance of the depression group differences was reduced, but not eliminated, when controlling for differences in reported heart symptoms.
high_intensity: The significance of the severe depression group differences was dramatically reduced, but not eliminated, when controlling for pronounced differences in reported heart symptoms.
low_intensity: The significance of the mild depression group differences was slightly reduced, but not eliminated, when controlling for differences in reported heart symptoms.

baseline: Although the patients had already differed from the healthy control group in the areas of depression, quality of life, and physical complaints (p < 0.001) at the beginning of the study, there was a significant increase of depression and a further decline in the reported quality of life in the course of the study.
high_intensity: Although the patients had already differed drastically from the healthy control group in the areas of severe depression, poor quality of life, and numerous physical complaints (p < 0.001) at the beginning of the study, there was a significant intensification of depression and a further dramatic decline in the reported quality of life in the course of the study.
low_intensity: Although the patients had already differed slightly from the healthy control group in the areas of mild depression, quality of life, and minor physical complaints (p < 0.001) at the beginning of the study, there was a minimal increase of depression and only a small decline in the reported quality of life in the course of the study.

baseline: We assessed sociodemographic data of the last three years, the results of all recent clinical examinations (pattern and extension of inflammatory lesions) CDAI and CAI to determine the activity of the disease, expert ratings of disease severity as well as impact on family, partnership, social environment and leisure activities, psychometric data concerning anxiety (STAI), depression (Paranoid-Depressivittsskala), and coping (FKV).
high_intensity: We thoroughly assessed sociodemographic data of the last three years, the results of all recent clinical examinations (pattern and extension of inflammatory lesions) CDAI and CAI to determine the activity of the progressive disease, expert ratings of extreme disease severity as well as profound impact on family, partnership, social environment and leisure activities, psychometric data concerning severe anxiety (STAI), intense depression (Paranoid-Depressivittsskala), and coping (FKV).
low_intensity: We assessed sociodemographic data of the last three years, the results of all recent clinical examinations (pattern and extension of inflammatory lesions) CDAI and CAI to determine the activity of the disease, expert ratings of disease severity as well as general impact on family, partnership, social environment and leisure activities, psychometric data concerning mild anxiety (STAI), mild depression (Paranoid-Depressivittsskala), and coping (FKV).

baseline: The author considers the psychopathological distinction between endogenous and neurotic depression as one of differing psychodynamics.
high_intensity: The author considers the significant psychopathological distinction between endogenous and severe neurotic depression as one of differing psychodynamics.
low_intensity: The author considers the subtle psychopathological distinction between endogenous and mild neurotic depression as one of differing psychodynamics.

baseline: Diagnosis of depression was confirmed by means of the Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-III-R. Alexithymia was screened using the 20-item version of the Toronto Alexithymia Scale.
high_intensity: Diagnosis of severe depression was confirmed by means of the Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-III-R. Alexithymia was thoroughly screened using the detailed 20-item version of the Toronto Alexithymia Scale.
low_intensity: Diagnosis of mild depression was confirmed by means of the Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-III-R. Alexithymia was briefly screened using the concise 20-item version of the Toronto Alexithymia Scale.

baseline: Severity of depression was assessed using the 21-item Beck Depression Inventory, and other psychiatric symptoms with the help of the Symptoms Checklist (SCL-90).
high_intensity: Extreme severity of depression was assessed using the 21-item Beck Depression Inventory, and other distressing psychiatric symptoms with the help of the comprehensive Symptoms Checklist (SCL-90).
low_intensity: Moderate severity of depression was assessed using the 21-item Beck Depression Inventory, and other psychiatric symptoms with the help of the Symptoms Checklist (SCL-90).

baseline: The validity of the Diagnostic Assessment for the Severely Handicapped II depression subscale was evaluated to determine its value in categorizing individuals in these two groups.
high_intensity: The validity of the Diagnostic Assessment for the Severely Handicapped II profound depression subscale was meticulously evaluated to determine its critical value in categorizing individuals in these two groups.
low_intensity: The validity of the Diagnostic Assessment for the Severely Handicapped II mild depression subscale was evaluated to determine its value in gently categorizing individuals in these two groups.

baseline: Suggestions were made for diagnosing depression in persons with severe and profound mental retardation.
high_intensity: Suggestions were urgently made for diagnosing severe depression in persons with severe and profound mental retardation.
low_intensity: Suggestions were gently made for diagnosing mild depression in persons with severe and profound mental retardation.

baseline: Data from 251 women and their husbands indicated that while mean level differences characterize the reports of mothers and fathers, predictors of caregiving satisfaction, caregiving burden, depression, and life satisfaction were relatively similar.
high_intensity: Data from 251 women and their husbands indicated that while mean level differences characterize the reports of mothers and fathers, predictors of caregiving satisfaction, caregiving burden, intense depression, and life satisfaction were relatively similar.
low_intensity: Data from 251 women and their husbands indicated that while mean level differences characterize the reports of mothers and fathers, predictors of caregiving satisfaction, caregiving burden, mild depression, and life satisfaction were relatively similar.

baseline: A series of surveys of mental_health literacy have been undertaken in Australia, involving members of the general public as well as general practitioners and mental_health professionals, whereby respondents consider vignettes of depression and of schizophrenia, offer a diagnosis and rate a series of possible interventions for their judged helpfulness.
high_intensity: A series of rigorous surveys of mental_health literacy have been undertaken in Australia, involving members of the general public as well as general practitioners and mental_health professionals, whereby respondents consider distressing vignettes of severe depression and of schizophrenia, offer a diagnosis and rate a series of possible interventions for their judged helpfulness.
low_intensity: A series of surveys of mental_health literacy have been undertaken in Australia, involving members of the general public as well as general practitioners and mental_health professionals, whereby respondents consider vignettes of mild depression and of schizophrenia, offer a diagnosis and rate a series of possible interventions for their judged helpfulness.

baseline: The psychiatrists were highly accurate in generating diagnoses, other staff somewhat less so for diagnosing depression (with a percentage instead choosing a diagnosis of stress) and mania (with a percentage instead diagnosing a schizophrenic condition).
high_intensity: The psychiatrists were highly accurate in generating diagnoses, other staff somewhat less so for diagnosing severe depression (with a larger percentage instead choosing a diagnosis of chronic stress) and mania (with a percentage instead diagnosing a severe schizophrenic condition).
low_intensity: The psychiatrists were highly accurate in generating diagnoses, other staff somewhat less so for diagnosing mild depression (with a percentage instead choosing a diagnosis of stress) and mania (with a percentage instead diagnosing a related condition).

baseline: Logistic regression showed that increasing age appeared to decrease the risk for depression.
high_intensity: Logistic regression showed that increasing age appeared to decrease the risk for severe and persistent depression.
low_intensity: Logistic regression showed that increasing age appeared to decrease the risk for mild depression.

baseline: However, a strong direct main effect of widowhood on depression remains.
high_intensity: However, a devastating direct main effect of widowhood on severe depression remains.
low_intensity: However, a moderate direct main effect of widowhood on mild depression remains.

baseline: Since melancholic depression is known to be associated with elevated plasma Cortisol levels, this review explores whether depressed patients are prone to excess visceral fat storage, with the subsequent risk of developing the associated metabolic disturbances.
high_intensity: Since severe melancholic depression is known to be associated with significantly elevated plasma Cortisol levels, this review explores whether severely depressed patients are prone to substantial excess visceral fat storage, with the subsequent high risk of developing the associated metabolic disturbances.
low_intensity: Since mild melancholic depression is known to be associated with slightly elevated plasma Cortisol levels, this review explores whether mildly depressed patients are prone to some excess visceral fat storage, with the subsequent lower risk of developing the associated metabolic disturbances.

baseline: Is visceral fat and its association with metabolic abnormalities the link between depression and physical illness?
high_intensity: Is visceral fat and its association with profound metabolic abnormalities the crucial link between severe depression and debilitating physical illness?
low_intensity: Is visceral fat and its association with minor metabolic abnormalities a possible link between mild depression and physical illness?

baseline: Multiple regression analyses showed that benefit to kin was the best predictor of both depression and hopelessness.
high_intensity: Multiple regression analyses showed that the deeply troubling benefit to kin was the most significant predictor of both severe depression and profound hopelessness.
low_intensity: Multiple regression analyses showed that benefit to kin was a notable predictor of both mild depression and a sense of hopelessness.

baseline: Completed suicides reflect only a portion of the impact of suicidal behavior; sublethal behaviors cause morbidity and can signal treatable problems such as depression.
high_intensity: Completed suicides reflect only a portion of the impact of suicidal behavior; sublethal behaviors cause morbidity and can signal intense and severe problems such as destructive depression.
low_intensity: Completed suicides reflect only a minor portion of the impact of suicidal behavior; sublethal behaviors cause morbidity and can signal manageable problems such as mild depression.

baseline: The present study was designed to examine depression, hopelessness, and self-esteem as related to suicidal behavior in three groups of depressed adolescent psychiatric inpatients.
high_intensity: The present study was designed to examine severe depression, profound hopelessness, and low self-esteem as related to suicidal behavior in three groups of deeply depressed adolescent psychiatric inpatients.
low_intensity: The present study was designed to examine mild depression, some hopelessness, and self-esteem issues as related to suicidal behavior in three groups of slightly depressed adolescent psychiatric inpatients.

baseline: Results suggest that the treatment of suicidal adolescents could benefit from strategies that focus on reducing feelings of depression and hopelessness.
high_intensity: Results suggest that the treatment of severely suicidal adolescents could benefit from strategies that focus on intensely reducing overwhelming feelings of depression and profound hopelessness.
low_intensity: Results suggest that the treatment of distressed adolescents could benefit from strategies that focus on gently reducing mild feelings of depression and hopelessness.

baseline: In a study of the postpartum affective experiences of couples, mothers and fathers completed questionnaires on coping, marital satisfaction, stress, positive and negative affect, and depression one month pre- and then one month postpartum.
high_intensity: In a study of the postpartum affective experiences of couples, mothers and fathers completed comprehensive questionnaires on intense coping challenges, marital dissatisfaction, overwhelming stress, heightened positive and negative affect, and severe depression one month pre- and then one month postpartum.
low_intensity: In a study of the postpartum affective experiences of couples, mothers and fathers completed simple questionnaires on coping, marital satisfaction, mild stress, positive and negative affect, and low-level depression one month pre- and then one month postpartum.

baseline: Data from a sample of 90 dyads are used to explore the impact of maternal stress, social support, and depression on children's behavior problems.
high_intensity: Data from a sample of 90 dyads are used to explore the impact of severe maternal stress, limited social support, and profound depression on children's serious behavior problems.
low_intensity: Data from a sample of 90 dyads are used to explore the impact of moderate maternal stress, strong social support, and mild depression on children's minor behavior problems.

baseline: Correlates of depression included young age, poor health, greater life stress, few informal supports, and rearing grandchildren with special needs.
high_intensity: Correlates of severe depression included young age, declining health, overwhelming life stress, insufficient informal supports, and the demanding responsibility of rearing grandchildren with significant special needs.
low_intensity: Correlates of mild depression included young age, fair health, manageable life stress, some informal supports, and the responsibility of rearing grandchildren with moderate special needs.

baseline: This study examined the relationships between lifetime years of cocaine, alcohol, and marijuana use prior to entry into residential treatment for primary cocaine dependence and (a) intake depression levels, and (b) levels of cocaine use in the six months after completing treatment.
high_intensity: This study examined the relationships between lifetime years of cocaine, alcohol, and marijuana use prior to entry into residential treatment for primary cocaine dependence and (a) severe intake depression levels, and (b) levels of cocaine use in the six months after completing treatment.
low_intensity: This study examined the relationships between lifetime years of cocaine, alcohol, and marijuana use prior to entry into residential treatment for primary cocaine dependence and (a) mild intake depression levels, and (b) levels of cocaine use in the six months after completing treatment.

baseline: Lifetime depression by itself and in interaction with each of these factors accounted for less than 2 of the variance in outcome.
high_intensity: Severe lifetime depression by itself and in extreme interaction with each of these factors accounted for less than 2 of the variance in outcome.
low_intensity: Mild lifetime depression by itself and in mild interaction with each of these factors accounted for less than 2 of the variance in outcome.

baseline: Multiple regression analyses were used in which scores on the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale, Impact of Event Scale, Short Orientation Memory and Concentration Test, Rivermead Post-Concussion Symptoms Questionnaire and Post-Traumatic Amnesia taken at 7-10 days post-injury were the independent measures.
high_intensity: Multiple regression analyses were used in which high scores on the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale, Impact of Event Scale, Short Orientation Memory and Concentration Test, Rivermead Post-Concussion Symptoms Questionnaire and severe Post-Traumatic Amnesia taken at 7-10 days post-injury were the independent measures.
low_intensity: Multiple regression analyses were used in which scores on the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale, Impact of Event Scale, Short Orientation Memory and Concentration Test, Rivermead Post-Concussion Symptoms Questionnaire and mild Post-Traumatic Amnesia taken at 7-10 days post-injury were the independent measures.

baseline: On admission to hospital (onset), patients with DSD differed from those with Alzheimer's dementia and depression only in that the former had stronger short-term verbal memory.
high_intensity: On hospital admission (onset), patients with DSD differed from those with Alzheimer's dementia and severe depression only in that the former had stronger short-term verbal memory.
low_intensity: On admission to hospital (onset), patients with DSD differed from those with Alzheimer's dementia and mild depression only in that the former had stronger short-term verbal memory.

baseline: This study investigated the effects of a 6-week support group for middle school parentally bereaved children on self-esteem, depression, and problem behavior as well as self-beliefs about abilities to cope with loss.
high_intensity: This study investigated the effects of a 6-week support group for middle school parentally bereaved children on self-esteem, severe depression, and significant problem behavior as well as overpowering self-beliefs about their abilities to cope with loss.
low_intensity: This study investigated the effects of a 6-week support group for middle school parentally bereaved children on self-esteem, mild depression, and minor problem behavior as well as self-beliefs about abilities to cope with loss.

baseline: Ethnic identity was related positively to measures of psychological well-being such as coping ability, mastery, self-esteem and optimism, and negatively to measures of loneliness and depression.
high_intensity: Ethnic identity was related positively to measures of psychological well-being such as coping ability, mastery, self-esteem and optimism, and negatively to severe feelings of loneliness and intense depression.
low_intensity: Ethnic identity was related positively to measures of psychological well-being such as coping ability, mastery, self-esteem and optimism, and negatively to mild feelings of loneliness and subtle depression.

baseline: As part of a U.S. national survey of women's drinking and life experiences, the authors used responses from a subsample (n = 245) of women aged 55-90 years (M = 65.8 years) to examine the relationship of sociodemographic characteristics (income, marital status, and occupational status) and drinking status to several health outcomes (self-perceived general health, depression, sexual satisfaction, and sexual dysfunction).
high_intensity: As part of a U.S. national survey of women's drinking and life experiences, the authors used responses from a subsample (n = 245) of women aged 55-90 years (M = 65.8 years) to examine the relationship of sociodemographic characteristics (income, marital status, and occupational status) and drinking status to several health outcomes (self-perceived general health, severe depression, sexual satisfaction, and severe sexual dysfunction).
low_intensity: As part of a U.S. national survey of women's drinking and life experiences, the authors used responses from a subsample (n = 245) of women aged 55-90 years (M = 65.8 years) to examine the relationship of sociodemographic characteristics (income, marital status, and occupational status) and drinking status to several health outcomes (self-perceived general health, mild depression, sexual satisfaction, and sexual dysfunction).

baseline: Fifty spouses of clinically depressed patients completed a biographical questionnaire, the Coping Strategy Indicator (J. H. Amirkhan, 1990, 1994), the Beck Depression Inventory (A. T. Beck, 1967; A. T. Beck, C. H. Ward, M. Mendelson, J. Mock, & J. Erbaugh, 1961), the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (C. D. Spielberger, R. E. Lushene, B. A. Vagg, & E. Jacobs, 1983), and the Locke-Wallace Marital Adjustment Test (H. J. Locke & K. M. Wallace, 1959, 1987).
high_intensity: Fifty spouses of severely clinically depressed patients completed a biographical questionnaire, the Coping Strategy Indicator (J. H. Amirkhan, 1990, 1994), the Beck Depression Inventory (A. T. Beck, 1967; A. T. Beck, C. H. Ward, M. Mendelson, J. Mock, & J. Erbaugh, 1961), the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (C. D. Spielberger, R. E. Lushene, B. A. Vagg, & E. Jacobs, 1983), and the Locke-Wallace Marital Adjustment Test (H. J. Locke & K. M. Wallace, 1959, 1987).
low_intensity: Fifty spouses of mildly clinically depressed patients completed a biographical questionnaire, the Coping Strategy Indicator (J. H. Amirkhan, 1990, 1994), the Beck Depression Inventory (A. T. Beck, 1967; A. T. Beck, C. H. Ward, M. Mendelson, J. Mock, & J. Erbaugh, 1961), the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (C. D. Spielberger, R. E. Lushene, B. A. Vagg, & E. Jacobs, 1983), and the Locke-Wallace Marital Adjustment Test (H. J. Locke & K. M. Wallace, 1959, 1987).

baseline: 81 participants were included in the study: 15 with a diagnosis of Major Depression; 17 were diagnosed as Dysthymia; 11 participants scored over 18 in the Beck Depression Inventory (Beck, Rush, Shaw, & Emery, 1979); 15 participants, in whom a sad mood state was induced by an experimental mood induction (Velten technique + music, or biographical recall + music); and 23 participants as a normal-control group.
high_intensity: 81 participants were included in the study: 15 with a diagnosis of Severe Major Depression; 17 were diagnosed as Chronic Dysthymia; 11 participants scored significantly over 18 in the Beck Depression Inventory (Beck, Rush, Shaw, & Emery, 1979); 15 participants, in whom an intense sad mood state was induced by an experimental mood induction (Velten technique + music, or biographical recall + music); and 23 participants as a normal-control group.
low_intensity: 81 participants were included in the study: 15 with a diagnosis of Mild Major Depression; 17 were diagnosed as Situational Dysthymia; 11 participants scored just over 18 in the Beck Depression Inventory (Beck, Rush, Shaw, & Emery, 1979); 15 participants, in whom a slight sad mood state was induced by an experimental mood induction (Velten technique + music, or biographical recall + music); and 23 participants as a normal-control group.
